title: Sada Systems, Under New Owner, to Stay in NoHo
summary: Cloud services provider Sada Systems Inc. has been acquired by Insight Enterprises Inc. for $410 million. Sada, a major Google Cloud Platform partner with 850 employees, will remain headquartered in North Hollywood and operate as a separate entity under Insight, doing business as Sada, An Insight Company. This acquisition is expected to boost Insight's cloud and digital services profits and expand its service-delivery capabilities, particularly in areas like generative AI.

title: Inflection AI Announces $1.3 Billion of Funding Led by Current Investors, Microsoft, and NVIDIA
summary: Inflection AI announced a $1.3 billion funding round led by Microsoft, Reid Hoffman, Bill Gates, Eric Schmidt, and NVIDIA, bringing its total raised to $1.525 billion. The funding will support the company's work on Pi, a personal AI designed for natural text and voice conversations. Inflection AI is also building the world's largest AI cluster with 22,000 NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs in partnership with CoreWeave and NVIDIA.

title: Sophia Velastegui
summary: Sophia Velastegui is Senior Vice President and Chief Product Officer of Aptiv, an automotive and autonomous tech company, where she drives innovation and growth. She previously held significant roles at Microsoft, Google/Alphabet, Apple, and Applied Materials, and is recognized for her board directorships and contributions to AI and emerging technologies. Velastegui is an award-winning engineer with degrees from Georgia Tech and UC Berkeley, and has furthered her corporate governance expertise at Stanford Law and Harvard Business School.

title: DocuSign layoff announcement comes as tech layoffs continue to rack the industry
summary: DocuSign announced a new round of layoffs, affecting 10% of its staff, or approximately 700 employees, primarily in its field organization. This decision follows a 9% staff reduction in September and aims to position the company for profitable growth and free up resources for investments. These layoffs are part of a broader trend of continued job cuts across the tech industry, with other major companies like Google, Meta, and Amazon also announcing reductions.

title: Qualcomm, Iridium Take Aim at Satellite-to-Mobile Phone Market
summary: Qualcomm and Iridium Communications are collaborating to introduce technology enabling satellite messaging for smartphone users in areas without cellular service. This partnership will initially offer a satellite-based emergency service for Android devices equipped with Qualcomm's premium chips. The move aims to bring satellite connectivity to a broader market, similar to the feature available on newer iPhones.

title: 2024 Generative AI Planning: How are IT Organizations Preparing?
summary: A Gartner Peer Community report from August 2023 surveyed 125 IT leaders on their organizations' Generative AI (GenAI) planning for 2024. Key findings indicate that most IT organizations are still in the research phase, with nearly half of those planning adoption starting with internal use cases. A significant majority expect their GenAI strategy to change and anticipate increased spending in 2024, often relying on vendors for implementation, particularly in customer service, resource automation, and software development.

title: Capital One Job Cuts Signal Trouble for IT Labor Market
summary: Capital One Financial Corp. has cut 1,100 positions within its technology department, specifically impacting its "agile" group. This move signals a potential spread of tech sector layoffs into corporate IT departments, which had previously been largely insulated. The job cuts reflect companies' belt-tightening measures amidst fears of a recession.

title: How Much Longer Can US Stocks Keep Beating The World?
summary: US stocks have outperformed global markets for nearly 14 years, a period attributed to tech giants and resulting in higher valuations compared to other developed economies. The article questions the sustainability of this dominance and suggests ETFs for investors who anticipate a shift, allowing exposure to non-US developed markets.

title: Current Cathie Wood Portfolio 2023
summary: This article details Cathie Wood's investment philosophy, focusing on innovative technology and disruptive business models. It provides a comprehensive list of ARK Invest's stock holdings as of December 31, 2022, including company name, security type, CUSIP, value in USD, and shares held. The article also touches upon the performance of her flagship ARK Innovation ETF and personal details about Cathie Wood.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff says San Francisco cleaned up its troubled downtown after he pressured City Hall
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff stated that San Francisco officials cleaned up the city's downtown in response to his pressure, ahead of the company's annual Dreamforce conference. Benioff had previously warned that the conference might leave the city due to concerns about homelessness and drug use. While happy with the short-term improvements, Benioff emphasized that more work is needed to address ongoing issues like homelessness and public safety for Dreamforce to consistently remain in San Francisco.

title: Big Tech Expects Some Assets to Last Longer. But the Boost to Profit Is Temporary.
summary: A growing number of tech companies, including Alphabet, IBM, and Akamai Technologies, are extending the estimated working lives of their servers and network equipment. This accounting change reflects a slower pace of chip development and temporarily boosts profits by cutting costs at a challenging time for the industry. Other major tech firms like Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Oracle, and Amazon.com have also revised these estimates since 2022.

title: The Cheap Trick Alphabet Is Using To Boost Its Share Price
summary: Alphabet's 20-for-1 stock split, following similar moves by Apple and Tesla, is unlikely to fundamentally change the company's valuation but aims to make shares more accessible to smaller investors and potentially gain entry into the Dow Jones Industrial Average. While some tech giants saw significant share price boosts post-split, Alphabet's future success might be tempered by changing market conditions. The article suggests Amazon could be the next tech giant to undertake a similar split to boost its stock.

title: T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF): A Promising Active Fund
summary: The T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF) has shown significant growth since its launch in June 2023, accumulating over $600 million in assets. The fund focuses on high-quality U.S. large-cap companies, employing a bottom-up stock selection approach with top holdings like Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon. TCAF's investment philosophy emphasizes strong performance in areas like technology, healthcare, and consumer discretionary.

title: The Best Artificial Intelligence ETFs of 2023
summary: The article highlights the top-performing Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETFs of 2023, with returns as high as 71%. It details five specific AI ETFs, including thematic funds that invest in companies benefiting from AI growth and AI-powered funds that use AI to select stocks, identifying key holdings and year-to-date performance for each.

title: Google, AES, others to create marketplace for 24/7 hourly renewable energy certificates
summary: Google, AES, Microsoft, and Constellation have partnered with LevelTen Energy to create a marketplace for "granular certificates," a new type of energy attribute certificate that tracks renewable energy generation on an hourly, location-specific basis. This initiative aims to provide more accurate signals for renewable energy development and help corporate and utility buyers meet 24/7 clean energy goals. The platform is expected to launch next year, offering both forward and spot markets for these certificates.

title: BCE Inc. stock falls Monday, underperforms market
summary: BCE Inc. (BCE) stock experienced a drop of 0.65% on Monday, closing at C$54.84, thereby underperforming the broader Canadian market. The S&P/TSX Composite Index fell by only 0.06%. The company's stock is C$10.82 short of its 52-week high, and trading volume for the day significantly exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Just 3 of the "Magnificent Seven" Have Outperformed the S&P 500 Since 2022. Here's the One I'd Buy for 2024 and 2025.
summary: This article analyzes the performance of the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks against the S&P 500 since 2022. It identifies Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple as the only three that have outperformed the S&P 500. The author argues that Alphabet, despite underperforming recently, is the best buy for 2024 and 2025 due to its valuation, potential in digital advertising, and cloud segment growth.

title: Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting 2023
summary: The 2023 Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting featured discussions on record financial results for FY23, strategic investments in AI, and responsible technology development. Key executives, including Satya Nadella, Amy Hood, and Brad Smith, addressed topics ranging from AI integration across product lines and revenue generation plans to safeguards against AI misuse, partnerships, and commitments to privacy and social responsibility. The meeting also covered the election of directors and various shareholder proposals.

title: Celestica stock rides another tech wave – but can it avoid a crash this time?
summary: Celestica Inc., a Toronto-based manufacturer, is experiencing a resurgence due to the AI boom, supplying equipment to data centers for major tech companies like Amazon, Google, and Meta. Despite a significant increase in stock price and revenue, questions remain about the sustainability of this growth compared to the company's past crash during the dot-com era. CEO Rob Mionis argues that Celestica is a more diversified and insulated company now, focusing on higher-margin, complex equipment and seeing sustained demand in the early stages of AI development.

title: Which Stocks Capture the AI Healthcare Revolution?
summary: The healthcare industry is poised for significant growth driven by AI, despite recent underperformance in health tech stocks. Experts like Vinay Thapar of Alliance Bernstein and Bessemer Venture Partners foresee AI transforming R&D, clinical trials, commercial development, and diagnostics, with market forecasts predicting a CAGR of over 35% for AI in healthcare. Investors can gain exposure through individual stocks like Veeva Systems, ICON, and Alphabet, or diversified ETFs like the Goldman Sachs Future Health Care Equity ETF.

title: AI ETFs see huge performance dispersion in 2023
summary: Artificial Intelligence ETFs have shown significant performance dispersion in 2023, with top strategies more than doubling the returns of the lowest performers. This disparity is largely attributed to the heavy weighting of certain ETFs towards US equities and the "magnificent seven" tech stocks. While these mega-cap companies have driven much of the AI theme's returns, there is still potential for pure-play AI companies to join the rally.

title: Gartner Hype Cycle Shows AI Practices and Platform Engineering Will Reach Mainstream Adoption in Software Engineering in Two to Five Years
summary: Gartner's Hype Cycle for Software Engineering 2023 indicates that AI-augmented software engineering, AI coding assistants, and platform engineering will achieve mainstream adoption within two to five years. By 2027, 50% of enterprise software engineers are expected to utilize machine learning-powered coding tools, significantly boosting productivity and allowing focus on higher-value tasks. Platform engineering is also highlighted as crucial for managing technological complexity, with 80% of software engineering organizations projected to establish platform teams by 2026.

title: 3 Compelling Cloud Storage Stocks to Send Your Portfolio Higher
summary: This article identifies three compelling cloud storage stocks: Alphabet (GOOGL), Dropbox (DBX), and Shopify (SHOP). It highlights Alphabet's strong Google Cloud growth and its dominant Google Services. Dropbox is discussed for its collaboration with Nvidia on generative AI and its potential to convert a large base of free users to paying subscribers. Shopify is included not as a pure-play cloud storage company, but because its successful e-commerce platform relies heavily on Google Cloud infrastructure and its recent financial performance has been strong.

title: Nova, MACOM, KLA Corporation, Lam Research, and Monolithic Power Systems Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Several semiconductor and analog semiconductor stocks, including Nova, MACOM, KLA Corporation, Lam Research, and Monolithic Power Systems, experienced significant jumps in their stock prices. This rally was fueled by renewed enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, particularly after Alphabet announced its upgraded Gemini 3 AI model, and positive sentiment from the New York Fed regarding a potential December interest rate cut. The article also provides a specific focus on Nova's recent stock performance and market context.

title: Which Cloud Stocks are Benefitting from the AI Boom?
summary: While cloud computing is fundamental to AI, some cloud-focused funds have underperformed despite the AI rally, suggesting a potential future bounce. The global cloud infrastructure market is dominated by Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, who are heavily investing in capacity and partnerships for generative AI. These "Magnificent Seven" companies have shown significant gains driven by the AI boom, indicating that the benefits of the AI-cloud synergy are largely accruing to the major infrastructure providers.

title: Which Cloud Stocks are Benefitting from the AI Boom?
summary: Despite cloud computing being fundamental to AI programs, some cloud funds, like WisdomTree’s Cloud Computing Fund, have not fully capitalized on the AI rally. This article explores why emerging cloud stocks have lagged, highlighting that the primary beneficiaries are the major cloud infrastructure providers such as Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, which are part of the "Magnificent Seven" and have seen significant gains. It also discusses how these cloud leaders are preparing for future demands from generative AI and quantum computing through increased capital expenditure and strategic partnerships.

title: First Pacific Advisors LLC Reduces Stake in Alphabet
summary: First Pacific Advisors LLC, managed by Richard Atwood, reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class C (GOOG) by 95,179 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates GOOG as "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance, growth in AI and cloud services, and solid balance sheet, despite a high valuation. The article also provides key financial metrics for Alphabet.

title: FAANG Gives Way to the ‘Magnificent Seven’
summary: The "FAANG" stock group has evolved into the "Magnificent Seven," with Netflix replaced by Nvidia, and Microsoft and Tesla added to the mix of top U.S. market names. ETF issuers are beginning to launch products specifically targeting these seven stocks, while existing ETFs like the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) already hold significant concentrations of them. Investors have various options, from highly concentrated ETFs to diversified funds, to gain exposure to these influential companies.

title: 10월 하락장 맞춘 AI ETF…엔비디아보다 '이것' 담았다 [글로벌마켓나우 플러스]
summary: LG AI연구원과 인공지능 전문 자산운용사 크래프트 테크놀로지스가 협력하여 'LG 크래프트 AI 파워드 US 라지캡 코어 상장지수펀드'(LQAI ETF)를 뉴욕증권거래소에 상장했습니다. 이 ETF는 엔비디아보다 구글과 마이크로소프트 비중을 높이고, 크래프트 테크놀로지스의 AI 위험 예측 지표를 통해 10월 하락장과 11월 초 반등을 예측하는 정확도를 보였습니다. 내년 시장 전망에서는 넷플릭스를 최선호 종목으로 꼽고, 기술주와 헬스케어 비중을 높이며 부동산 섹터는 편입하지 않고 있습니다.

title: Diamond Hill Capital Reduces Stake in Alphabet Inc.
summary: Diamond Hill Capital Management Inc. reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class A (GOOGL) by 8,431 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates GOOGL as "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance and strategic investments in AI and cloud services, despite risks from high valuation and increased costs. Alphabet Inc. Class A has shown a YTD price performance of 50.68% and has a current market cap of $3351.9B.

title: Diamond Hill Capital Reduces Stake in Alphabet Inc.
summary: Diamond Hill Capital Management Inc., managed by Ric Dillon, has reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class A (GOOGL) by selling 8,431 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates GOOGL as "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance and strategic investments, despite risks like high valuation. The article also provides key financial metrics for Alphabet Inc. Class A.

title: Bilibili Announces Most Popular Scientific Topics of 2023 among China's Young Generations
summary: Bilibili announced the "2023 Top 5 Most Popular Scientific Topics on Bilibili" among young Chinese generations, including AIGC, room-temperature superconductors, brain-computer interfaces, black holes, and controllable nuclear fusion. The platform hosted a "Super Science Night" event featuring renowned scientists and Bilibili creators to engage young audiences with science. Science and knowledge-related content is the second most searched category on Bilibili, accounting for 41% of total viewing time, with over 243 million users viewing such content in the past year.

title: Sonos v. Google : A Decision Based on Ignorance of Patent Law That Must Be Overturned
summary: This article argues that a district court's decision in the Sonos v. Google patent litigation, which found Sonos's patents unenforceable due to laches because Sonos filed a continuation, demonstrates a fundamental misunderstanding of patent law. The author asserts that filing a continuation is a right and that the ruling, which also controversially suggested "fraud on the court" and "new matter," is legally unsound and must be overturned by the Federal Circuit to prevent significant disruption to patent practice. The piece also highlights the perceived double standard where patent owner delays are sanctioned, but alleged "efficient infringement" strategies by well-funded defendants are not.

title: Shoot, Don’t Kill
summary: Byrna Technologies, a less-lethal weapon manufacturer, is attempting to create a market for "less lethal" guns for self-defense amidst a polarized American gun culture. Their devices use compressed gas to launch non-lethal projectiles, offering an alternative to traditional firearms. Despite challenges in marketing and operational scaling, Byrna aims to appeal to a broad consumer base by highlighting their products as safe and unregulated alternatives for self-defense.

title: Microsoft Edged Out Its Cloud Computing Competitors in Q3
summary: Microsoft's cloud computing service, Azure, reported 29% growth in Q3, outperforming competitors Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services, largely due to strong demand for its AI capabilities. The article suggests inverse ETFs like MSFU, CLDL, and UBOT for traders looking to capitalize on Microsoft's continued competitiveness in cloud computing and the growth potential of AI. Microsoft's significant investment in OpenAI contributed to a 13% revenue jump, highlighting its strategic focus on integrating AI across its technology stack.

title: Top 10 Cloud Security Companies
summary: The cloud-managed services market is projected to reach US$164 billion by 2027, driven by increasing enterprise demand and a lack of IT expertise, while cloud security is poised for substantial growth to US$170.51 billion by 2032 due to rising cyber threats. This article lists the top 10 cloud security companies in 2023, based on market capitalization, including industry giants like Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon, highlighting their key offerings and recent developments in cloud security. The companies presented offer diverse solutions, from comprehensive cloud platforms and cybersecurity infrastructure to data analytics and application security.

title: Cathie Wood explains how the artificial intelligence boom could propel Ark's Innovation ETF
summary: Cathie Wood believes the artificial intelligence boom could significantly boost Ark Invest's flagship Ark Innovation ETF (ARKK). While the fund has gained 17% this year, Wood emphasized that AI represents a reality, not just a dream, and that its disruptive nature will create new industry leaders. She cautioned investors to be discerning with their AI bets, highlighting Tesla as a key holding while expressing reservations about some other "Magnificent Seven" stocks.

title: Enphase Energy (NASDAQ: ENPH) stock down 22% - higher interest rates kill installations
summary: Enphase Energy (NASDAQ: ENPH) stock dropped 22% due to slowing installations, a trend exacerbated by higher interest rates impacting the attractiveness of high-capital-cost solar energy solutions. The slowdown, following similar results from SolarEdge Technologies, highlights an underlying problem where increased financing costs make solar installations less appealing to buyers, affecting sales and revenues across the sector. This situation is seen as damaging to Enphase's stock price as it undermines previous expectations of swift growth.

title: Ask AI Guru: Genpact turns to generative AI to help employees learn
summary: Genpact, a NYSE-listed professional services company, has rolled out an internal generative AI chatbot called "AI Guru" to enhance employee learning and development. This tool, powered by Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, helps employees with tasks such as IT migration, test case generation, and management advice, and provides 24/7 access to collective expertise from internal "master gurus." The initiative aims to improve employee retention and efficiency by offering personalized and constantly updated learning content, addressing a bottleneck in their traditional learning methods.

title: Stanford’s AI transparency index shows foundational models are shrouded in secrecy
summary: A Stanford University report reveals that most popular foundational AI models from companies like OpenAI, Google, and Meta lack transparency regarding their development and societal impact. Meta's Llama 2 topped the transparency index, while OpenAI's GPT-4 scored lower despite extensive public information from partners, indicating that open-source models generally lead in transparency. The researchers highlight the need for greater disclosure to inform policymakers and foster trust in AI, especially as regulations like the EU's Artificial Intelligence Act emerge.

title: DaVita Collaborates with Google Cloud to Develop Customized Clinical Operating System Designed to Transform Kidney Care
summary: DaVita Inc. and Google Cloud have partnered to develop a new clinical operating system called Center Without Walls (CWOW) to transform kidney care for over 200,000 DaVita patients. This system centralizes clinical documentation and leverages AI and analytics from over 30 million dialysis treatments annually to improve clinical outcomes and streamline workflows. Built on Google Cloud's infrastructure, CWOW aims to enhance data sharing between care teams, physician partners, and hospitals, ultimately improving patient quality of life and lowering care costs.

title: Gartner Identifies the Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2024
summary: Gartner has announced its top 10 strategic technology trends for 2024, emphasizing the need for organizations to act boldly amidst technological disruptions and socioeconomic uncertainties. The trends, presented at Gartner IT Symposium/Xpo 2023, highlight the increasing role of AI, sustainability, and intelligent automation in driving business value and resilience. Key themes include the democratization of Generative AI, AI Trust, Risk and Security Management, AI-Augmented Development, and the emergence of Machine Customers and Industry Cloud Platforms.

title: Citi Maintains Alphabet-A(GOOGL.US) With Buy Rating, Maintains Target Price $280
summary: Citi analyst Ronald Josey has maintained a Buy rating on Alphabet-A (GOOGL.US) and kept the target price at $280. According to TipRanks, the analyst boasts a 60.5% success rate and an average return of 24.6% over the past year. The information is provided for informational purposes and is not investment advice.

title: Generative AI Delivers a Boost to Cloud Computing
summary: Cloud computing companies are experiencing a rebound after a difficult period, driven by improving fundamentals and the increasing importance of generative AI. Spending on cloud computing is projected to rise by nearly 22% in 2023, and cloud providers are capitalizing on this trend by integrating AI-incorporated solutions and monetizing AI-as-a-service. This surge in AI adoption is expected to lead to better-than-expected revenue and profit growth for companies in the cloud computing sector.

title: Palantir: Implications Of The $28B Mega Cisco-Splunk Deal (NYSE:PLTR)
summary: Cisco's $28 billion acquisition of Splunk underscores the increasing value of AI capabilities in the industry, raising questions about potential takeover targets. Palantir Technologies, with its aggressive focus on AI and growth in Business Intelligence, is identified as a possible acquisition candidate. This deal highlights the broader trend of large corporations seeking to acquire advanced AI capabilities for long-term revenue growth.

title: What Market Pros Saw Last Earnings Season That Spurred Investments in Tech and AI Stocks
summary: Market experts, managing over $67 billion, analyzed second-quarter earnings reports and concluded that the bull market has room to run, a U.S. recession is unlikely, consumer spending remains strong, and AI is not in a bubble but rather a significant driver of corporate profits. They identified key sectors and companies benefiting from current growth trends, including broad-market strength beyond AI and Big Tech, and a re-emerging strong momentum in European economies.

title: Expedia Group builds generative AI into multiple products in its “Fall Release”
summary: Expedia Group is unveiling its "Fall Release 2023," introducing numerous features and products for travelers and supplier partners, heavily integrating generative AI. Key updates include AI-powered conversational capabilities within its apps, dynamic travel guides, and "EG Labs" for consumer feedback on new tech. The release also brings influencer content, group trip planning tools, and AI-driven recommendations for hotel partners to enhance performance and guest insights.

title: Communications ETF XLC Offers Loud & Clear Exposure to the Space
summary: The Communication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLC) provides investors with exposure to the growing digital side of the U.S. economy, encompassing communications, media, and technology companies. Launched following a 2018 GICS reclassification, XLC tracks a market-cap-weighted index of U.S. telecom, media, and entertainment components of the S&P 500, with top holdings including Meta Platforms and Alphabet. This ETF offers an accessible and low-cost way to invest in leading digital economy companies.

title: Oracle says it's ready to cater to Canadian banks' open banking needs
summary: Oracle has declared its readiness to support Canadian banks with their open banking requirements, offering technology solutions as Canada implements its framework. Oracle's executive vice president for financial services, Sonny Singh, noted that the company's existing financial products, used globally, are well-positioned for this shift. This comes as Canadian banks are increasingly partnering with fintech firms and Oracle, despite recent market value losses due to strong cloud-computing competition.

title: Morgan Stanley’s AI Assistant Marks New Era For Finance Sector
authors: Q.ai - Powering a Personal Wealth Movement
summary: Morgan Stanley has launched an internal AI assistant, 'AI @ Morgan Stanley Assistant', built on OpenAI's GPT-4 software. This move positions Morgan Stanley as a pioneer among major banks in utilizing generative AI for financial advisors and support staff. While the bank also faces a significant lawsuit, its stock saw a slight increase following the AI announcement, signaling a new era for AI in the finance sector.

title: Manyika appointed to Airbnb board
summary: Google's Research, Technology and Society senior vice-president, James Manyika, a Zimbabwean-born businessman, has been appointed to the board of American online homestay firm, Airbnb Inc., effective immediately. Manyika, an expert in AI and technology's impact on society, will help Airbnb leverage artificial intelligence and joins eight other board members at the US$91.96 billion valued company. His extensive background includes roles at McKinsey & Company, advising the White House, and serving on various influential boards, bringing significant expertise in technology, economy, and global trends to Airbnb.

title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman tells Salesforce’s Marc Benioff that AI ‘hallucinations’ are more feature than bug
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman suggested to Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff that AI "hallucinations" should be seen as a feature, not a bug, emphasizing their creative potential. This discussion took place at the Dreamforce conference where Salesforce rolled out new AI products, integrating with platforms like Google Workspace. Altman's perspective highlights a focus on generative AI's creative capabilities over its strict adherence to factual accuracy.

title: Breakthrough and Enovis (TM) Announce Official Partnership, Empowering Private Practice Healthcare to Help Improve Quality of Care While Increasing Profitability
summary: Breakthrough, a leader in conservative care marketing solutions, and Enovis™ Corporation, a pioneer in innovative rehabilitation technologies, have announced an official partnership. This collaboration aims to empower private practice healthcare providers to improve patient care quality and increase profitability by promoting innovative therapeutic technologies directly to patients through data-driven marketing campaigns. The partnership enables clinics to confidently adopt new technologies, like laser therapy, by offering solutions to overcome declining insurance reimbursements through cash-based services.

title: Andretti special purpose acquisition company to merge with Boston-based AI startup
summary: The blank-check company started by former IndyCar driver Michael Andretti, Andretti Acquisition Corp., is merging with Boston-based artificial intelligence startup Zapata AI. This merger values Zapata at approximately $200 million, with the combined company's equity value projected to be between $281 million and $365 million depending on share redemptions. The transaction is anticipated to close in the first quarter of next year, bringing together Andretti's SPAC with a "generative AI software company" that has roots in quantum computing and focuses on industrial AI solutions.

title: Bandwidth Partners with Google and Cognigy to Launch AIBridge, Integrating Artificial Intelligence with Contact Centers Using Maestro
summary: Bandwidth has announced a partnership with Google and Cognigy to launch AIBridge, a new capability within its Maestro platform. AIBridge enables enterprises to deploy voice-based AI tools to their contact centers, allowing for faster and more efficient call resolution in the communications cloud without direct agent intervention. This integration is designed to improve customer experience, increase agent satisfaction, and significantly reduce contact center operating costs by leveraging conversational AI from partners like Cognigy.AI and Google Cloud's Dialogflow.

title: SAP and Google Cloud Enhance Open Data Cloud With New Generative AI Solutions for Enterprises
summary: SAP and Google Cloud announced an expanded partnership to integrate generative AI solutions within their open data cloud. This collaboration will leverage SAP Datasphere and Google Cloud’s Vertex AI to create industry-specific solutions, starting with automotive, and enhance sustainability performance for enterprises. The partnership aims to provide customers with powerful new tools to improve business insights, analysis, and decision-making through responsible and secure AI deployment.

title: Google Cloud, HCA team up to deploy AI in the emergency department
summary: HCA Healthcare is expanding its partnership with Google Cloud and Augmedix to deploy generative AI tools in emergency departments, aiming to improve documentation efficiency and allow clinicians more time for patient care. Following a successful pilot program in four hospitals, HCA is considering wider implementation of Google's generative AI, and also exploring the use of Google's medical large language model, Med-PaLM 2, for complex medical queries. The initiative focuses on enhancing workflows and caregiver support while acknowledging the need for careful ethical deployment and rigorous quality assessment of AI in healthcare.

title: Ginkgo Bioworks and Google Cloud Partner to Build Next Generation AI Platform for Biological Engineering and Biosecurity
summary: Ginkgo Bioworks and Google Cloud have announced a five-year strategic partnership to develop an AI platform for biological engineering and biosecurity. Ginkgo will leverage Google Cloud's Vertex AI and computational infrastructure to build new large language models across genomics, protein function, and synthetic biology, with Google Cloud providing funding and positioning Ginkgo as a key partner in developing foundation models for life sciences. This collaboration aims to accelerate innovation in areas like drug discovery, agriculture, manufacturing, and biosecurity, and will be discussed further at Google Cloud Next.

title: Hedge fund exposure to 7 biggest tech stocks at record high, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Hedge funds have reached record exposure to the seven largest tech stocks by market capitalization, according to Goldman Sachs data, driven by strong performance and the artificial intelligence theme. These seven stocks, including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, now constitute about 20% of the total net market value held by hedge funds tracked by Goldman Sachs. Despite the concentration risk, investment managers rationalize these allocations due to the significant returns generated by these companies this year.

title: Dropbox review: Still the best at syncing and sharing
summary: This PCWorld review reaffirms Dropbox's position as a top choice for fast, reliable file synchronization and sharing, despite its limited free storage and lack of intermediate subscription tiers. While it excels in its core functionality and offers business-oriented features, its pricing model lacks options between the free 2GB and the paid 2TB. The article highlights its strengths for collaborative file access and its backup capabilities.

title: YieldMax Launches Option Income Strategy ETF on Coinbase
summary: YieldMax has launched the YieldMax COIN Option Income Strategy ETF (CONY) on NYSE Arca, aiming to generate monthly income through a synthetic covered call strategy on Coinbase Global (COIN). This ETF, actively managed by ZEGA Financial, is part of a growing suite of YieldMax option income strategy ETFs focusing on growth companies that may not pay dividends. It provides investors with an opportunity to earn income and potentially protect against downside while gaining exposure to a growth company like Coinbase.

title: Best Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality Stocks In 2023: December List
summary: This article identifies top Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) stocks for 2023, acknowledging the market's slow but potential growth, similar to the early days of smartphones. It emphasizes investing in stable, well-capitalized companies that are involved in AR/VR but do not solely depend on it for revenue, such as Alphabet, Apple, Autodesk, Meta, and Microsoft. The article also highlights the importance of risk management, portfolio diversification, and continuous monitoring of emerging trends in this evolving technological landscape.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 07/30/2023
summary: This article details the top-performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week ending July 30, 2023, highlighting that these funds are high-risk due to leverage. Key performers include China-focused ETFs like Direxion Daily FTSE China Bull 3X Shares (YINN) and Direxion Daily CSI China Internet Index Bull 2x Shares (CWEB), along with those tracking electric vehicles (EVAV) and specific tech giants like Meta (FBL) and Google (GGLL). The performance was driven by factors such as China's policy actions, growth in the EV sector, and strong tech earnings.

title: AI and Data Centers: It’s About Keeping Cool
summary: A report from Citi Research highlights the critical role data centers play in the AI revolution, emphasizing that keeping servers cool will be vital. Despite historical predictions, data center energy use has been largely stable due to efficiency gains, but AI's computational demands are accelerating, making cooling and renewable energy increasingly important for sustainability. The article notes that while AI compute has outpaced Moore's Law, increased scrutiny of carbon emissions will drive higher corporate renewable PPAs.

title: After Earnings, Is Alphabet Stock a Buy, Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar analyzes Alphabet's Q2 earnings, highlighting accelerated search growth, YouTube ad revenue recovery, and cloud service stability. The article maintains its Fair Value Estimate of $161 per share, rating Alphabet's stock as undervalued with a wide economic moat due to intangible assets and network effects, despite high uncertainty related to advertising reliance.

title: YieldMax Launches Synthetic Covered Call ETFs for Meta, Google
summary: YieldMax has introduced two new actively managed ETFs, the YieldMax META Option Income Strategy ETF (FBY) and the YieldMax GOOGL Option Income Strategy ETF (GOOY), designed to generate monthly income through synthetic covered call strategies on Meta and Alphabet stock, respectively. These ETFs, which do not directly invest in the underlying stocks, follow the recent launch of the YieldMax AMZN Option Income Strategy ETF (AMZY) and cater to increasing advisor interest in options-based income strategies. Both new funds carry an expense ratio of 0.99% and are advised by Tidal Financial Group and subadvised by ZEGA Financial.

title: YieldMax Launches Synthetic Covered Call ETFs for Meta, Google
summary: YieldMax has expanded its lineup of actively managed ETFs by launching two new funds that employ a synthetic covered call strategy for Meta Platforms Inc. (META) and Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL). The YieldMax META Option Income Strategy ETF (FBY) and the YieldMax GOOGL Option Income Strategy ETF (GOOY) aim to generate monthly income by selling call options on these tech giants. These new offerings follow the recent introduction of a similar ETF for Amazon (AMZN) and all have an expense ratio of 0.99%.

title: Nasdaq Is Reducing the Influence of Giant Tech Firms in a Popular Stock Market Index
summary: Nasdaq is implementing a "special rebalance" of its Nasdaq 100 index to reduce the dominance of giant tech firms like Apple and Microsoft. This move addresses the historic rally of a few mega-cap tech stocks, which have caused overconcentration in the index and potentially increased diversification risk for investors. The rebalance, effective July 24, will prompt funds tracking the index to adjust their portfolios, potentially leading to trading costs and minor market volatility.

title: Unstructured raises $25M for large language model data processing expansion
summary: Unstructured Technologies Inc. has secured $25 million in new funding to expand its operations for processing data for large language models. Founded by a former CIA analyst, the company provides a platform that converts unstructured internal data into LLM-compatible formats, addressing the challenge of scattered data for organizations. The funding round was led by Bain Capital Venture Associates LLC with participation from several other investors.

title: Caribbean phone companies suffering from “market failure” due to Over-The Top services, Social Media
summary: Caribbean telecommunication companies are experiencing "market failure" due to the prevalent use of Over-The-Top (OTT) services and social media, which consume the majority of data and international call traffic, leading to significant financial losses for local providers. Despite annual investments exceeding US$500 million in network upgrades since 2017, these companies face declining voice revenues and a lack of significant contribution from major tech companies that utilize their infrastructure. Industry leaders are advocating for government intervention and a unified CARICOM approach to address this imbalance and ensure a fair share from big tech, warning of dire consequences for regional connectivity and economic development if the issue remains unresolved.

title: SEC acknowledges bitcoin ETF filings from BlackRock, Bitwise and others
summary: The SEC has formally acknowledged spot bitcoin ETF applications from major asset managers including BlackRock and Bitwise. This move follows a surge of institutional filings, notably spurred by BlackRock's application in June, indicating a significant step forward in the regulatory review process for these financial products. The applications are now officially under review, with various firms looking to leverage this new investment opportunity.

title: Kopin Corp is the Technology Seen Behind Smart AR Glasses
summary: Kopin Corp (NASDAQ: KOPN), a high-resolution microdisplay maker, is highlighted as a key technology provider for smart AR glasses, including supplying displays for Vuzix and Alphabet. Despite an 80% drop from 2021 highs, the company has made significant advancements, such as achieving 3 million nits brightness for its 2K x 2K MicroLED displays, essential for AR in bright conditions. Kopin's Q1 2023 results showed increased product revenues, especially in defense, and the new CEO emphasized renewed focus on quality and efficiency to improve margins and achieve cash flow breakdown by year-end.

title: Growth-Stock Funds Fly High but Fall Short in 2023′s First Half
summary: Growth-stock funds experienced a strong rebound in the first half of 2023 after significant losses in 2022, with large-growth funds doubling small-growth funds' gains. However, two-thirds of U.S.-centric active managers underperformed stylistically relevant indexes and passive rivals due to untimely sector allocations and light stakes in mega-cap stocks that drove market performance. International and emerging markets showed more modest gains, with some regions outperforming others, leading to a mixed bag for global stocks.

title: Cisco bats for universal AI regulation
summary: Cisco is advocating for universal AI regulation, emphasizing the need for a global public-private dialogue due to AI's far-reaching impact. The company believes AI should be used responsibly with transparency and collaboration between the public and private sectors to establish regulatory frameworks, including content attribution and copyright. This stance aligns with other tech giants like Microsoft and Google who also support AI regulation, and comes as the EU is actively pursuing legislation in this area.

title: TThe High Price of Low Volatility | U.S. Equity market commentary 2Q23
summary: This article by Bill Nygren, Portfolio Manager at Oakmark, discusses how different entities define investment risk and argues against the common perception of index funds as low-risk, highlighting increasing concentration risk in indices like the NASDAQ 100 and S&P 500. He contrasts this with Oakmark's approach, which focuses on long-term value investing and accepts higher short-term volatility for potentially better long-term returns. Nygren contends that index fund investors and those seeking low volatility stocks are overlooking significant valuation risks.

title: Oakmark Equity and Income Fund: Second Calendar Quarter 2023
authors: CFA; Adam D. Abbas; Michael A. Nicolas
summary: The Oakmark Equity and Income Fund gained 5.3% in Q2 2023, outperforming the Lipper Balanced Fund Index, despite market concentration in large-cap tech stocks. The fund adjusted its portfolio by reducing technology exposure and initiating new positions, primarily in the healthcare sector, based on a value-driven investment philosophy. The article also reflects on the foundational principles of diversification in portfolio construction, influenced by economist Harry Markowitz, and the fund's approach to asset allocation.

title: Apple’s market value ends above $3 trillion for the first time
summary: Apple Inc.'s market value surpassed $3 trillion for the first time at the close of a trading session, driven by positive inflation data and confidence in its market expansion strategies. This milestone reflects a 49 percent gain in Apple shares for 2023, amid a tech stock rebound fueled by expectations of slower interest rate hikes from the US Federal Reserve and buzz around artificial intelligence. The company's financial resilience, strong balance sheet, and a recent augmented-reality headset launch contribute to its success, making it one of only five US companies with a valuation exceeding $1 trillion.

title: AI Startup Typeface Raises $100 Million From Salesforce, GV
summary: Typeface Inc., an AI startup specializing in content creation services for businesses, has successfully raised $100 million in funding from investors including Salesforce Ventures and Alphabet’s GV. This investment values Typeface at $1 billion and increases its total fundraising to $165 million, reflecting growing investor interest in generative AI technologies.

title: Baidu: Why It’s One Of The Best Chinese Stocks To Own
summary: Baidu is presented as a strong opportunity among Chinese stocks despite current market underperformance. The article highlights its strengthening financials, particularly in ads and cloud, and its bullish innovation in AI with Ernie Bot and Apollo Go. Analyst upgrades and a significant price target increase by Morgan Stanley reinforce its potential for substantial upside.

title: Some ESG Issues Take Center Stage at Big Tech Investor Meetings
summary: ESG principles are increasingly important at big tech companies, with shareholder demands evolving beyond traditional environmental concerns to focus on social and governance issues. Recent investor meetings at Alphabet and Meta, both holdings in the Invesco ESG Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQMG), saw a rise in shareholder resolutions concerning online safety, gender/racial equity, human rights, and executive compensation. This trend highlights the growing emphasis on the "S" and "G" in ESG, potentially positioning QQMG as a relevant investment for those seeking exposure to mega-cap growth with an ESG focus.

title: Comparing the Expense Ratios of ETFs Investing in AI: Which One Is Right for You?
summary: This article compares the expense ratios and year-to-date returns of four ETFs that invest in artificial intelligence, focusing on options with lower fees. It discusses broad-based tech ETFs like FTEC, IETC, and IYW, and a new economies composite ETF, KOMP, highlighting their investment strategies and top holdings. The piece advises investors to consider expense ratios, YTD returns, investment goals, risk tolerance, and portfolio diversification when choosing an AI-focused ETF.

title: EPAM Announces Strategic Global Partnership with Google Cloud
summary: EPAM Systems, Inc. announced a strategic global partnership with Google Cloud to develop and deploy AI-first solutions for enterprise digital transformation. This enhanced collaboration will leverage Google Cloud's AI and ML capabilities with EPAM's engineering expertise to deliver innovative cloud-enabled AI, data modernization, and analytics solutions across various industry verticals. The partnership aims to help clients accelerate their transformations into AI-enabled businesses and drive growth.

title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FMET)
summary: The Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET) has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" with an average price target equal to its current share price of $36.66. The rating is based on 613 analyst ratings covering 20 companies (69.5% of the portfolio) over the past year. The ETF's top holdings include major tech companies like AMD, Alphabet, Apple, and NVIDIA.

title: AMD's AI chip challenge to Nvidia remains uphill fight with no big customers named
summary: AMD unveiled new details about its MI300X artificial intelligence chip, designed to challenge Nvidia's market dominance, but did not announce any major customers for the product. While the chip offers significant memory capacity aimed at cost reduction for AI services, the lack of customer commitments disappointed Wall Street, causing AMD's stock to fall. Analysts noted that Nvidia's strong market position is reinforced by its software ecosystem, which AMD is attempting to counter with its Rocm platform.

title: AMD launches new Instinct MI300X AI chip to take on Nvidia’s GPUs
summary: AMD has launched its new Instinct MI300X AI accelerator chip, designed to compete with Nvidia's GPUs in the generative AI market. The company also introduced its Infinity Architecture Platform, powered by eight MI300X chips, and its ROCm software ecosystem. Despite these announcements, AMD's stock fell due to a lack of major customer endorsements for the new chips and details on pricing.

title: Accenture looks to power AI efforts with $3 billion investment
summary: Accenture announced a significant $3 billion investment over three years into its data and AI practice, aiming to double the number of employees working with AI to 80,000. This move highlights a broader industry trend of companies scaling up generative AI offerings, following similar initiatives by Microsoft, Alphabet, and Salesforce. The investment also comes after recent layoffs at Accenture and includes the launch of an "AI Navigator for Enterprise" tool to guide businesses in AI adoption.

title: Additions to Fortinet FortiFlex deliver more flexible licensing options to customers
summary: Fortinet Inc. has introduced new product and service additions to its FortiFlex program, offering customers more flexible licensing options, including support for physical FortiGate next-generation firewall appliances. The program, which uses a points system for usage-based pricing, is now available via private offer in the Amazon Web Services Inc. Marketplace. FortiFlex aims to address the evolving needs of highly distributed networks by allowing organizations to pay by usage and manage licenses more efficiently across various deployment types.

title: A breakdown of AI ETFs as tech names burn bright
summary: This article breaks down various AI-focused ETFs available in Europe, examining their methodologies, holdings, and performance. It highlights the differences in how these ETFs define and capture the AI theme, from market-cap weighted exposure to companies involved in big data and NLP to equally-weighted exposure based on AI-related revenue or IP. The piece also compares their costs, liquidity, and correlation of returns, noting that while some are dominated by large tech names, others offer differentiated exposure to companies leveraging machine learning.

title: Traders Could Use Google as an Alternate Play on AI
summary: Google is presented as an alternative investment for traders looking to capitalize on the growing artificial intelligence (AI) trend, given its increasing focus on AI capabilities beyond its search engine. The article discusses Direxion Investments' ETFs (GGLL and GGLS) for both bullish and bearish plays on Google, as well as the Direxion Daily Robotics, Artificial Intelligence & Automation Index Bull 2X ETF (UBOT) for a broader, leveraged AI investment.

title: TCL Takes Step Toward Its Own TVOS With Cineverse Deal For FAST Content and Streaming Tech
summary: TCL is moving to develop its own streaming operating system by partnering with Cineverse. This deal involves TCL licensing Cineverse's FAST channels and using Cineverse's Matchpoint SaaS streaming distribution platform for its phones and smart TVs in North America, marking a shift away from its previous reliance on Roku and Google TV. The Cineverse content and tech will first appear as a new streaming app on TCL TVs powered by Google TV, and later on TCL's Roku TVs.

title: Introducing Apple Vision Pro: Apple’s first spatial computer
summary: Apple has unveiled Apple Vision Pro, its first spatial computer, which blends digital content with the physical world using a three-dimensional user interface controlled by eyes, hands, and voice. Running on the new visionOS, Vision Pro features an ultra-high-resolution display system, custom Apple silicon, and offers new ways to interact with apps, enjoy entertainment, relive memories, and connect via FaceTime. The device is designed with advanced materials, focuses on privacy, and will be available early next year starting at $3,499 (U.S.).

title: Microsoft Inks Deal With NVIDIA-Backed CoreWeave
summary: Microsoft has signed a deal with NVIDIA-backed cloud-computing startup CoreWeave, planning to invest billions to bolster its cloud computing infrastructure for AI operations. This partnership will provide Microsoft easier access to NVIDIA’s GPUs, which are crucial for AI-based applications like ChatGPT, and aims to give Microsoft a competitive edge against rivals like Alphabet Inc. and Amazon Web Services. CoreWeave’s access to over 45,000 GPUs and its status as an elite CSP in the NVIDIA Partner Network positions it as a key enabler for Microsoft's AI endeavors.

title: Vimeo is tuning out its streaming TV apps
summary: Vimeo is discontinuing its dedicated streaming TV apps for Apple TV, Android TV, Amazon Fire TV, and Roku starting June 27th. Users can still watch Vimeo content on their TVs by casting from the Vimeo mobile app via Apple AirPlay 2 or Google Chromecast. This move aligns with Vimeo's strategic shift in recent years from a consumer-facing streaming destination to focusing on video-streaming services for businesses.

title: Apple Bets On The Emerging Markets Growth Story
summary: Apple is increasingly focusing on emerging markets, particularly India, to drive growth amidst a challenging global smartphone market. The company achieved marginal growth in iPhone sales despite overall industry decline, with India seeing significant retail and manufacturing expansion plans. While services and financial technology offer long-term opportunities, the emerging markets strategy is a key component of Apple's immediate growth narrative, alongside ongoing share repurchases and dividend increases.

title: Baidu Creates $140 Million Fund to Back ChatGPT-Like Startups
summary: Baidu Inc. has launched a 1 billion yuan ($140 million) fund to support Chinese startups developing generative AI, similar to ChatGPT services. This initiative aims to incubate projects built on Baidu's Ernie AI model, with individual deployments potentially reaching 10 million yuan. Venture capitalists like IDG Capital will assist in evaluating pitches and providing seed funding to promising founders.

title: Everything you need to know about Salesforce’s Q1 2024 financial results
summary: Salesforce, Inc. reported increased first-quarter adjusted earnings in Q1 2024 ($1.69 per share) and revenue growth of 11% year-over-year to $8.25 billion. All key operating segments showed growth, driven by its generative AI ecosystem including Einstein GPT, Slack GPT, and Tableau GPT. CEO Marc Benioff highlighted the role of the Salesforce GPT Trust Layer in securing customer data and enhancing enterprise automation.

title: U.S. Supreme Court declines to hear bid to sue Reddit over child porn
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court has declined to hear a lawsuit attempting to hold Reddit Inc. liable for child pornography posted on its platform, upholding a lower court's decision that Reddit is shielded by Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act. The case explored the scope of a 2018 amendment, the Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act (FOSTA), which allows lawsuits if the claim involves child sex trafficking, but the court found Reddit did not "knowingly benefit" from such activity. This decision follows a similar sidestepping of Section 230 immunity in a separate case involving Google and YouTube.

title: Google announces US-Taiwan-Philippines cable with Chunghwa, Globe, and AT&T
summary: Google has announced plans for a new subsea cable system, TPU (Taiwan-Philippines-US), linking the US, Taiwan, and the Philippines, partnering with Chunghwa Telecom, Innove (Globe Group), and AT&T. This new cable, expected to be ready for service in 2025 with NEC as the supplier, will provide 260Tbps of capacity and offer an alternative route to Google's existing Apricot cable, enhancing resilience and capacity in the APAC region. Additionally, the article notes another subsea cable development, the EMC West system in the Middle East, being built by Center3 and ASN.

title: ETF of the Week: Goldman Sachs Hedge Industry VIP ETF (GVIP)
summary: VettaFi’s Tom Lydon discusses the Goldman Sachs Hedge Industry VIP ETF (GVIP) which offers exposure to top holdings favored by hedge funds without an overweight toward any single stock. GVIP provides diversification across various companies, including some mid-cap and international stocks, making it a less volatile option for investors seeking innovative companies. It provides a consensus of top companies chosen by leading hedge fund managers, appealing to investors looking for strong, well-vetted companies.

title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:FMET)
summary: This article provides an overview of the Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET), including its price, holdings, and recent news. FMET tracks a market cap-weighted index of equities related to the metaverse, launched on April 19, 2022, and is managed by Fidelity. The ETF has seen a significant increase in share price since the beginning of 2025 and lists its top institutional shareholders and key holdings.

title: Roundhill Investments Launches Generative AI & Technology ETF (NYSE Arca: CHAT)
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (NYSE Arca: CHAT), providing investors with exposure to companies at the forefront of generative AI technology. The ETF aims to capitalize on the rapidly growing generative AI market, which Roundhill estimates to have a total addressable market of over $120 billion for enterprise software. CHAT is an actively-managed ETF with top holdings including Nvidia, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Salesforce, offering investors a way to participate in this innovative and transformative technology.

title: Roundhill Launches Generative AI & Technology ETF With CHAT
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT), an actively managed ETF focusing on global companies leading in generative AI technology. The fund aims to offer precise exposure to generative AI, distinguishing itself from other AI-themed ETFs that may lack such specific focus. Top holdings include Nvidia, Microsoft, and Alphabet, with expectations for the basket to expand as more companies genuinely contribute to the generative AI space.

title: Here's how AI is driving the rise of GPU cloud specialists
summary: The rise of AI is fueling a new class of cloud providers specializing in GPU compute, offering lower prices than generalized cloud competitors. Companies like CoreWeave, Lambda Labs, RunPod, and Arc Compute are catering to AI workloads that require substantial GPU resources. These niche providers differentiate themselves through competitive pricing, strategic locations, and ready access to scarce compute resources amidst supply chain challenges.

title: Msci Kld 400 Social Index: Meaning, Example, FAQs
summary: The MSCI KLD 400 Social Index is a market capitalization-weighted stock index that focuses on large, mid, and small-cap U.S. companies with high environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards, excluding certain industries. Founded as the Domini 400 Social Index, it was a pioneer in socially responsible investing. The index is reviewed quarterly and tends to be dominated by large American technology companies like Microsoft, NVIDIA, Alphabet, Tesla, and Visa.

title: Survey Signals Pause-and-Pivot Year for CEOs
summary: The 2023 Gartner CEO and Senior Business Executive Survey indicates a shift from short-term reactivity to cautious long-term planning, with CEOs focusing on business productivity and new three- to seven-year growth strategies. While growth remains a top priority, profitability is investors' primary concern, leading to an emphasis on multiyear productivity engineering and the creative application of new technologies like AI and automation. Talent and workforce issues, including shortages and compensation demands, continue to be significant challenges for executives.

title: Accenture is cutting 75 San Jose workers
summary: Accenture is cutting 75 employees based at Google's campus in North San Jose, appearing to be cutting contractors who worked for Google. This news comes amidst a wave of other major layoffs by tech companies including First Republic, Google, Lyft, and Meta Platforms.

title: B+C Hall of Fame 2023: Matt Bond
summary: Matt Bond, Chairman of Content Distribution at NBCUniversal, is honored by the B+C Hall of Fame for his influential career in cable programming and distribution. Known as a tough negotiator from his time at TCI and Comcast to his current role at NBCU, Bond has been involved in numerous significant transactions. The article also highlights his remarkable recovery from a severe heart attack and his philosophical view of his career journey from the "Model T era" to the "Tesla era" of television.

title: Better Bear-Market Buy: Unity Technologies Stock or Digital Turbine Stock?
authors: Jon Quast for The Motley Fool
summary: This article compares Unity Technologies (U) and Digital Turbine (APPS) as potential bear-market buys, noting both have seen significant stock drops. It highlights their direct competition in the mobile app discovery market, particularly after Unity's merger with ironSource, and ultimately suggests Unity may be the better buy due to its "end-to-end platform" approach.

title: Undervalued Communication Services Stocks
summary: This article identifies undervalued communication services stocks, highlighting names like Comcast, Disney, and Alphabet, which are trading at discounts after a challenging 2022. It screens for companies within the Morningstar US Communication Services Index that have a 4 or 5-star Morningstar Rating and a wide economic moat, providing analyst insights for the top five. The communication services sector saw a significant rebound in early 2023 after substantial losses in the previous year.

title: Qualcomm, Nvidia spar for top spot in AI chip efficiency tests
summary: Qualcomm's AI 100 chips outperformed Nvidia's H100 chips in two out of three power efficiency categories for AI inference tasks, specifically image classification and object detection. Nvidia, however, took the lead in natural language processing performance and power efficiency. This highlights the competitive landscape in the growing market for data center inference chips, where power consumption is a key cost factor.

title: Green Visor Financial Technology Acquisition Corp. I (GVCI) Stock Live Price, Chart & News
summary: This article provides live stock price, chart, and news for Green Visor Financial Technology Acquisition Corp. I (GVCI). It shows the current stock price, market capitalization, trading volume, and performance metrics. The company's stock trades on NASDAQ and currently has a bullish price prediction according to the site.

title: Frontdoor App Changes the Game of Home Repair and Maintenance
summary: Frontdoor, Inc. has launched a new app that aims to revolutionize home repair and maintenance by connecting homeowners with pre-qualified experts via video chat. The app, available in mid-April, offers various features including DIY tips, maintenance reminders, and discounts. A new campaign from Fallon and Chemistry supports the launch, which also marks a reunion of brand and agency leaders.

title: China AI: What Lies Ahead?
summary: A Citi Research report by Alicia Yap examines the AI landscape in China, forecasting significant growth in its generative AI application market from Rmb66.3bn in 2022 to Rmb207bn by 2025. The report also highlights the rapid expansion of China's cybersecurity market, projected to reach US$31.9bn by 2026, driven by digital economy demands and government support. It discusses how generative AI could revolutionize the SaaS industry and considers the impact of data privacy and censorship on China's AI progress.

title: DEFI Stock Price | Hashdex Bitcoin Futures ETF
summary: This article provides detailed financial information for the Hashdex Bitcoin Futures ETF (DEFI), including its current stock price, trading exchange (NYSE), and key statistics such as expense ratio and total assets. It also offers recent news and analysis related to Bitcoin and the broader market, along with technical analysis insights and the fund's profile. The DEFI ETF, launched in September 2022 by Hashdex Asset Management Ltd., invests in currency markets using derivatives like futures to track the Hashdex U.S. Bitcoin Futures Fund Benchmark.

title: eToro has launched a new investment portfolio
summary: eToro has expanded its smart investment portfolio offerings by launching the AI-Revolution portfolio, focusing on the artificial intelligence industry. This new portfolio divides companies into two groups: those involved in AI technology infrastructure and those across various sectors utilizing AI to enhance their products and services. A minimum investment of $500 is required for this portfolio.

title: Artificial Intelligence in China: Implications and Opportunities
summary: The rapid adoption of generative AI platforms like ChatGPT has highlighted China's strong position to benefit from the AI trend. Driven by massive data, a skilled workforce, supportive government policies, and an advanced manufacturing base, Chinese companies like Baidu, ByteDance, Alibaba, and Tencent are poised to become leaders in generative AI. The article details the foundational strengths of China's AI ecosystem and the potential beneficiaries within its tech and semiconductor industries.

title: Salesforce follows Microsoft in launching A.I. tools for salespeople with help from OpenAI
summary: Salesforce is launching new AI-powered tools, including Einstein GPT for sales and service and a ChatGPT app for Slack, leveraging OpenAI's technology. These tools aim to assist salespeople, customer service agents, and marketers by generating responses and content, with an emphasis on human review to mitigate the spread of incorrect information. This move follows Microsoft's similar integration of AI into its business software, highlighting the competitive rush among tech giants to capitalize on generative AI.

title: Sonos CEO Patrick Spence on right to repair, spatial audio and those never-ending lawsuits
summary: Sonos CEO Patrick Spence discusses the company's new Era 100 and Era 300 speakers, focusing on the emergence of spatial audio and its mainstream adoption challenges. He also addresses Sonos' commitment to right-to-repair principles, its premium pricing strategy, the future of the smart home market, and ongoing lawsuits with Google.

title: 10 Undervalued, High-Quality Stocks With Competitive Advantages
summary: This article identifies 10 undervalued, high-quality stocks with wide economic moats, according to Morningstar analysts. These companies, including Adobe, Microsoft, and Alphabet, have strong balance sheets, high profitability, and competitive advantages expected to last over 20 years. The stocks listed were trading below their fair value estimates as of March 2, 2023.

title: Generative AI, Explained
summary: This article explains generative AI, a rapidly evolving field using deep learning algorithms to create new and original content. It highlights the technology's history, starting with Google's Transformer model, and explores its wide range of current and future use cases across various industries such as content creation, healthcare, finance, and gaming. The piece concludes that generative AI is still in its infancy with vast potential to revolutionize many aspects of life and work.

title: C3 AI Announces Fiscal Third Quarter 2023 Financial Results
summary: C3 AI (NYSE: AI) announced strong financial results for its fiscal third quarter ended January 31, 2023, exceeding revenue guidance with $66.7 million. The company highlighted successful partnerships, expansion into new markets, and a confident outlook towards profitability in FY24, driven by its consumption-based pricing model and innovations in enterprise AI and Generative AI.

title: Elliott nominates slate of directors to Salesforce board - source
summary: Activist investor Elliott Management Corp has nominated a slate of directors to the board of Salesforce Inc, following their multi-billion dollar stake acquisition in January. Elliott praised Salesforce's recent announcements, including accelerated margin targets and a $20 billion share repurchase, as steps toward regaining investor trust. This move adds pressure on Salesforce to deliver on promises and enhance accountability through board oversight.

title: Baidu's ChatGPT-like app will revolutionise its search engine, says CEO
summary: Baidu's CEO Robin Li announced that its upcoming ChatGPT-like app, Ernie Bot, will revolutionize its search engine by enhancing user experience and engagement, significantly expanding the market size of search engines. The company plans to build an AI ecosystem around Ernie Bot, leveraging its advanced generative AI technology to boost online advertising and serve as a productivity tool for other businesses. Baidu aims to regain market share and capitalize on its "first mover" advantage in China's AI market with Ernie Bot, which is trained on years of search data and is "state of the art" in understanding Chinese language and culture.

title: Dexcom G6 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System Launches in Singapore
summary: Dexcom, Inc. has officially launched its G6 Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) System in Singapore for individuals aged two and older, including pregnant women. This system eliminates the need for routine fingersticks by continuously measuring and wirelessly sending glucose levels to a receiver or compatible smart device, offering real-time data and customizable alerts. The launch marks Dexcom's first CGM availability in Southeast Asia, with DKSH Singapore Pte Ltd appointed as the sales, marketing, and distribution service provider.

title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: George Soros, Seth Klarman, D.E. Shaw, Millennium Management, Element Capital, Coliseum Capital Management, Renaissance Technologies, Clearfield Inc (CLFD), Alset Inc. (AEI), and More
summary: This article provides an overview of recent activities in the hedge fund world, including D.E. Shaw closing its first private equity fund, Seth Klarman increasing stakes in Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta, and George Soros' fund investments. It also covers Millennium Management's hiring of a star macro manager, Element Capital's rule relaxation after a significant loss, and a proxy battle involving Coliseum Capital Management and Purple Innovation. The report highlights a strong month for Asia-focused hedge funds, increased scrutiny for crypto's hedge fund ties, Renaissance Technologies' substantial increase in Tesla shares, and insider buying in Clearfield Inc. and Alset Inc.

title: C3 AI CEO on ChatGPT-Fueled Stock Jump
summary: C3.ai Inc. CEO Tom Siebel discusses the company's stock surge, which nearly doubled after the release of ChatGPT and C3.ai's new generative AI enterprise search product. Siebel highlights how generative AI will fundamentally change enterprise applications and simplify data analytics for customers, making C3.ai's offerings more accessible. Despite investor excitement, Siebel emphasizes the focus on product development and anticipates the company will become cash positive and profitable within five quarters on an adjusted basis, with plans to increase employment.

title: Reinventing search with a new AI-powered Microsoft Bing and Edge, your copilot for the web
authors: Yusuf Mehdi - Corporate Vice President & Consumer Chief Marketing Officer
summary: Microsoft unveiled a new AI-powered Bing search engine and Edge browser, aiming to reinvent web search by providing more complete answers, a chat experience, and content generation capabilities. These new tools are designed to act as an "AI copilot for the web," leveraging a next-generation OpenAI model (more powerful than ChatGPT) and Microsoft's proprietary Prometheus model. The update applies AI to the core search algorithm, resulting in a new user experience that integrates search, browsing, and chat.

title: Baidu stock surges after announcement of ChatGPT-style AI bot
summary: Baidu's stock surged after the company announced its intention to launch a ChatGPT-style AI chatbot called "Wenxin Yiyan" or "ERNIE Bot" in March. This strategic move highlights the ongoing AI race among tech giants, following Google's announcement of its own chatbot, Bard, and Microsoft's significant investment in OpenAI. Baidu's ERNIE Bot is based on a language model first developed in 2019 and is currently in its third iteration.

title: Google, Amex roll out anti-fraud tool
summary: Google and American Express have expanded their partnership to introduce a new security feature for Amex virtual card users in the U.S. This anti-fraud tool, initially launched last year with Capital One, replaces actual card numbers with unique virtual numbers during online purchases made via Chrome and Android apps, eliminating manual CVV entry and providing encrypted connections. Google plans to extend this feature to Visa and Mastercard virtual cards later this year.

title: Software company Autodesk lays off 250 employees
summary: Autodesk, a software company, has laid off 250 employees, which is less than 2% of its global workforce. This decision is part of its fiscal year 2024 plans to align resources with key priorities and comes amidst a global economic downturn affecting many tech companies. The affected roles include digital marketing, technical marketing, and web optimization, though the company continues to hire for other key positions.

title: Calamos Investments Launches New Sustainable Equities ETF SROI
summary: Calamos Investments has launched the Calamos Antetokounmpo Global Sustainable Equities ETF (SROI) on NYSE ARCA, in collaboration with NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo. This actively managed ETF aims for long-term capital appreciation by investing in quality growth companies that integrate ESG principles, utilizing both traditional financial and nonfinancial indicators. The fund will also donate a portion of its profits to charity, reflecting a commitment to community impact.

title: Big Tech to Congress: Listen to Taylor Swift and Go After Ticketmaster, Not Us
summary: Lobbyists for major technology companies capitalized on public outrage over Ticketmaster's handling of Taylor Swift concert tickets to deflect congressional antitrust scrutiny away from Big Tech. They argued that Congress should focus on clear monopolies like Ticketmaster, implying that existing antitrust laws are sufficient and that efforts to reform them to target tech giants are misguided. This strategy led to a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing focusing on Live Nation/Ticketmaster's monopolistic practices instead of Big Tech.

title: AI Time: 10 Ways Artificial Intelligence is Getting Real
summary: A new report from Citi Global Insights highlights 10 areas of innovation in Artificial Intelligence, a market that has grown significantly at a 35% CAGR since 2015. The article discusses key AI technologies such as Large Language Models, AI Art, Quantum for AI, Edge AI, and Explainable AI, detailing their market potential and impact. It also features insights from leading AI experts on the future trajectory of AI development.

title: Getty Images suing the makers of popular AI art tool for allegedly stealing photos
summary: Getty Images has filed a lawsuit against Stability AI, the creator of the AI art tool Stable Diffusion, alleging copyright infringement. The stock image company claims Stability AI copied and processed millions of its images without obtaining proper licenses. This action highlights the growing tension between traditional media suppliers and AI art generators, as artists become concerned about their work being used for AI training without credit.

title: What the Stock Split by Google’s Parent, Alphabet, Means - WSJ
summary: Alphabet announced a 20-for-1 stock split, its first since 2014, making its shares more accessible to individual investors. This move follows similar actions taken by Apple and Tesla since the pandemic, signaling a renewed interest in stock splits among major tech companies. The split will apply to all three classes of Alphabet stock.

title: Why the Rich Have Become Richer
summary: This article explores the reasons behind increasing wealth disparity within advanced economies, focusing on the U.S. It highlights that both earned income (due to higher wages for elite employees) and unearned income (from stock market gains) have contributed to the rich becoming richer, particularly noting the significant impact of stock ownership and dividend reinvestment for higher-income households. The author emphasizes that equity returns have substantially outpaced wage growth over the long term.

title: What Is A Snowflake Database? Introduction To Modern Data Platform
summary: This article provides an in-depth introduction to Snowflake, a modern cloud-independent data warehousing platform. It explains Snowflake's architecture, including its cloud services, query processing, and database storage layers, and highlights its numerous benefits like scalability, security, and seamless data sharing. The article also differentiates Snowflake from other data platforms based on architecture, maintenance, scalability, and cost.

title: Ignite '22 – That's a Wrap
summary: Palo Alto Networks hosted its first in-person customer conference since 2019, Ignite '22, welcoming 2500 customers. Key announcements included an extended partnership with Google Cloud for ZTNA 2.0, new product innovations for Palo Alto Networks' Next Gen Platforms emphasizing Zero Trust, and advancements in Cortex Solutions like the cloud-native XSIAM and re-architected XSOAR 8.0. The event also featured compelling keynotes from leaders like Nikesh Arora, Wendi Whitmore, Lee Klarich, Zeynep Ozdemir, BJ Jenkins, and Nir Zuk, highlighting the evolving cybersecurity landscape and the future role of AI.

title: Where Are Stocks Looking Cheap or Expensive?
summary: After a significant valuation reset in 2022, Morningstar analysts believe the stock market is finishing the year at its most undervalued level since March 2020.
