Small-cap and large-cap growth stocks, as well as sectors like communication services and consumer cyclicals, appear significantly undervalued, while utilities, oil and gas, and waste management remain relatively overvalued. This analysis is based on price/fair value ratios, with US stocks trading at an average 15% discount as of December 19, 2022.

title: The 7 Hottest Augmented Reality Stocks to Own for 2023 and Beyond
summary: This article highlights seven augmented reality stocks poised for growth in 2023 and beyond, given the AR market's projected expansion to nearly $600 billion by 2030. It covers established tech giants like Alphabet leveraging AR for practical applications, specialized component providers like Himax Technologies, and pure-play AR ventures, while also acknowledging the inherent risks and volatility in this developing sector. Each stock profile details its AR relevance, financial standing, and potential for investors.

title: Want to Attract Top Tech Talent? Prioritize Their Needs
summary: This article emphasizes that attracting and retaining top tech talent requires more than just competitive pay; companies must prioritize technologists' needs for growth, modern tools, and an inclusive work environment. It suggests strategies like clear communication during recruiting, investing in up-to-date technologies, and fostering a culture of acceptance and work-life quality. Ultimately, understanding and acting on these priorities will help businesses thrive in the competitive tech talent market.

title: 5 Charts on Big Tech Stocks’ Collapse
summary: In 2022, Big Tech stocks collectively lost nearly $4 trillion in market value, with the Morningstar US Technology Index down 28.7%. This collapse significantly impacted overall market returns, contributing 7 percentage points to the U.S. market index's 18.7% loss. Factors like recession fears, advertising slowdowns, and changes in consumer spending led to substantial declines for companies such as Meta Platforms, Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, and Nvidia.

title: UnitedHealth names Google exec Kirsten Gil to board of directors
summary: UnitedHealth Group has appointed Google executive Kirsten Gil to its Board of Directors. Gil, a long-time leader at Alphabet (Google’s parent company), brings extensive experience in business operations, strategy, and finance across various Google departments, including search, maps, AI, and sustainability. Her appointment is expected to strengthen UnitedHealth's board with diverse tech and business expertise.

title: Can Bilibili be the Chinese Version of YouTube?
summary: This article examines Bilibili Inc. (NASDAQ: BILI), often called the "YouTube of China," comparing its business model and growth to YouTube (NASDAQ: GOOGL). It highlights similarities in content creation and differences in monetization and target audience, while also discussing Bilibili's volatile stock performance and impressive user engagement despite ongoing losses. The piece contextualizes Bilibili's recent performance within the broader reopening of the Chinese economy and its impact on other Chinese stocks.

title: Pentagon splits $9 billion cloud contract among Google, Amazon, Oracle and Microsoft
summary: The Pentagon awarded $9 billion worth of cloud computing contracts to Google, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft, and Oracle. These Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability (JWCC) contracts will provide enterprise-wide cloud services across all security domains and classification levels until 2028. This move signifies the military's shift towards utilizing multiple vendors for its cloud computing needs, learning from past litigation that halted a single-vendor IT modernization project.

title: Plainsight and Connection Launch AI Alliance To Bring Computer Vision To Enterprises Across Industries
summary: Plainsight, a leader in vision AI, has announced a strategic partnership with Connection (NASDAQ: CNXN), an IT solutions provider. This alliance aims to bring computer vision solutions to enterprises across various industries, with an initial focus on Manufacturing and Retail. The partnership will offer Plainsight's enterprise-grade vision AI with fully managed services, leveraging their respective Google Cloud partnerships.

title: Google, Oracle, Amazon, Microsoft to share $9 billion ‘return of JEDI’ defense contract
summary: Google, Oracle, Amazon, and Microsoft will jointly share a $9 billion hybrid contract from the Pentagon to provide secure cloud services globally. The contract, known as Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability, is scheduled for completion by June 8, 2028, with work to be performed in Reston, Va. This agreement follows previous discussions and changes regarding the Department of Defense's cloud computing needs.

title: Pentagon Divides Big Cloud-Computing Deal Among 4 Firms (Published 2022)
summary: The Pentagon awarded lucrative cloud-computing contracts, potentially valued at up to $9 billion, to Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Oracle. This decision marks a significant shift from an earlier attempt to award a sole contract to Microsoft, which was later scrapped after legal challenges and a recognition that the department's needs had evolved. The new Joint Warfighting Cloud Capability project aims to provide comprehensive cloud services across all security domains and classification levels for the Defense Department.

title: ETF 360: Strive’s Cole Discusses Energy Sector’s Long-Term Potential
summary: In a recent "ETF 360" episode, Strive Asset Management's Matt Cole discussed the Strive U.S. Energy ETF (DRLL) with VettaFi's Todd Rosenbluth. Cole highlighted the energy sector's strong fundamentals and profitability, noting its potential for continued outperformance relative to the tech sector. He also suggested that factors like a potential end to China's zero-COVID policy could further boost oil prices and DRLL's value.

title: Alphabet Shareholders | Who Owns The Most Shares of Alphabet?
summary: This article examines the ownership structure of Alphabet (GOOGL), detailing its largest shareholders among institutional investors and company insiders. It highlights that co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin control a significant portion of voting power through their Class B shares, while institutions like The Vanguard Group, The Capital Group, and State Street are major holders. The piece also lists top insider shareholders, excluding the founders.

title: Yahoo to buy minority stake in Taboola in digital ad push
summary: Yahoo is set to acquire a nearly 25% minority stake in Taboola.com Ltd, making it the largest shareholder. This 30-year deal will grant Taboola exclusive rights to sell native ads on Yahoo's platforms and is projected to generate $1 billion in annual revenue, marking a significant push into digital advertising for Yahoo. The agreement aims to boost Taboola's revenue and operating earnings, despite a recent downturn in its quarterly revenue and annual forecast.

title: NASDAQ Trading - How to invest in NASDAQ (US100) index?
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on investing in the NASDAQ (US100) index, detailing its structure, how it works, and reasons for its high volatility. It explains different trading positions (long and short) and identifies opportune times for trading, such as during periods of market panic or significant company announcements. The article also touches upon the use of CFDs and ETFs for investing in NASDAQ.

title: Moody's closing its consulting business in China, laying off staff: Report
summary: Moody's Corp is reportedly shutting down its consulting business, Moody's Analytics, in China and laying off over 100 employees across its Beijing, Shanghai, and Shenzhen offices. This move comes as China's zero-Covid policy and subsequent lockdowns are causing many multinational firms to reconsider their operations in the country. However, Moody's credit rating business will continue to operate in China.

title: Is DigitalOcean Stock a Buy Now?
summary: DigitalOcean is presented as a cloud infrastructure company targeting small businesses, developers, and startups, distinguishing itself from giants like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud with competitive pricing. The article highlights DigitalOcean's strong financial performance in Q3, including significant revenue growth and ambitious targets for 2024, despite considerations about stock-based compensation affecting free cash flow. The author concludes that DigitalOcean is a strong buy due to its rapid growth, reasonable stock valuation, and focused niche market.

title: U-Haul diversifies its social strategy to tell people it’s more than moving trucks
summary: U-Haul is expanding its social media strategy across various platforms like TikTok, LinkedIn, and Pinterest to communicate that it offers more than just moving trucks, including storage lockers, boxes, and hitches. This diversification aims to build brand loyalty and awareness among a broad customer base, leveraging digital channels after significantly reducing print advertising spend in 2009. While spending on social media is difficult to track precisely, U-Haul's overall advertising spend increased significantly from 2021 to 2022, with a notable portion dedicated to streaming and desktop video.

title: AI-powered video and audio editing app Descript raises $50M
summary: Descript Inc., an AI-powered video and audio editing platform, has raised a $50 million Series C funding round led by the OpenAI Startup Fund, bringing its total raised to over $100 million. Founded by former Groupon CEO Andrew Mason, the app simplifies editing for podcasters and videographers using AI and has launched new features, including background removal and scene creation, to make video editing as intuitive as using a Word document. OpenAI's COO Brad Lightcap expressed excitement for tools like Descript that empower creators.

title: Penguin Solutions Launches New Cloud-Native HPC/AI Control Plane and Announces Partnership with Google Cloud
summary: Penguin Solutions launched Scyld Cloud Central, a new cloud-native HPC/AI software offering, and announced a partnership with Google Cloud. This unified solution aims to simplify HPC/AI deployment, streamline user experience, and provide cost management for both on-premises and cloud-based environments. The platform offers rapid deployment, access to Penguin services, elastic scaling, and on-demand access to the latest processing technology, making HPC/AI more accessible and efficient for various users.

title: Salesforce Accessibility Execs Derek Featherstone, Catherine Nichols Talk Disability Inside And Out Of The Company In New Interview
summary: Salesforce accessibility executives Derek Featherstone and Catherine Nichols discuss the company's commitment to disability inclusion, both internally and externally. They highlight the collaborative efforts within the tech industry to promote accessibility, the role of Salesforce's Office of Accessibility and Abilityforce ERG, and the ethical component embedded in their product development. The executives emphasize that accessibility is a continuous journey and a core value for Salesforce, aiming to create a thriving environment for disabled employees and expanding their user base globally.

title: Primasun, backed by ResMed and Verily, Launches at HLTH 2022
summary: Primasun, a joint venture between ResMed and Verily, launched at HLTH 2022, offering a clinically-supported solution for complex sleep disorders. The platform aims to reduce the impact of untreated sleep disorders by connecting patients with certified sleep physicians for diagnosis and treatment. This initiative addresses the public health epidemic of insufficient sleep and the scarcity of sleep specialists in the U.S.

title: Got $5,000? These Are 2 of the Best Growth Stocks to Buy Right Now
summary: This article suggests two growth stocks, Duolingo (DUOL) and The Trade Desk (TTD), as strong long-term investments despite recent market trends favoring value stocks. Duolingo is highlighted for its impressive user growth and expansion beyond language learning, while The Trade Desk is praised for its ability to thrive in a challenging digital advertising market by providing efficient advertising solutions. Both companies are currently trading at discounted prices, presenting potential opportunities for significant long-term gains.

title: How Kayak Fared 10 Years After Priceline’s Offer to Buy It
summary: Ten years after Priceline (now Booking Holdings) acquired Kayak, the article assesses Kayak's performance under the new ownership. Despite Google's increasing dominance in online travel search, Kayak has prospered through international expansion and acquisitions, though some co-founders express reservations about its current direction and direct booking capabilities. The piece also briefly notes related news from Airbnb, Tripadvisor, and Hopper.

title: ‘Matter’ kicks off with a bang in Amsterdam – with Silicon Labs in starring role
summary: The new 'Matter' IoT standard launched in Amsterdam, featuring Silicon Labs in a prominent role and showcasing new smart home solutions. Silicon Labs, aiming to be "the Nvidia of IoT," predicts 40 billion IoT devices by 2030 and significant growth for smart home IoT due to Matter's interoperability. The standard, backed by nearly three hundred companies, aims to simplify smart home experiences for consumers.

title: Regeneron turns to IT to accelerate drug discovery
summary: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals is leveraging IT, particularly cloud computing and advanced data platforms, to significantly accelerate its drug discovery process. CIO Bob McCowan has spearheaded a major digital transformation, migrating the company's data to a multicloud environment (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and developing a MetaBio Data Discovery Platform, empowering scientists with tools to experiment and test hypotheses more efficiently. This strategic IT investment aims to reduce the drug development timeline from ten years to as few as four or five.

title: Google, IBM, Wells Fargo Join Growing List of Companies Posting Pay for All US Jobs
summary: Google, IBM, and Wells Fargo have joined a growing list of companies that are voluntarily posting salary ranges for all US job listings, even in states where it is not legally mandated. This move comes as New York City and Colorado already require such disclosures, with California and Washington poised to follow suit. The trend reflects a broader shift towards greater pay transparency in the American job market.

title: Kroger-Albertsons Merger Makes Sense Operationally
summary: The proposed merger between Kroger and Albertsons, if it closes in early 2024, would create a $200 billion company with over 5,000 stores, significantly overhauling the competitive landscape in the grocery market. Kroger CEO Rodney McMullen, referencing the successful Fred Meyer acquisition, argues the merger is necessary to better compete with larger retailers like Walmart and Amazon, allowing for cost savings, price cuts, and increased investment in digital infrastructure and retail media. The deal is expected to generate $1 billion in annual cost savings and provide greater buying power to navigate rising costs and shrinking margins in the industry.

title: ESG Indexes Lifted by Carbon-Efficient Firms but Underperformed
summary: MSCI ACWI ESG Indexes underperformed during the first three quarters of 2022 despite generally outperforming from 2013-2021. While carbon-efficient firms positively contributed to performance, exclusions from the MSCI ACWI ESG Leaders Index due to ESG controversies and significant negative contributions from specific stocks like Apple and Amazon primarily drove the underperformance. Industry factors, particularly energy and aerospace and defense, saw a reversal in performance but played a lesser role in the overall ESG index underperformance compared to stock-specific exclusions and dollar strengthening.

title: Tech investors think they know what will turn around Meta after a 72% implosion this year: Less Mark Zuckerberg
summary: Tech investors believe Meta Platforms Inc. could recover from its 72% stock implosion if CEO Mark Zuckerberg steps back, as his focus on the metaverse is seen as a drain on earnings. Despite his strong control due to the company's capital structure, some investors view the stock as "dirt cheap" and believe it could significantly rise with better management focus on shareholders. Others defend Zuckerberg's long-term vision, citing his past successes and patience.

title: GM temporarily suspends advertising on Twitter following Elon Musk takeover
summary: General Motors announced a temporary suspension of its advertising on Twitter following Elon Musk's acquisition of the social media platform. The automaker stated it is evaluating Twitter's new direction under Musk's ownership and will continue to use the platform for customer interactions but not paid advertising. Other auto companies, including Ford, Stellantis, and Rivian, are also assessing their ad strategies or have commented on their plans regarding the platform.

title: 4 META ETFs With Buy the Dip Opportunity
summary: Following a significant drop in Meta Platforms Inc. (META) stock due to decreased quarterly profits and digital advertising numbers, this article identifies four ETFs presenting a "buy the dip" opportunity. Despite investor concerns over Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse investment, these ETFs hold META with a minimum 10% weight and could rebound. The ETFs highlighted are the Communication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLC), Vanguard Communications Services ETF (VOX), Fidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETF (FCOM), and Global X Social Media ETF (SOCL).

title: Predictions 2023: AI Will Become An Indispensable, Trusted Enterprise Coworker
summary: In 2023, AI technology is predicted to become an indispensable and trusted enterprise coworker, transforming global markets. Key predictions include TuringBots writing 10% of worldwide code, one in four tech executives reporting to their board on AI governance, and 10% of Fortune 500 enterprises generating content with AI tools. These advancements signify AI's foundational role in successful enterprises and continued investment.

title: Intel's Mobileye unit valued at $22 bln as shares cruise higher
summary: Mobileye Global Inc., Intel's self-driving technology unit, debuted strongly on the U.S. stock market, reaching a valuation of $21.8 billion despite earlier IPO target reductions. The company's chief communications officer highlighted the importance of gaining a public platform and product visibility, especially for its SuperVision product, amid a challenging year for U.S. IPOs. Mobileye, which was previously listed before its acquisition by Intel in 2017, competes in the fiercely competitive assisted driving market, projecting deployment in 270 million cars by 2030.

title: Google Cloud AI to power Wells Fargo’s new virtual assistant Fargo
summary: Wells Fargo is partnering with Google Cloud to power its new virtual assistant, Fargo, using artificial intelligence to provide a more personalized and intuitive banking experience. The virtual assistant will help customers with various banking tasks, offer proactive financial wellness guidance through predictive analytics, and will be available in Spanish in 2023. This collaboration aims to meet the growing demand for digital banking services and enhance customer financial support.

title: About J.B. Hunt Transport, Inc.
summary: J.B. Hunt Transport, a Fortune 500 company, leveraged IBM Turbonomic to optimize its cloud infrastructure across Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud. The solution enabled significant time savings and provided full-stack visibility and AI-powered recommendations, leading to a safe migration of a substantial compute environment from Azure to Google Cloud in only 35 business days with zero downtime. This ongoing partnership helps J.B. Hunt assure application performance and reduce waste in their hybrid cloud environment.

title: Opinion: This one stock stands out when looking at key data from the FAANG+ group
summary: This article discusses the current landscape for tech-oriented stocks, noting that 2022 has been difficult for the sector. It suggests that smart long-term investors should look for bargains among quality merchandise, particularly within the FAANG group. The piece aims to identify one stock from this group that offers a good combination of low valuation and high growth, despite the challenging market conditions.

title: Wells Fargo taps Google AI on virtual assistant launch
summary: Wells Fargo announced its collaboration with Google Cloud to power its new virtual assistant, Fargo, which will assist customers with tasks like managing debit cards, checking credit limits, and searching transactions. This move is part of Wells Fargo's broader digital transformation strategy. Fargo will use Google's conversational AI platform, Dialogflow, and will eventually offer predictive analytics and support Spanish speakers, aiming to enhance customers' financial well-being.

title: Wells Fargo’s New Virtual Assistant, Fargo, to Be Powered by Google Cloud AI
summary: Wells Fargo is launching a new virtual assistant called Fargo, powered by Google Cloud's AI, to enhance customer banking experiences. Fargo will offer personalized financial insights, account servicing, and eventually Spanish language capabilities, aiming to provide convenient and proactive financial guidance. This collaboration with Google Cloud is a key part of Wells Fargo's digital strategy to become digital-first and reinvent personal finance.

title: RAGNAROK ARENA: THE NEWEST RPG MOBILE GAME BY GRAVITY GAME HUB IS COMING SOON
summary: Gravity Game Hub (GGH) PTE.LTD, a subsidiary of GRAVITY Co., Ltd., announced the upcoming release of their new mobile game, Ragnarok Arena, in late Q4 2022. This RPG, strategy, and idle game combines classic Ragnarok Online elements with new features like monster deployment and guild wars, and will be showcased at ESGS 2022. The game will be available across various regions on Apple and Google stores, and players can pre-register soon.

title: Report: Oracle slows hiring, especially in Bay Area and Seattle, raising fears of deeper cuts
summary: Oracle has reportedly slowed its hiring efforts, particularly in the Bay Area and Seattle, leading to concerns about potential deeper job cuts. Hiring managers have been instructed to delay start dates for new recruits as the company significantly scales back its recruitment activities. This move by Oracle follows similar actions by other tech giants like Microsoft and Google, signaling a potential shift in the tech job market.

title: U.S. Speaker Pelosi's husband sold Nvidia, Micron options at a loss
summary: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul Pelosi, sold call options in chipmakers Micron Technology and Nvidia, incurring losses close to $1 million. The transactions were disclosed in a transparency filing, which also showed he exercised call options for Alphabet shares and allowed Walt Disney call options to expire at a loss. This comes amid scrutiny over stock trading by lawmakers and their families, leading to legislative efforts to restrict such activities.

title: If I’d invested £1,000 in Alphabet stock 5 years ago, here’s how much I’d have now
summary: This article analyzes the hypothetical returns of investing £1,000 in Alphabet stock (Class A and Class C) five years ago, comparing its performance to major US indexes. The author, John Choong, details the growth of such an investment and discusses future prospects for Alphabet, despite recent bear market conditions, citing its strong financial health and diverse growth avenues.

title: The Last Word: Waymo's Charlie Jatt on Beer Driving Itself Across Texas With No Human at the Wheel
summary: Waymo's Head of Commercialization for Trucking, Charlie Jatt, discussed the future of autonomous beer deliveries in Texas. Waymo, the self-driving truck unit of Alphabet Inc., has already transported over 1 million pounds of Modelo and Corona beer from Dallas to Houston with a safety driver. The company aims for fully autonomous beer runs in the near future, citing excellent system maturity and performance.

title: T-Mobile Teams up with Google Cloud to Transform Customer Experiences
summary: T-Mobile and Google Cloud are partnering to enhance customer experiences for wireless users through Google Cloud's expertise in data analytics, AI, and ML, leveraging its 5G and edge computing solutions. The collaboration aims to deepen customer relationships and accelerate innovation by utilizing Google Cloud's BigQuery, BigQuery ML, Dialogflow, and Contact Center AI to provide personalized services and faster issue resolution. This partnership reflects T-Mobile's "customer obsessed" approach, aiming to understand and respond to consumer needs more effectively.

title: Lumen (LUMN) Completes Sale of ILEC Business to Brightspeed
summary: Lumen Technologies (LUMN) has completed the sale of its incumbent local exchange carrier (ILEC) business in 20 states to Brightspeed. This strategic move allows Lumen to focus on its national fiber routes, ILEC operations in 16 other states, and invest further in its Quantum Fiber and Enterprise businesses. The transaction also aims to support its accelerated Quantum Fiber deployment plan and reduce debt.

title: Game company Roblox enabled girl's sexual exploitation, lawsuit claims
summary: A lawsuit filed in San Francisco accuses online gaming firm Roblox Corp of enabling a California girl's sexual and financial exploitation by adult men. The lawsuit also targets Discord Inc, Snap Inc, and Meta Platforms Inc, claiming these companies failed to keep minors safe and did not require parental consent or verify age. The girl, who started using Roblox at age nine or ten, allegedly suffered severe mental health problems due to exploitation facilitated through these platforms.

title: Fiserv, LG back Korea Credit Data as the SME-focused fintech startup raises another $24.7M
summary: South Korean fintech startup Korea Credit Data (KCD) has raised an additional $24.7 million in Series D extension financing from strategic investors Fiserv and LG Uplus, bringing its total Series D funding to $70 million and its overall funding to $112 million. This latest round values KCD at approximately $776 million. KCD provides digital financial services, including its bookkeeping app Cash Note and SME-focused lending services, to 1.7 million registered merchants in South Korea, aiming to address critical pain points for small and medium-sized enterprises.

title: Logitech Sight AI Camera Makes Hybrid Work Meetings More Equitable for Remote Participants
summary: Logitech announced Logitech Sight, an AI-powered tabletop camera designed to make hybrid work meetings more equitable for remote participants. This multi-camera system works with Logitech's Rally Bar or Rally Bar Mini to provide remote workers with an "at the table" experience, effectively addressing the disparity between in-office and remote colleagues. Logitech Sight features dual 4K cameras and seven beamforming microphones, integrates with major video conferencing platforms, and is designed with sustainability in mind.

title: Walmart blazes trails with its enterprise ‘supercloud’
summary: Walmart has developed an enterprise "supercloud" called the Walmart Cloud Native Platform, which abstracts away differences between public cloud providers, its hybrid cloud, and edge computing nodes. This multicloud environment aims to optimize resource consumption, drive developer productivity, and enhance network resilience and data analysis. The company is also overhauling its legacy software infrastructure to containers, aiming for portability and resiliency over pure cost savings, and has been able to make 170,000 website adjustments monthly.

title: App Store experienced sharp revenue drop in September, Morgan Stanley says
summary: Apple's App Store experienced its steepest year-on-year net revenue decline in September, dropping 5% according to Morgan Stanley analyst Erik Woodring, largely due to a 14% plunge in gaming revenue. Sensor Tower data supports this, showing Apple's September revenue at $6.9 billion, down from $7.2 billion last year, and Morgan Stanley attributes this trend to consumers reallocating discretionary income amidst a global economic downturn. Despite a predicted potential rebound in the December quarter due to an extra selling week and currency fluctuations, Apple's services revenue for the September-ending quarter also fell short of Wall Street expectations.

title: Waymo, C.H. Robinson Driverless Trucks Haul Beer to Houston From Dallas
summary: Waymo, Alphabet's driverless-vehicle unit, and C.H. Robinson have completed a pilot program hauling over 1 million pounds of Modelo and Corona beer from Dallas to Houston using Class 8 trucks with Waymo's self-driving software and a safety driver. This test demonstrates the system's maturity and performance, potentially addressing the long-haul driver shortage for C.H. Robinson and commercializing Waymo's autonomous vehicle technology. The companies are working towards deploying service without a test driver in the coming years.

title: TTAC: Overweight Tech & Energy, Underweight Industrials & Communication
summary: The FCF US Quality ETF (TTAC) focuses on free cash flow to select approximately 150 stocks, aiming to outperform the Russell 3000. As of late August, TTAC was overweight in technology and energy sectors and underweight in industrials and communication services. FCF Advisors prioritizes free cash flow metrics, which they believe are more difficult to manipulate than GAAP earnings, especially in the current challenging investment environment.

title: Robert Kyncl Named CEO of Warner Music Group Starting January 1, 2023
summary: Robert Kyncl has been appointed CEO of Warner Music Group (Nasdaq: WMG), effective January 1, 2023, succeeding Steve Cooper. Kyncl, currently Chief Business Officer at YouTube, will serve as co-CEO with Cooper for January 2023 before becoming sole CEO on February 1, 2023. Cooper, who has been the longest-running CEO in WMG's history, will transition out after over a decade of leadership marked by growth and innovation.

title: Herbalife Nutrition Survey Reveals Top Ten Modern Day Entrepreneurs and What Traits are Needed to Join the List
summary: A Herbalife Nutrition survey identified Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, and Steve Jobs as the top three most influential modern entrepreneurs, followed by Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg. The study, involving 2,750 respondents across the U.S., Mexico, and Israel, also explored traits essential for entrepreneurial success, highlighting creativity and intelligence as most important. Herbalife Nutrition emphasized the ongoing strength of the entrepreneurial spirit and the company's commitment to fostering it.

title: 14 best shopping apps of 2025
summary: This article lists the 14 best shopping apps for 2025, categorizing them into marketplace, clothing, social media, cashback, grocery, mystery, and car shopping apps. It highlights the growing trend of mobile commerce and provides detailed descriptions of each app's features and benefits. The article also suggests that marketers consider partnering with these apps to gain awareness and loyalty from shoppers.

title: Never Mind Growth vs. Value Stocks, Look to Beta
summary: This article argues that investors should focus on stock volatility, represented by beta, rather than the traditional growth vs. value distinction, especially given the current economic uncertainty. It highlights that high-beta stocks, despite their risk, are currently undervalued, particularly in cyclical sectors, presenting potential opportunities. The author also suggests that low-beta stocks can offer a haven for risk-averse investors in uncertain times.

title: S|W: The SaaS Weekly – Adobe has $20 billion designs on Figma
summary: This edition of S|W: The SaaS Weekly highlights Adobe's significant $20 billion acquisition of Figma and Google facing a $25 billion lawsuit. The newsletter also covers various funding rounds for Canadian startups like GrowerIQ and Bright, leadership changes at Thinkific, and financial updates from companies like D2L and Byju's, alongside news of layoffs at GoStudent and Twilio.

title: Essent adds digital expert to board of directors
summary: Essent Group has appointed Anu (Henna) Karna to its board of directors, bringing over 25 years of experience in digital, data, and analytics innovation across various industries. Karna currently serves as the global general manager of industry solutions for insurance at Google Cloud. Her expertise is expected to be invaluable in enhancing Essent's use of data and digital transformation initiatives.

title: What’s New in Artificial Intelligence from the 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle™
summary: The 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle for Artificial Intelligence highlights key AI innovations expected to drive significant business benefits and will see mainstream adoption within two to five years. These innovations are categorized into data-centric, model-centric, applications-centric, and human-centric AI, with a focus on impact on both business leaders and engineering teams. The article emphasizes technologies like composite AI, decision intelligence, edge AI, and responsible AI as crucial for competitive advantage and solving complex business problems.

title: OTT Platform DISNEY+ HOTSTAR now supports Dolby Atmos on compatible TVs, AVRs, soundbars, Android smartphones and iOS devices
summary: Disney+ Hotstar has expanded its audio support to include Dolby Atmos for its users, delivering a multidimensional, spatial sound experience on compatible devices. This new feature, complementing existing Dolby Vision support, aims to immerse users more deeply in their favorite movies and shows. A wide range of titles, including Hotstar Specials and Multiplex content, are now available with Dolby Atmos.

title: Palo Alto Networks 3-for-1 stock split: What to Know
summary: Palo Alto Networks completed a 3-for-1 stock split, with shares gaining slightly on the first day of trading post-split before moving into negative territory. Shareholders of record as of September 6 received two additional shares for each one held, distributed after the close of trading on September 13. The company stated the split aims to make shares more accessible to employees and a broader base of investors, following significant stock price increases since its IPO.

title: Buy stocks with wide moats to protect your profits
summary: The article discusses Warren Buffett's "economic moat" concept, highlighting companies with sustainable competitive advantages. It outlines five key characteristics of such companies—intangible assets, cost advantage, switching costs, network effects, and efficient scale—and provides examples like Coca-Cola, Salesforce, and Alphabet. The piece concludes with advice on how investors can identify and invest in these wide-moat companies, including building a personal portfolio or using ETFs and investment trusts.

title: Jim Chanos Takes Aim at Data Centers and Their High Valuations
summary: Noted contrarian investor Jim Chanos is challenging the high valuations of data center REITs, despite their apparent growth potential. He argues that major cloud providers building their own facilities pose a competitive threat, potentially limiting future growth for companies like Equinix and Digital Realty Trust. Chanos and other analysts also raise concerns about rising costs, intense competition, and opaque valuation metrics for these firms.

title: Snap CEO to restructure company, cut 20% of workforce
summary: Snap Inc. is restructuring its operations and laying off 20% of its workforce after experiencing its slowest-ever revenue growth in Q2 and a significant net loss. CEO Evan Spiegel stated the company will refocus on revenue and user growth, and augmented reality (AR) to ensure long-term success. This strategic shift includes discontinuing non-core projects like Snap Originals, Minis, Games, Pixy, Zenly, and Voisey, while also authorizing a $500 million stock buyback program.

title: Announcing VMware Cloud on AWS integration with Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP
summary: NetApp announces the integration of VMware Cloud on AWS with Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP, offering an integrated, certified, and supported external NFS datastore. This solution allows for independent scaling of compute and storage in the cloud, leading to significant cost savings (up to 25-50% TCO reduction) and simplified data management for data-intensive VMware workloads. The partnership leverages 20 years of collaboration between NetApp and VMware to reduce barriers to cloud migration.

title: How Royal Caribbean set up a seafaring cloud strategy
summary: Royal Caribbean Group has adopted a multicloud strategy to manage the complex IT needs of its cruise ship fleet, leveraging Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft Azure for different workloads. This approach helps address the unique challenges of seafaring operations, such as unreliable satellite connectivity and the need for robust hybrid solutions. The company emphasizes the importance of balancing internal expertise with external partners and carefully considering cost and talent access in its vendor selection process.

title: These Wide-Moat Stocks Are Gaining Ground
summary: Quality stocks with wide economic moats, including Microsoft and Amazon, have outperformed since the bear market low in June, despite still being undervalued. While narrow-moat stocks have seen stronger recent gains due to market-cap weighting of companies like Apple and Tesla, wide-moat companies are better positioned to handle inflation due to their pricing power. Overall, Morningstar analysts consider wide-moat stocks to be deeply undervalued compared to overpriced narrow-moat stocks.

title: Aflac virtualizes the customer enrollment experience
summary: Aflac successfully virtualized its customer enrollment experience during the pandemic to support its independent agents, who were facing significant business risks due to social distancing. By combining existing technologies and building a new enrollment platform on AWS, Aflac enabled agents to conduct virtual meetings, co-browse with clients, and process policy purchases more efficiently. This digital transformation, which included the development of microsites and a "bionic" agent approach, earned Aflac a CIO 100 Award and lays the groundwork for a full migration to the cloud and further intelligent automation.

title: R|T: The Retail Times – Groupon to focus on ‘mission critical activities’ following staff cuts
summary: Groupon has cut over 500 staff and plans to focus solely on "mission-critical activities" due to underperforming business. This move is intended to improve its trajectory and generate positive cash flow by the end of 2022, following similar workforce reductions by other tech giants like Alibaba and Amazon. The article also provides updates on various other tech companies, including funding rounds, layoffs, and strategic partnerships.

title: CoStar, Adena Hefets Take Top Inman Innovator Awards At ICLV 2022 | Inman Real Estate News
summary: Adena Hefets, co-founder and CEO of Divvy Homes, and CoStar Group were honored with the top Inman "Innovators of the Year" awards at Connect Las Vegas 2022. These awards recognized their trailblazing work in the real estate industry, with Hefets for her rent-to-own platform and CoStar for its online marketplace and analytics, including its new search portal Citysnap. The article also lists other winners across various categories including Agent or Team of the Year and Brokerage of the Year.

title: How the economic downturn is affecting the AI sector
summary: The economic downturn is impacting the AI sector, with enterprises cutting budgets and slowing AI projects, despite AI being an integral part of the economy. While some vendors and venture capitalists are feeling the squeeze through stricter investment processes and hiring freezes, others remain insulated due to prior budgeting or long-term investment strategies. Experts suggest experimental AI projects will be paused, but the long-term outlook for next-generation AI technologies remains positive.

title: Google and U.S. chip maker SkyWater expand open source chip design platform
summary: Google Public Sector and U.S. chip manufacturer SkyWater Technology Inc. are expanding an open-source platform for chip design, with the U.S. Department of Defense funding $15 million for the development. This collaboration aims to lower the cost and increase accessibility for chip design and production for both national defense and commercial markets. The platform will be powered by Google's cloud and focuses on analog-digital mixed-signal chips using a 90-nanometer process.

title: Alphabet earnings miss estimates, ad revenue beats, stock pops
summary: Alphabet reported Q2 earnings that missed Wall Street estimates, with adjusted earnings per share hitting $1.21 against an expected $1.32. Despite the overall miss, ad revenue surpassed expectations at $56.29 billion. Shares rose 4% in after-hours trading, offering some relief to investors following concerns about the digital advertising market.

title: iRhythm Gains FDA Clearance for its Clinically Integrated ZEUS System
summary: iRhythm Technologies announced FDA 510(k) clearance for its ZEUS System for the Zio Watch, developed in partnership with Verily. This integrated solution provides a clinical-grade, wrist-worn wearable for long-term continuous monitoring to detect and characterize atrial fibrillation (AFib), aiding clinicians in diagnosis and intervention. The Zio Watch with the ZEUS System aims to enhance patient care by offering a cost-effective and noninvasive monitoring platform, leveraging iRhythm's extensive ECG data repository and proprietary AI algorithms.

title: Healthcare Triangle launches regional HQ in Singapore to bolster medical innovation in APAC
summary: Healthcare Triangle Inc. has inaugurated its regional headquarters in Singapore, planning to invest $25 million to advance digital healthcare across the Asia Pacific region. This expansion aims to foster medical innovation, create over 500 jobs, and support the digital transformation of healthcare and pharmaceutical sectors by leveraging cloud-based platforms. The company's focus includes strategic partnerships and collaborations to build a more resilient healthcare ecosystem in the APAC region.

title: GM trails far behind Tesla in EV sales — CEO Mary Barra bet the company that will change
summary: GM CEO Mary Barra is betting the company's future on electric vehicles, despite currently trailing far behind Tesla in sales. GM plans to invest $30 billion in EVs by 2025, launch 30 electric models globally, and believes its Ultium platform will enable it to surpass Tesla by mid-decade or 2029. Barra's legacy is tied to transforming GM into an electric leader, building on past efforts to make the company leaner and more agile.

title: iRhythm Technologies receives another FDA 510(k) for AFib monitoring system
summary: iRhythm Technologies has received another FDA 510(k) clearance for its ZEUS System, developed in partnership with Verily, which monitors atrial fibrillation. The latest clearance is for an algorithm that characterizes the amount of AFib a patient experiences over time using PPG-based bio-signals. The ZEUS System is not yet commercially available but is expected to have a limited market release in 2023.

title: 3 Reasons Why Investing in the Nasdaq-100 Is Effective
summary: This article highlights three core reasons why investing in the Nasdaq-100 is effective for long-term asset management. It explains how index investing, particularly in the Nasdaq-100, offers exposure to rapidly growing, innovative global companies with strong brand power and historically high growth rates. The article details various investment products available, such as mutual funds and ETFs, and discusses strategies like currency hedging and leverage.

title: The Critiques Against the American Innovation and Choice Online Act Miss the Mark
summary: Yelp's General Counsel, Aaron Schur, argues that criticisms against the American Innovation and Choice Online Act (AICOA) are unfounded and focus on highly unlikely hypothetical abuses. He contends that concerns about the bill hindering content moderation are misguided, as existing antitrust laws and judicial precedent would prevent such misapplications. Schur asserts that the proposed edits to AICOA are unnecessary, politically unfeasible, and would weaken antitrust enforcement, urging legislators to pass the bill as is to combat real anticompetitive harms.

title: What Does GameStop’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: GameStop (GME) is undergoing a 4-for-1 stock split, its first in 15 years, which will increase the number of shares and decrease the price per share without affecting market capitalization. Morningstar gives GME a 3-star quantitative rating, indicating it is fairly valued, but with extreme uncertainty due to high volatility. This split follows similar actions by other tech and consumer companies like Amazon, Shopify, and Alphabet.

title: Verizon Communications Inc. stock rises Friday, still underperforms market
summary: Verizon Communications Inc. stock increased by 1.05% on Friday to $51.02, despite a strong day for the broader market indexes. The stock's rise ended a two-day losing streak, yet it still closed short of its 52-week high and underperformed key competitors like Apple, Alphabet, and AT&T. Trading volume for Verizon was lower than its 50-day average.

title: What Does Google’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet, is undergoing a 20-for-1 stock split, which will adjust Morningstar's fair value estimate per share to $180, though its competitive advantage and 4-star "undervalued" rating remain unchanged. Analyst Ali Mogharabi identifies YouTube monetization, Maps monetization, and the cloud business as key growth drivers, with strong confidence in Google's continued dominance in the online search market. The article also notes other companies like Amazon, Shopify, and Tesla undertaking similar stock splits.

title: What the Alphabet Stock Split Means for Google Investors
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) announced a 20-for-1 stock split scheduled for July 15, aiming to make its shares more accessible and liquid for investors. While the split is a cosmetic change that doesn't alter fundamentals, it could increase trading activity and allow smaller investors to buy shares. The article advises investors to consider their personal strategy when deciding whether to invest before or after the split, noting that the current market dip combined with the split could make Google more affordable.

title: J.B. Hunt releases metrics on self-driving truck pilot
summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. has released positive metrics from a self-driving truck pilot program on Interstate 45 between Dallas and Houston, in collaboration with Waymo Via. The pilot successfully moved over 860,000 pounds of freight with excellent safety records, leading to a long-term strategic alliance. J.B. Hunt also announced an expansion of its autonomous trucking program with Wayfair for a six-plus week pilot project on the same corridor.

title: Pinterest CEO steps down, Google executive to take over in e-commerce push
summary: Pinterest CEO Ben Silbermann is stepping down after 12 years, handing over the leadership to Google commerce executive Bill Ready. This change signals a strategic shift for Pinterest towards e-commerce initiatives, moving beyond its advertising-based model. Shares rose 9% in extended trading following the announcement.

title: News | Google in Talks To Buy Chicago’s Thompson Center
summary: Google is in negotiations to purchase the James R. Thompson Center in Chicago's Loop business district, a move that could significantly boost the area. This deal is the latest in Google's history of strategic real estate acquisitions in Chicago, and it could provide space for thousands of additional employees. The acquisition could also influence Prime Group's redevelopment plans for the building and the state of Illinois's prior agreement to buy back office space.

title: What Does Shopify’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Shopify is set to undergo a 10-for-1 stock split on June 28, the company's first split since going public in 2015. Morningstar senior equity analyst Dan Romanoff anticipates the fair value estimate will adjust from $450 to $45 per share post-split, with the stock maintaining its 4-star rating. This split does not impact the company's narrow economic moat rating and occurs amidst a lowered fair value estimate due to uncertain e-commerce outlook post-COVID and revised growth assumptions.

title: Microsoft stops selling emotion-reading tech, limits face recognition
summary: Microsoft Corp announced it will stop selling emotion-reading technology based on facial images and will also limit unfettered access to its facial recognition technology. This move aligns with efforts by leading cloud providers to self-regulate sensitive technologies as lawmakers consider new legal limits. Existing customers of emotion-reading tools will have one year before losing access, and facial recognition services will now require approval for use.

title: McDonald's agrees to pay $1.3 bln to settle French tax dispute
summary: McDonald's has agreed to pay $1.3 billion in fines and back taxes to resolve a long-running tax dispute in France, ending a probe into whether the company properly declared its income. The settlement, which covers the years 2009-2020, does not constitute an admission of guilt and concludes both tax and criminal cases against the fast-food giant in France. McDonald's stated it paid over 2.2 billion euros in taxes and created nearly 25,000 jobs in France over that period.

title: L3Harris in talks to buy Israeli spyware firm NSO - reports
summary: U.S. defence contractor L3Harris is reportedly in talks to acquire Israeli spyware firm NSO Group, a deal that would require approvals from U.S. and Israeli authorities and L3Harris's board. The potential acquisition raises concerns in the White House due to NSO's controversial Pegasus software, which has been used by governments to spy on individuals, leading to the company being blacklisted by the U.S. Commerce Department. If approved, the deal could potentially remove NSO from the banned list and allow its assets to be exclusively used with the United States and its allies.

title: C3 AI & Google Cloud: Optimizing Supply Chains
summary: C3 AI announced a new supply chain software product developed in partnership with Google Cloud to address disrupted global supply chains. The C3 AI Supply Chain Suite leverages Google Cloud AI, infrastructure, and Supply Chain Twin to improve demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and supplier lead time visibility, leading to better on-time customer delivery. This collaboration integrates C3 AI's AI capabilities with Google Cloud's powerful infrastructure and data organization for resilient enterprise AI supply chain solutions.

title: Newmark Completes Sale of Moffett Green, Fully-Leased Trophy Campus in Silicon Valley
summary: Newmark has successfully completed the sale of Moffett Green, a 719,037 square-foot, fully-leased trophy office campus in Sunnyvale, California, to CommonWealth Partners, LLC. The transaction, which represents the largest single-asset investment office sale in Silicon Valley history, involved Meta Platforms, Inc. as the long-term tenant. Steven Golubchik and his team at Newmark facilitated the deal, highlighting continued investor demand for prime assets in high-barrier-to-entry markets and the strong performance of Moffett Park.

title: Oracle women stumble in pay bias suit while Google cuts a deal
authors: Malathi Nayak and Robert Burnson and Bloomberg
summary: Women at Oracle Corp. face a setback in their pay disparity lawsuit as a judge tentatively revoked their class-action status, making it more difficult to proceed. Meanwhile, Google agreed to pay $118 million to settle a similar lawsuit alleging pay disparities for more than 15,000 female workers. The Google settlement includes provisions for independent oversight of hiring practices and pay equity studies.

title: Fortinet (FTNT) to Split Stock in 5 to Attract More Investors
summary: Fortinet (FTNT) announced a five-for-one forward stock split to make its shares more accessible to employees and retail investors, with stockholder approval scheduled for June 17. If approved, the stock price will drop from approximately $300 to $60 per share. This move follows similar stock splits by other major tech companies like Alphabet, Amazon, and NVIDIA, aiming to boost demand and potentially increase share prices.

title: Oracle closes $28B deal to buy EHR giant Cerner
summary: Oracle has finalized its $28.3 billion acquisition of health IT company Cerner, marking its largest acquisition to date and a significant move to expand into the healthcare market. The deal, which involved Oracle finalizing a stock tender offer with 69.2% of Cerner shares, aims to leverage Cerner as an "anchor asset" to scale Oracle's cloud business in hospitals and health systems. This acquisition positions Oracle to transform healthcare delivery through new information systems and addresses the growing trend of big tech companies investing heavily in the healthcare IT sector.

title: Didi set to resume app downloads, new user registrations as probe nears end
summary: Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing is expected to have its ban on app downloads and new user registrations lifted soon, signaling the near completion of a cybersecurity investigation by Beijing. This development, reported by The Wall Street Journal, suggests Didi's apps could be reinstated as early as this week. The move follows Didi's agreement to delist from the New York Stock Exchange to satisfy Beijing's demands.

title: Nvidia TAO Toolkit update aims to simplify deep learning model development
summary: Nvidia has updated its TAO Toolkit platform to simplify and accelerate deep learning model creation for enterprise applications, making AI development more accessible and less time-consuming. The toolkit now includes new capabilities like "bring your own model weights" and integration with TensorBoard for better visualization, along with the option to deploy as-a-service with REST APIs. While other companies have also worked on simplifying AI pipelines, analysts note that Nvidia's TAO Toolkit, with its low-code nature and pre-trained models, aims to speed up time-to-market for AI models and reduce the need for extensive data science expertise.

title: KeyBank CIO: ‘Improving CX Is Our Endgame’
summary: KeyBank CIO Amy Brady discusses the bank's extensive cloud transformation to Google Cloud, aiming to move most products and services by 2025. She emphasizes that improving client experiences is the ultimate goal, and highlights the importance of managing cultural and talent challenges alongside technological changes.

title: What Does Amazon's Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Amazon is executing a 20-1 stock split, its first in over two decades, effective June 3. The split will adjust Morningstar's fair value estimate for Amazon to $192 per share from $3,850, but senior analyst Dan Romanoff's long-term view remains unchanged, anticipating continued growth in e-commerce, AWS, and advertising. Other major tech companies like Alphabet and Tesla are also planning stock splits.

title: What Can a Multi-Factor Screening Methodology Do for Your Core Equity Exposure?
summary: This article discusses how applying a multi-factor screening methodology can improve risk-adjusted returns for large-cap equity portfolios. It highlights factors such as value, quality, and momentum, and introduces the FlexShares US Quality Large Cap Index Fund (QLC) which integrates these factors. The fund aims to provide benefits of these factor exposures while maintaining a similar risk profile to the broader large-cap market.

title: What Can a Multi-Factor Screening Methodology Do for Your Core Equity Exposure?
summary: This article discusses how applying a multi-factor screening methodology, focusing on value, quality, and momentum, can enhance core equity exposure for large-cap stock portfolios. It highlights research from FlexShares suggesting that this approach can deliver superior risk-adjusted returns compared to the broad large-cap market. The FlexShares US Quality Large Cap Index Fund (QLC) is presented as an example of an ETF that utilizes these factors.

title: iRobot Unveils iRobot OS - The Most Thoughtfully Intelligent Operating System for the Home
summary: iRobot has launched iRobot OS, a new operating system that enhances the intelligence of its home robots. This OS integrates advanced computer vision and machine learning to offer features like improved pet-centric cleaning, object avoidance, and enhanced voice command capabilities for Roomba j7 and j7+ robot vacuums. iRobot OS is designed to make robot cleaning more effective and adapt to user preferences and home environments.

title: Global Data Annotation Tools Market Size, Share Forecast to 2033
summary: The global data annotation tools market was valued at USD 2.87 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach USD 23.82 billion by 2033, growing at a CAGR of 26.50%. Key growth drivers include the rapid penetration of AI in healthcare and massive data generation via advanced technologies, while the inaccuracy of some tools remains a restraint. Asia Pacific is expected to dominate the market, with North America also showing significant growth.

title: Our Ultimate Stock-Pickers' Top 10 High-Conviction Purchases
summary: The article highlights the top 10 high-conviction purchases by Morningstar's Ultimate Stock-Pickers, focusing on significant additions to portfolios. Despite market volatility and inflation in early 2022, managers found value across various sectors, with Sherwin-Williams, T-Mobile, and Home Depot being particularly notable. Many of these high-conviction and new-money purchases received positive economic moat ratings from Morningstar analysts.

title: Interxion pauses plans for $300 million expansion in Dublin
summary: Interxion has paused a $300 million expansion plan in Dublin due to a de facto moratorium placed on new data center developments in the greater Dublin area by EirGrid, Ireland's national grid operator. This moratorium, which could last until 2028, has led to calls for a nationwide ban and has prompted criticism from various industry bodies, despite local council efforts to prevent further data center construction. The situation highlights the growing pressure on Ireland's energy resources from data centers, which now consume 11 percent of the country's total grid-generated electricity.

title: Music festivals are a UX nightmare. Here’s how Snap and Live Nation are fixing them
summary: Snap and Live Nation are partnering to use augmented reality (AR) to enhance the music festival experience. New Snapchat lenses will debut at the Electric Daisy Carnival, offering features like 3D maps, set lists, directions, and a "FriendFind AR" tool to locate friends in the crowd. This collaboration aims to transform how attendees navigate and interact with large-scale events, going beyond mere selfies to provide practical utility and new engagement opportunities.

title: International Business Machines Corp. stock underperforms Friday when compared to competitors
summary: International Business Machines Corp. (IBM) stock fell 0.91% to $128.48 on Friday, May 20, 2022, underperforming the broader stock market, which saw the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average rise slightly. This marked the third consecutive day of losses for IBM, leaving its stock $17.51 below its 52-week high. While IBM declined, some competitors showed mixed performance, with Apple Inc. (AAPL) rising and Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) and Alphabet Inc. Cl A (GOOGL) falling.

title: QVC in the digital age: Tech giants like YouTube embrace livestream shopping
summary: Tech giants like YouTube are embracing livestream shopping, reimagining the QVC model from the 1990s. YouTube aims to streamline the existing organic behavior of users seeking product reviews on its platform by integrating live video shopping experiences with influencers. This move comes as livestream shopping has become a multi-billion dollar industry, particularly significant in China, and presents a win-win opportunity for creators and viewers by making the process easier and more interactive.

title: Online dating giant Match Group sues Google over app store
summary: Match Group, the company behind popular dating apps like Tinder and OkCupid, has sued Google, alleging an illegal monopoly in the Google Play Store and anticompetitive in-app payment policies. Match Group claims Google's 30% cut of in-app purchases and its mandate to use Google's payment technology are harmful, especially as Google threatened to remove Match apps from the Play Store if they don't comply with new rules. Google, in response, argues Match Group is trying to avoid paying for services and that the majority of apps on its platform do not pay fees.

title: Tinder owner Match sues Google in 'last resort' to avoid app-store booting
summary: Match Group Inc., owner of dating apps like Tinder, has sued Alphabet Inc.'s Google, describing it as a "last resort" to prevent its apps from being removed from the Google Play store. Match is contesting Google's policy of demanding up to 30% of sales from apps and threatening to block downloads unless Match uses Google's payment system exclusively. The lawsuit accuses Google of violating antitrust laws and seeks to protect Match from potentially hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue payments to Google.

title: Walmart, J.B. Hunt Take Lead in Driverless Technology
summary: Walmart Inc. and J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. are leading the adoption of driverless truck technology to enhance supply chain efficiency. Walmart has partnered with Gatik for "middle-mile" deliveries, achieving 200,000 accident-free miles, while J.B. Hunt is collaborating with Waymo on long-haul routes in Texas, delivering 862,000 pounds of freight without incident. These initiatives aim to address increasing consumer demand, driver shortages, and the overall safety and efficiency of freight movement.

title: Korean Webtoon Companies that are giving the Audience Addictive Content
summary: The Korean webtoon industry is experiencing significant global growth, driven by the success of K-culture, despite challenges like increased competition and a decline in artists' average income in 2023. Key players like Lezhin Comics, Naver's Webtoon and Line Manga, KakaoPage, Ridi Corp's Manta, Toomics, and Tappytoon are expanding internationally, leveraging diverse genres, free-reading models, and innovative technologies like AI and NFTs. These companies are not only captivating worldwide audiences but also transforming the global entertainment landscape through partnerships and strategic investments.

title: Class Action Complaint Claims Apple, Google, Snap Liable for Facilitating 'Sexual Grooming' of Minors
summary: Apple, Google, and Snap Inc. are facing a class action lawsuit in California Southern District Court for allegedly enabling the sexual grooming of minors. The suit stems from a criminal case where Snapchat was used to coerce a minor into pornographic acts. The plaintiffs seek to compel the defendants to enforce policies to prevent such criminal conduct and comply with child abuse laws.

title: Vodafone, Cardinality.io and Google Cloud build smarter European network performance platform
summary: Vodafone, Cardinality.io, and Google Cloud have partnered to develop a smarter, pan-European cloud-native network performance platform. This platform will enable Vodafone to manage and enhance its mobile network across eleven European countries more efficiently, using AI to analyze billions of network data points daily. The collaboration aims to accelerate network automation, improve customer experience, and optimize network investments.

title: Tech sell-off pushes Nasdaq to steepest drop since June 2020
summary: A tech sell-off on Thursday, May 5, 2022 pushed the Nasdaq Composite to its steepest drop since June 2020, wiping out hundreds of billions in market value. This downturn was driven by disappointing earnings reports from cloud and e-commerce companies like Shopify, Amazon, and Meta, coupled with investor concerns following the Federal Reserve's interest rate hike to combat inflation. The rotation out of tech began in late 2021 due to inflation fears and escalated with events like Russia's invasion of Ukraine, leading to significant year-to-date losses for many "Covid winner" stocks.

title: Stock Splits Lead to Split Results in Trading
summary: This article analyzes the impact of stock splits on market structure, liquidity, retail investor participation, notional exposure, trade size, odd lots, and volatility in both equities and options markets. Using data from 61 stock splits since 2020, including a case study on Apple (AAPL), the Cboe team found that stock splits do not necessarily increase liquidity proportionally to the split ratio and can lead to a decrease in overall investor capital exposure, though they do increase retail investor participation. The study suggests while splits enhance accessibility, they may not always benefit existing shareholders.

title: With interest rates rising, it's time to focus on MANG stocks instead of FAANG, according to Jefferies
summary: Jefferies analysts recommend focusing on "MANG" stocks (Microsoft, Apple, Nvidia, and Alphabet) over "FAANG + Microsoft" as interest rates rise and the Federal Reserve tightens monetary policy. This shift is presented as a safer investment strategy during an environment of increasing rates. The article highlights the rationale behind prioritizing this particular group of tech giants.

title: With interest rates rising, it's time to focus on MANG stocks instead of FAANG, according to Jefferies
summary: Jefferies analysts recommend focusing on "MANG" stocks (Microsoft, Apple, Nvidia, and Alphabet) instead of the traditional "FAANG + Microsoft" group as interest rates rise. They suggest that MANG stocks present a safer investment strategy during the Federal Reserve's monetary policy tightening. This advice was issued prior to a Federal Open Market Committee meeting.

title: Global Payments Partners with Bakkt, Offering Crypto and Loyalty Programmes
summary: Global Payments Inc. has partnered with Bakkt Holdings, Inc. to expand its cryptocurrency offerings, allowing its customers to pay using digital assets and integrate crypto into various payment solutions. This collaboration will also enable Global Payments to broaden its banking-as-a-service bankcard offerings to include customer access to cryptocurrencies. The partnership is part of Bakkt's ongoing efforts to boost crypto adoption within the payment ecosystem, following similar collaborations with American Bank, Wyndham Hotel, Google, and MasterCard.

title: Crypto Logs: Crypto Goes from Meme to Mainstream
summary: This article discusses the increasing correlation between Bitcoin and broader equity markets, particularly tech stocks, despite a weaker start to 2022 for crypto and blockchain equities. It highlights growing institutional interest in cryptocurrencies, exemplified by Silvergate Capital's customer growth and Fidelity's announcement to offer Bitcoin investments in 401(k) plans, suggesting a move from "meme to mainstream" for crypto. The author posits that increased institutional participation could lead to more efficient trading and research, ultimately benefiting Bitcoin and related equities.

title: Top 10 Growth Stocks by Market Capitalization
summary: This article defines growth stocks and explains how they differ from other investment types, highlighting their potential for capital appreciation and typical reinvestment strategies. It then presents a list of the top 10 large-cap growth stocks as of April 2022, detailing their market capitalization, forward P/E ratio, dividend status, and specific growth drivers for each company. The article also touches on general market performance of growth stocks and factors influencing their volatility.

title: Nasdaq 100 Index: Tech Stocks Lose $1.8 Trillion in a Month Thanks to Fed
summary: Tech investors have experienced the worst start to the year in two decades, with the Nasdaq 100 Index losing over $1.8 trillion in value in April alone. This decline is attributed to a tumultuous earnings season, fears of an economic slowdown, and aggressive expectations regarding the Federal Reserve's rate-hike trajectory, with another hike anticipated next week. Investors are bracing for continued volatility in the market.

title: The Cybersecurity Threats Self-Storage Operators Face Today and How to Defend Against Attacks
summary: This article discusses the increasing cybersecurity threats faced by self-storage operators, who are often targeted due to fewer resources compared to larger companies. It outlines common attack types such as ransomware, spearfishing, cryptomining malware, cloud vulnerabilities, and endpoint attacks. The piece also provides actionable defense strategies including staff training, two-factor authentication, secure wireless networks, fortified endpoints, data backups, and selecting reputable service providers.

title: MOTO & MRAD Rise on Tech Stock Rally
summary: U.S. stocks, particularly technology stocks, climbed on Thursday, with Apple and Amazon's earnings calls anticipated. Meta Platforms' strong first-quarter earnings report, showing an increase in users beyond expectations, boosted the Nasdaq Composite Index and the S&P 500 technology sector. The SmartETFs Advertising & Marketing Technology ETF (MRAD C) and the SmartETFs Smart Transportation & Technology ETF (MOTO) offer exposure to different segments of the technology sector, with MRAD focusing on advertising and marketing technology and MOTO investing in smart transportation and related tech.

title: China Grants First Driverless Taxi Permits to Baidu, Pony.ai
summary: China has issued the first permits for driverless ride-hailing services to Baidu and Pony.ai in Beijing, marking a significant step in the country's pursuit of autonomous driving technology. These permits allow the companies to offer rides to the public without a safety driver behind the wheel, though a safety supervisor is still required in the front passenger seat. Baidu commenced its driverless services in a 23-square-mile suburban Beijing area on April 28.

title: Why AWS, Microsoft, Google, Visa Are Setting Base In Kenya
summary: Major tech companies like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft, Google, and Visa are establishing operations in Kenya due to its growing economy and increasing client demand for cloud computing services. Kenya's strategic location as East Africa's largest economy and a hub for Fortune 500 companies makes it an attractive market for expansion. This move is driven by the need to meet local data residency requirements and capitalize on the burgeoning African cloud computing industry.

title: Does a Musk-owned Twitter dim Tesla’s star?
summary: Elon Musk's bid to buy Twitter has raised concerns about its potential impact on Tesla's reputation and future. Observers question whether this acquisition distracts Musk from Tesla's core mission and if the controversies surrounding Twitter could negatively affect the automaker's brand and stock performance. While some see potential for new alliances and free speech advocacy, others worry about conflicts of interest and potential harm to customer perception and privacy.

title: Tax Breaks Cushion Tesla’s Texas Landing
summary: Tesla received approximately $64 million in state and local tax breaks to build its Giga Texas factory in Austin, sparking debate over the efficacy of such incentives in generating promised economic benefits and jobs. The article highlights concerns that communities often give up more than they gain from these deals, drawing parallels to Tesla's Buffalo factory where job creation targets were not met. Community groups and local residents have raised issues regarding the deal's lack of oversight, potential for wage theft and unsafe conditions, and the challenge of local hiring due to language barriers, leading some local lawmakers to question the wisdom of future incentive deals.

title: GameStop Soars on Plans to Extend Rebound With Stock Split
summary: GameStop (GME) shares soared by as much as 22% in extended trading following the announcement of plans to propose a stock split to shareholders in the form of a dividend. The company intends to ask for approval to increase its Class A shares from 300 million to 1 billion at its upcoming annual meeting. This move led to a significant jump in the stock price, reaching $203.98 after closing at $166.58.

title: IonQ Named As One Of TIME’s 100 Most Influential Companies
summary: IonQ (NYSE: IONQ), a leader in trapped-ion quantum computing, has been recognized on TIME’s annual TIME100 Most Influential Companies list for its leadership in commercializing quantum computing. The company was included in the "New Frontiers" category, acknowledging its extraordinary impact and recent achievements, including the introduction of IonQ Aria, the world's most powerful quantum computer. This recognition follows a year of significant business momentum and technical breakthroughs for IonQ.

title: KKR Values Behavioral-Health Startup Brightline at $705 Million
summary: Behavioral-health startup Brightline announced a valuation of $705 million after securing $105 million in a funding round led by KKR & Co. Existing investors, including Alphabet Inc.'s venture arm GV and Optum Ventures, also participated in the funding. Brightline provides virtual behavioral-health services to children and their families.

title: CEO interview: Silicon Labs’ Matt Johnson on balancing breadth and focus
summary: Matt Johnson, CEO of Silicon Labs, discusses the company's strategic shift to focus entirely on the IoT market after divesting its infrastructure and automotive businesses. He highlights the importance of offering complete, application- and software-led solutions for diverse wireless technologies in IoT, emphasizing security and continuous integration for cost, performance, and power reduction. Johnson also touches on the company's approach to manufacturing and capital deployment, including M&A and share repurchases.

title: Perfect Corp.’s YouCam Apps Reach over 1 Billion Downloads Worldwide
summary: Perfect Corp.'s YouCam Suite of Apps has achieved "Super App" status, surpassing 1 billion global app downloads. The suite, which includes YouCam Makeup, YouCam Perfect, YouCam Video, and YouCam Nail, leverages AI and AR technologies for beauty, photo effects, and video editing, generating 1.68 billion virtual try-ons monthly. The company attributes its success to best-in-class AI and AR innovations, fostering a loyal community that spends over 530 million minutes monthly within the YouCam universe.

title: Independent Sandbox AQ Launches, Prominent Investors Including T. Rowe Price, Eric Schmidt, Breyer Capital, Guggenheim Partners and Thomas Tull, and Customers
summary: Sandbox AQ, an enterprise SaaS company leveraging quantum tech and AI, officially launched with significant backing from prominent investors including T. Rowe Price, Eric Schmidt, Breyer Capital, Guggenheim Partners, and Thomas Tull. Eric Schmidt will serve as chairman of Sandbox AQ’s board of directors, and the company plans to hire additional AI experts, physicists, and engineers. Sandbox AQ is developing commercial products for various sectors, focusing on post-quantum cryptography, drug development, clean energy, and data security, and has already secured global customers like Vodafone Business and Mt. Sinai Health System.

title: MSG Entertainment Names Lucas Watson President, MSG Sphere
summary: Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corp. announced the appointment of Lucas Watson as President, MSG Sphere, effective March 28. In this role, Watson will lead the business strategy and execution for MSG Sphere, the company's planned immersive entertainment venues, including go-to-market planning and bookings. The first MSG Sphere venue is scheduled to open in Las Vegas in the second half of 2023, and Watson will also oversee the global development of the MSG Sphere brand.

title: Amazon announces 20-for-1 stock split
summary: Amazon announced a 20-for-1 stock split, following similar moves by other major tech companies like Alphabet, Apple, and Tesla. The article explains that a stock split divides existing shares into multiple, smaller-priced shares without changing the overall value of an investor's holdings or the company's market capitalization. Stock splits are often done to increase a stock's liquidity and make it more accessible to a wider range of investors, though in an era of fractional shares, some of the practical impact is diminished.

title: Our Ultimate Stock-Pickers' Top 10 Buys and Sells
summary: This article identifies the top 10 high-conviction buys and sells among Morningstar's Ultimate Stock-Pickers for the fourth quarter of 2021, based on an aggregate analysis of their holdings. It highlights key companies like Microsoft and 3M as top buys and Marsh & McLennan as a prominent sell, detailing the Morningstar analysts' fair value estimates, economic moats, and investment theses for these firms. The report assists investors by providing insights into attractive investment ideas and valuation considerations.

title: EA, Oracle Among Companies Heeding Ukraine Plea to Stop Business in Russia
summary: Ukraine has requested that approximately 50 tech companies, including Oracle and EA, cease operations in Russia to isolate the country and pressure its government following military action. In response, Oracle announced the suspension of all operations in the Russian Federation, and EA Sports committed to removing Russian national and club teams from its FIFA games. Other major companies like Spotify, Twitter, Meta, Microsoft, and Google have also taken steps to restrict Russian state media or suspend services in Russia.

title: Tripadvisor, Google Maps Suspend Reviews of Some Russian Listings
summary: Google Maps and Tripadvisor have temporarily suspended new user reviews for certain listings in Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus. This action was taken in response to a flood of political statements posted as reviews, driven by a social media campaign urging activists to communicate with Russians via these platforms about the war in Ukraine. The companies aim to prevent the publishing of off-topic and abusive content.

title: At Snap Inc., Making Augmented Reality Work for Fashion
summary: Snap Inc. is making significant strides in augmented reality (AR) for the fashion industry, with over 200 million Snapchat users engaging with AR daily. Peter Sellis, VP of Product at Snap Inc., discusses how AR technologies, including virtual try-ons and spatial technology, are evolving to enhance shopping experiences, reduce returns, and increase conversions for brands like Prada, Farfetch, and Gucci.
