The commercial benefits and future product innovations, such as cloth simulation and 3D asset management, are highlighted as key drivers for investment in AR within fashion.

title: Google, Meta face penalties in Russia as deadline passes to open local offices
summary: Google and Meta are among several internet companies facing potential penalties in Russia for failing to establish local offices and comply with a new communications law. Russia's state communications regulator, Roskomnadzor, had set a deadline of the end of February for these companies to open local offices or face restrictions. The move is part of Russia's broader effort to control internet content, with fines previously issued for failing to censor anti-government content, and recent curtailments of access to platforms like Facebook in retaliation for censoring state media.

title: KYNDRYL REPORTS FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL-YEAR 2021 RESULTS
summary: Kyndryl Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: KD) reported its fourth-quarter and full-year 2021 financial results, with full-year revenues totaling $18.7 billion and a net loss of $2.3 billion. The company is strategically positioning itself for growth through new partnerships with cloud hyperscalers and key initiatives focused on increasing signings, transforming service delivery, and addressing substandard margins. Kyndryl also announced significant strategic partnerships with major cloud providers and an expanded customer base following its spin-off from IBM.

title: CRM giant Salesforce acquiring B.C.’s Traction on Demand
summary: Salesforce.com Inc. is acquiring B.C.-based software firm Traction on Demand, which specializes in implementing marketing strategies using Salesforce's CRM services. The Burnaby-based company employs about 500 workers across British Columbia, and its founder had previously resisted selling the company. This acquisition follows Salesforce's recent spree of purchases, including Mobify and Slack Technologies Inc.

title: Exclusive: Singapore flags concern to India over ban on Sea's game -sources
summary: Singapore has expressed concerns to India regarding its ban on the popular gaming app "Free Fire," owned by Sea Ltd, marking the first diplomatic intervention since the ban. The move significantly impacted Sea's market value, and investors are worried about potential extensions to Sea's e-commerce app, Shopee. India had banned the app among others, citing data transfer to Chinese servers, a claim Sea refutes, stating it is a Singaporean company compliant with Indian law.

title: LG AI Research forms 'Hyperscale' AI alliance with 13 companies
summary: LG AI Research has formed an alliance with 13 companies and organizations to expand the use of its hyperscale AI engine, Exaone. The alliance aims to apply Exaone's capabilities, which include 300 billion parameters and multi-modal functions, across various sectors like IT, finance, and medical fields. Members will benefit from technologies such as Exaone Tuning, API access, and Exaone Playground, while contributing to the AI's further development and adoption.
source: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
source_domain: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition

title: Kraft Heinz taps Google for multiyear transformation push
summary: Kraft Heinz announced a multiyear strategic partnership with Google to accelerate its digital transformation, leveraging Google Cloud's AI and ML to drive food innovations, build a customer data platform, and improve media efficiency. This initiative is part of Kraft Heinz's broader strategy to reinvest in its brands and achieve cost savings by 2024, enabling data-driven decisions as consumer behavior shifts online. The partnership aims to enhance personalization at scale, optimize media activations, and address changing market challenges amid the pandemic.

title: Kraft Heinz Names Miguel Patricio as Chair Following Alex Behring's Retirement and James Park's Election to Board of Directors; Greg Abel Comments
summary: The Kraft Heinz Company announced leadership changes to its Board of Directors, with CEO Miguel Patricio slated to become the new Chair following Alex Behring's retirement. Additionally, technology entrepreneur James Park will be nominated for election to the Board. These changes aim to continue strong leadership and integrate technology expertise into the company's strategy.

title: Salesforce ties executive compensation to ESG goals
summary: Salesforce announced that a portion of executive variable pay for those at the executive vice president level and above will be tied to ESG measures, starting this fiscal year. These measures will focus on increasing representation for diverse employees and reducing air travel emissions, as well as increasing spend with suppliers signed onto Salesforce's Sustainability Exhibit. This move reflects a growing trend among major companies to link executive compensation to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) and sustainability goals.

title: JPMorgan Chase, Toshiba and Ciena Build the First Quantum Key Distribution Network Used to Secure Mission-Critical Blockchain Application
summary: JPMorgan Chase, Toshiba, and Ciena have successfully built and demonstrated the first quantum key distribution (QKD) network for metropolitan areas, securing a mission-critical blockchain application. This groundbreaking research proves the viability of QKD to detect and defend against potential quantum computing attacks, supporting 800 Gbps data rates under real-world conditions. The network secured Liink by J.P. Morgan, the world's first bank-led, production-grade, peer-to-peer blockchain network, showcasing the technology's effectiveness against future quantum threats.

title: Billionaire George Soros reveals stake in Rivian, sells some tech shares
summary: Billionaire George Soros' investment fund, Soros Fund Management, acquired a significant stake in electric-pickup maker Rivian Automotive Inc., purchasing nearly 20 million shares worth approximately $2 billion in Q4. This move was disclosed in a recent SEC filing. At the same time, Soros' fund also trimmed positions in major tech companies like Amazon and Alphabet.

title: Copyright case: Google LLC v. Oracle America Inc., USA
authors: Thomas Long (Wolters Kluwer Legal & Regulatory US)
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled in favor of Google LLC in a significant copyright case against Oracle America, Inc. The Court determined that Google's use of approximately 11,000 lines of code from Java SE API for its Android mobile operating system constituted fair use and did not infringe on Oracle's copyright. This decision, dubbed "the copyright case of the decade" by Google, was a six-to-two ruling.

title: Can A Vintage T. Rowe Price Fund Ride Rivian, Microsoft And Snap To The Moon?
summary: Portfolio manager Joe Fath is revitalizing the T. Rowe Price Growth Stock Fund, founded in 1950, by investing heavily in new tech companies and focusing on "disruptive change," contrasting with the fund's historical picks like IBM. Despite facing outflows to passive management, Fath's strategy involves concentrated bets in private companies like Rivian, and public tech giants such as Microsoft, achieving significant returns. He remains confident in these high-growth, high-volatility investments, believing their long-term growth profiles will ultimately reward shareholders.

title: Want Exposure To Google? 2 Communication Services ETFs Holding Alphabet Shares
summary: This article discusses two Communication Services ETFs, the Fidelity MSCI Telecommunication Services Index ETF (FCOM) and the iShares Global Comm Services ETF (IXP), that offer significant exposure to Alphabet shares. It highlights Alphabet's strong Q4 and FY 2021 results, including a 20-for-1 stock split, and reviews the holdings, performance, and key metrics of each ETF for investors looking to capitalize on the growth in this sector.

title: Nvidia’s $40bn takeover of UK chip designer Arm collapses
summary: Nvidia's $40bn takeover of UK chip designer Arm has collapsed due to insurmountable regulatory hurdles, leading Arm to pursue a stock market flotation instead. The deal, which had been valued as high as $75bn, faced fierce opposition and regulatory scrutiny in multiple regions, including the US, UK, and China. Softbank will now prepare Arm for an IPO and receive a $1.25bn break-up fee from Nvidia.

title: Google Cloud Announces Cloud-First Partnership with KeyBank
summary: Google Cloud, KeyBank, and Deloitte have announced an expanded, multi-year strategic partnership to accelerate KeyBank's cloud-first approach to banking. KeyBank will become one of the largest regional banks to operate its primary platforms and applications on Google Cloud, leveraging AI and data solutions to deliver enhanced digital experiences. Deloitte will facilitate the migration of KeyBank's infrastructure to Google Cloud, with the goal of moving the majority of its products and services to the cloud by 2025.

title: Alphabet eyes $2 trillion value after blowout results
summary: Alphabet Inc. is on the verge of joining Apple and Microsoft in the $2 trillion market valuation club after a strong quarterly report led to an over 8% surge in its shares. The company also announced a 20-to-1 stock split, aiming to make shares more accessible to retail investors. At least 20 brokerages raised their price targets on Alphabet's stock.

title: NICE Expands Partnership with Google, Adding CXone to the Chrome Enterprise Recommended Program
summary: NICE has expanded its partnership with Google, integrating its CXone customer experience platform into the Chrome Enterprise Recommended program. This optimization allows organizations using Chrome OS devices to leverage CXone's comprehensive suite of CX applications for efficient work-from-anywhere capabilities, enhancing both agent and customer experiences. The move reinforces NICE's commitment to providing next-gen, digitally fluent experiences on Chrome OS, supporting millions of interactions for various businesses.

title: Alphabet Stock Split: A Win for Retail Investors … And the Dow?
summary: Alphabet's 20-for-1 stock split aims to make its shares more accessible to retail investors and potentially opens the door for its inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. While fundamentally inconsequential, the split could provide a tailwind for GOOGL stock. Its impact on the Dow would also be significant, altering sector weighting and index composition considerations.

title: Alphabet brings big stock splits back to market
authors: Jeran Wittenstein and Vivianne Rodrigues and Bloomberg
summary: Alphabet Inc. announced a 20-for-1 stock split, aiming to make its shares more accessible to small investors by reducing the per-share price. This move is also seen as a step towards potential inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which has historically been a barrier due to Alphabet's high stock price. The announcement led to a 10% jump in shares during premarket trading.

title: Google parent Alphabet is splitting its stock 20-for-1. Here's why, and what it means for investors.
summary: Alphabet announced a 20-for-1 stock split to make its shares more affordable and appealing to smaller investors, with Class A shares potentially dropping to around $138 from over $2,750. This move could also facilitate its entry into the Dow Jones Industrial Average, although the company's fundamentals and market capitalization will remain unchanged. All shareholders will receive 19 additional shares of the same class as a dividend on July 15 if the plan is approved.

title: Google's parent company Alphabet announces 20-for-1 stock split
summary: Alphabet, Google's parent company, announced a 20-for-1 stock split during its quarterly earnings report, aiming to make shares more accessible. The split, which applies to all share classes (A, B, and C), is pending shareholder approval and would take effect in July 2022. This move follows a significant doubling of Alphabet's stock value in the preceding two years, with each share potentially revalued to $137.64 from $2,752.88 after the split.

title: Univision, Televisa Complete $4.8B Merger
summary: Grupo Televisa, S.A.B and Univision Holdings II, Inc. have completed their $4.8 billion merger, creating TelevisaUnivision, Inc., a new company poised to reach over 100 million Spanish-language speakers daily across TV, digital, and audio. The newly formed entity plans to launch a major streaming service in 2022, featuring free and premium tiers with a vast offering of original Spanish-language entertainment, sports, and news. New investors in TelevisaUnivision include SoftBank Latin America Fund, Google, and The Raine Group.

title: Income Is The Outcome
summary: The article discusses the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income Fund, an income-oriented fund that uses equity-linked notes (ELNs) and options premiums to generate substantial income for investors. Despite underperforming market benchmarks in total return, its strategy prioritizes income generation and aims to reduce volatility, allowing investors to stay invested in equities in a more defensive manner. The fund's co-portfolio manager, Hamilton Reiner, explains how the use of ELNs converts options premiums into bona fide income and how market volatility influences the income generated.

title: Google parent Alphabet announces 20-for-1 stock split
summary: Alphabet, Google's parent company, announced a 20-for-1 stock split following a surge in its stock price. This move aims to make shares more accessible to a wider range of investors by significantly lowering the per-share cost. The split requires shareholder approval and will involve Class A, B, and C shares, with existing holders receiving 19 additional shares for each one they own by July 15.

title: Google (GOOGL) announces 20-for-1 stock split
summary: Google's parent company Alphabet announced a 20-for-1 stock split proposal, aiming to make Google stock more affordable and abundant for investors. This news followed an impressive Q4 2021 earnings report where Google beat Wall Street expectations, driven by investments in AI and strong Pixel phone sales. If approved, existing shareholders by July 1, 2022, will receive 19 additional shares for each original share by July 15.

title: 11 Undervalued Mega-Cap Stocks to Consider
summary: This article identifies 11 undervalued mega-cap stocks that investors should consider, defining mega-caps as companies with market capitalizations over $200 billion. It highlights that the recent market downturn has brought many such stocks into buying range, including detailed analysis for Alphabet, Amazon.com, and AT&T.

title: How to Invest in the Top 100 U.S. ESG Companies
summary: The article discusses the 2022 list of top 100 U.S. ESG companies compiled by Just Capital, highlighting major movements like Alphabet's rise and Meta's fall. It explains the methodology behind the rankings, which prioritize issues important to Americans, and introduces the Goldman Sachs JUST U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF (JUST) as a way to invest in companies demonstrating "just business behavior."

title: Chip giant Nvidia expands R&D operations in Israel
summary: Nvidia is expanding its R&D operations in Israel by establishing a new design and engineering group focused on next-generation CPUs for AI, robotics, and autonomous vehicles. The company, which acquired Israel's Mellanox Technologies in 2020, plans to hire additional engineers in Israel, further solidifying the country's role as Nvidia's largest R&D hub outside the US. This expansion intensifies competition for tech talent in Israel, where both Nvidia and Intel have significant R&D presence, and Google is also entering the chip-making sector.

title: A Full List Of Uber Subsidiaries [& How They Benefit Uber]
summary: This article details Uber's various subsidiaries, including Uber Eats, Uber Freight, and UberWAV, alongside its corporate structure and key leadership. It also outlines significant acquisitions such as Jump Bikes, Careem, Drizly, and Postmates, and discusses previously owned entities like Raiser LLC and Xchange Leasing. The piece highlights Uber's expansion into a global transportation and e-commerce giant, aiming for a future with driver-less transportation.

title: Here’s How Warren Buffett Persuaded Google’s Reluctant Founders to Go Public
summary: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page were initially hesitant to take their company public due to fears of losing control. A serendipitous meeting with Warren Buffett, who shared his strategy of a two-tier stock structure used at Berkshire Hathaway, convinced them that they could go public while retaining control. This led Google to adopt a similar stock structure for its IPO and publish an "Owner's Manual" outlining their long-term philosophy for shareholders.

title: J.B. Hunt, Waymo expand partnership on self-driving truck technology
summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. and Waymo Via are expanding their strategic alliance to integrate commercial autonomous driving technology into transportation and logistics, aiming for fully autonomous transport in Texas within the next few years. This long-term partnership builds on a successful 2021 pilot and will include multiple trials to analyze the operational capacity of Waymo Via's autonomous Class 8 trucking unit. The collaboration also seeks to merge autonomous driving technology with J.B. Hunt’s digital freight marketplace and refine the technology's commercial readiness.

title: PacBio and Google Collaborate to Use Machine Learning to Optimize Long-Read Sequencing Data Analysis
summary: PacBio announced a research collaboration with Google to use machine learning to optimize long-read sequencing data analysis. This collaboration aims to improve PacBio's HiFi sequencing accuracy and data output by integrating Google's genomic analysis, machine learning, and algorithm development tools. The partnership is expected to further enhance variant calling and unlock more insights from PacBio sequencing data for various applications.

title: Akron Marathon registration details, sponsorships announced
summary: Registration for the 20th Akron Marathon Race Series opens on January 20, with early registration for eligible participants starting on January 18. Key sponsors FirstEnergy Corp., Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co., and National Interstate Insurance Co. have renewed their support through 2024. The article outlines the dates and locations for the various races, including the National Interstate 8K and 1 Mile, Goodyear Half Marathon and 10K, and the FirstEnergy Akron Marathon, Half Marathon, and team relay.

title: Santa Barbara-Based Company Wins Legal Battle Against Google Over Patent
summary: Santa Barbara-based company Sonos won a legal battle against Google, with the U.S. International Trade Commission ruling that Google infringed on five Sonos patents related to smart speaker technology. This ruling includes a cease-and-desist order and an import ban on infringing Google products, specifically concerning Google's Nest speakers and their volume adjustment capabilities. Sonos has two additional patent-infringement cases against Google pending in federal courts.

title: JVAL Stock Price | JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF
summary: This article provides detailed information about the JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF (JVAL), including its current stock price, trading exchange (NYSE), and comprehensive financial metrics such as dividend yield, expense ratio, and market capitalization. It also offers technical analysis insights and lists the ETF's top holdings, outlining its investment strategy as a value-focused equity fund targeting the U.S. market.

title: Qualcomm inks car chip deals with Volvo, Honda and Renault
summary: Qualcomm announced deals to supply chips to automakers Volvo Group, Honda Motor Co Ltd, and Renault SA, accelerating its push into the automotive sector. The company will provide its "Snapdragon Cockpit" chips for digital dashboards and infotainment systems, aiming to help car manufacturers transform vehicles into rolling computers capable of over-the-air updates and generating recurring revenue. Qualcomm also unveiled a new chip and system, "Snapdragon Ride Vision System," for computer vision and safety features, utilizing technology from its recent acquisition of Arriver.

title: Smart Water for a Smarter Home: Moen Leads the Way with Industry's First Whole-Home Connected Water Product Suite
summary: Moen introduces the industry's first whole-home smart water ecosystem, the Moen Smart Water Network, which allows consumers to control, monitor, and conserve water throughout their homes using a single smartphone app. The network includes new and expanded smart products like the Flo Smart Water Monitor and Shutoff, Smart Leak Detector, Smart Sump Pump Monitor, Smart Faucet with Motion Control, and Smart Shower, all designed to provide peace of mind, security, and personalized water experiences. These innovations offer automated water security, water usage education, personalized settings, and voice activation capabilities for a truly connected home water system.

title: LINGA rOS and Evertec Pursue Hospitality Market and other Digital Transactions News briefs from 12/30/21
summary: LINGA rOS and Evertec Inc. are partnering to target the hospitality market in the Caribbean and Latin America. Separately, Cantaloupe Inc. is launching an AI/machine learning service called Enhance for its Seed customers, while SuperCom Ltd.'s chairman bought 512,000 shares of company stock. Additionally, Mercator Advisory Group released a report on managing processing costs, and FIS Inc. and Global Payments Inc. were noted among the worst-performing S&P 500 stocks in 2021.

title: Digital Turbine Announces Strategic Partnership with Google
summary: Digital Turbine has announced a multi-year strategic partnership with Google to enhance its product and growth strategy for the Android ecosystem. This collaboration aims to enable nearly a billion devices with intelligent app discovery and will involve Digital Turbine utilizing Google Cloud's enterprise and cloud solutions for global expansion and to broaden its growth and monetization offerings. The partnership will power app discovery for Android devices across mobile, TV, and connected devices, further deepening Digital Turbine's involvement in the Android ecosystem.

title: Apple's App Store broke competition laws, Dutch watchdog says
summary: The Netherlands' competition regulator, ACM, has found that Apple Inc. broke competition laws with its App Store payment policies, specifically concerning dating apps. Apple is ordered to allow alternative payment systems for dating apps and faces a fine of up to 50 million euros if it fails to comply by January 15. Apple has stated it disagrees with the order and has filed an appeal.

title: 9 ETFs For Exposure To Communications, Consumer Staples, Discretionary Sectors
summary: This article reviews nine ETFs offering exposure to the Communication Services, Consumer Discretionary, and Consumer Staples sectors. It details the holdings, performance, and key financial metrics of several ETFs within each sector, including their top companies and year-to-date returns. The article serves as a guide for investors looking to gain diversified exposure to these specific segments of the S&P 500 index.

title: 5 things to know about Oracle after $28.3 billion acquisition of Kansas City’s Cerner
summary: Oracle has announced a $28.3 billion acquisition of Cerner Corp., Kansas City's largest private employer, marking one of the year's biggest deals. This move signifies Oracle's growing push into the healthcare industry, following similar expansions by other tech giants. The acquisition brings together Oracle, an $280 billion company with 133,000 employees globally, and Cerner, valued at $23 billion with 28,000 employees worldwide, notably 13,000 in Kansas City.

title: About IBS Bulgaria
summary: IBS Bulgaria is helping regional banks modernize their critical systems to comply with the PSD2 directive. They developed a new open banking platform powered by IBM API Connect and IBM Cloud Pak for Integration technology, resulting in reduced integration times and significant cost reductions for their clients. This solution allows banks to quickly adapt to new regulations and services, with approximately 90% of open banking in Bulgaria now relying on IBM integration technology.

title: Pearson Announces Omid Kordestani as Non-Executive Chair Designate and Tim Score as Deputy Chair Designate
summary: Pearson plc announced the appointments of Omid Kordestani as Non-Executive Chair Designate and Tim Score as Deputy Chair Designate. Kordestani, known for his leadership roles at tech companies like Google and Twitter, will succeed Sidney Taurel as Non-Executive Chair in April 2022. Score, Pearson's Senior Independent Director, will assume the Deputy Chair role at the same time, bringing extensive experience from the technology sector.

title: The Invesco QQQ Stock Price Is Up 23.7% Since January. Could There Be More Gains?
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ) has seen its stock price rise 23.7% since January, driven by major tech companies like Apple and Google, despite recent pullbacks. Investors are closely watching the Federal Reserve's monetary policy meeting for potential hawkish policies that could further impact the Nasdaq index and the QQQ ETF. While the ETF is currently in a downtrend, its present stock price may be attractive for a future rally, though a clear upward trend based on EMA crossings is yet to materialize.

title: Uber, Google, Ford Delay Office Return as Omicron’s Spread Threatens Business Districts
summary: Office-building owners and small businesses are bracing for another delay in employee returns to the workplace as the Omicron variant threatens widespread company plans. Major companies like Lyft, Ford, Uber, and Google have modified or delayed their return-to-office plans, although not all explicitly cite the new variant as the reason. This uncertainty impacts business districts that rely on office workers for economic activity.

title: Is Saudi Aramco Stock a Good Buy? • (TADAWUL: 2222)
summary: This article analyzes whether Saudi Aramco stock is a good buy, considering its status as one of the world's largest companies, financial performance, and future outlook. It provides guidance on how to gain exposure to the stock through ETFs, discusses its stock history and value, and presents both bull and bear cases from analysts. The article concludes with a "hold" recommendation due to uncertainties in the global economy and the stock's relatively muted performance despite strong oil prices.

title: 4 Charts on Apple's $3 Trillion Market Cap
summary: Apple Inc. has become the first company to achieve a $3 trillion market capitalization, briefly hitting $182.88 per share. This article highlights the immense scale of Apple's market cap through various comparisons, such as its value exceeding the total market cap of all public companies in Canada. It also discusses Apple's dominance within the U.S. market, making up nearly 22% of all U.S.-domiciled technology companies' total market capitalization.

title: Adobe buys social media marketing startup ContentCal
summary: Adobe Inc. has acquired ContentCal, a six-year-old social media marketing startup, for an undisclosed sum reported to be over $100 million. ContentCal’s platform helps businesses manage social marketing planning and processes, offering tools for collaboration, scheduling, and performance tracking. This acquisition is expected to enhance Adobe's creative tools with expanded social media capabilities, following its earlier purchase of Frame.io Inc.

title: Innovator Interview: JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Tracy-Ann Lim
summary: Tracy-Ann Lim, Chief Media Officer at JPMorgan Chase & Co., discusses how her agency experience prepared her for the rapid changes brought by the pandemic, particularly the acceleration of digital engagement. She also details JPMorgan Chase’s brand pillars of Impact and Integrity, the challenges and adaptations for a cookieless future, and the evolving role of media in crisis communication and inclusivity. Lim emphasizes the importance of agility, customer experience, and discoverability in the future of media.

title: Ingram Micro Acquires Brlink, Strengthening Its Partner Ecosystem with New Managed Services
summary: Ingram Micro has acquired BRLink, a leading managed services provider in Brazil, to enhance its cloud services portfolio and strengthen its partner ecosystem. This acquisition positions Ingram Micro as the sole distributor in Brazil capable of offering complete cloud migration services, leveraging BRLink's expertise in managed services, data analysis, and artificial intelligence. BRLink will continue to operate as a business unit within Ingram Micro Brazil, led by its founder Rafael Marangoni, supporting Ingram Micro's growth in the rapidly expanding Latin American cloud market.

title: US-Based Equinix Acquires Nigerian Digital Infrastructure Firm MainOne for $320m
summary: US-based Equinix Inc. is acquiring Nigerian digital infrastructure firm MainOne Cable Co Ltd. for $320 million, marking Equinix's first entry into the African market. MainOne, founded by Funke Opeke, operates three data centers with a fourth under construction, alongside plans for a sub-sea cable connecting Portugal to several West African nations. This acquisition positions Equinix to capitalize on the rapidly growing demand for data use and storage capacity in Africa, while providing MainOne with crucial capital and network access for its expansion.

title: Tile owner Life360 could be selling precise location data of millions: Report
summary: A new report suggests that Life360, the recent acquirer of Tile and a popular family safety app used by 33 million people, is reportedly selling precise location data to data brokers. Former employees of data brokers revealed that Life360 serves as a significant source of this sensitive information, generating substantial revenue from its sale. While Life360's CEO acknowledged data sales as part of their business model to keep services free, he stated no plans to sell data from Tile devices.

title: The metaverse needs aggressive regulation
summary: The author, a pioneer in AR/VR technology, argues for aggressive regulation of the metaverse to prevent large corporations from extensive monitoring and manipulation of users. He emphasizes the need to restrict data collection, regulate real-time marketing tactics, and ensure transparency regarding AI-controlled agents and targeted placements. The article warns that without regulation, the metaverse risks becoming an environment where powerful entities exploit user data and emotions for commercial gain.

title: Deloitte buys Oracle Cloud specialist BIAS Corporation
summary: Deloitte US has acquired BIAS Corporation, an IT consultancy specializing in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), to enhance its cloud migration capabilities. BIAS, founded in 2000, has over 350 employees and was recognized as an Oracle Global and North American Partner of the Year. This acquisition addresses the increasing demand for cloud services and follows Deloitte's fiscal year 2021 revenue growth to over $50 billion.

title: Adopt a data-centric approach to cyber security
summary: This article emphasizes the need for organizations to shift from traditional perimeter-based security to a data-centric approach for cybersecurity. It highlights the importance of discovering and classifying data, implementing a layered security framework, and balancing security with usability. The article also discusses the advantages of cloud-native architectures and emerging AI-based tools for enhancing data protection against evolving cyber threats.

title: 6 GHz readies for new users as AFC wannabees stack up
summary: A growing number of companies have applied to become Automated Frequency Coordination (AFC) system operators for the unlicensed 6 GHz band, a crucial step to enable standard power operations for new applications. These AFC systems will facilitate outdoor operations, highly directional indoor antennas, and higher power indoor uses, with applicants including major tech and telecom firms. The market for AFC operators is expected to allow for diverse business models and innovation, particularly with the adoption of a standardized interface for device makers.

title: Meet the top 7 Indian Americans CEOs in corporate America
summary: This article highlights seven prominent Indian American CEOs leading major US corporations, whose combined revenue in 2020 exceeded $530 billion. It details the careers and achievements of individuals like Sundar Pichai (Alphabet/Google), Satya Nadella (Microsoft), and Parag Agrawal (Twitter), showcasing their rise in corporate America. The piece also provides context on the historical progression of Indian Americans into top executive roles since the 1990s.

title: Observing Attacks Against Hundreds of Exposed Services in Public Clouds
summary: Unit 42 researchers deployed a global honeypot infrastructure of 320 nodes to study attacks against exposed services in public clouds. They found that 80% of honeypots were compromised within 24 hours and all within a week, highlighting the rapid pace at which attackers exploit misconfigured services. The research emphasizes the ineffectiveness of IP-based firewalls and the critical need for quick vulnerability remediation in cloud environments.

title: FedEx Sees 10% Rise in Holiday Package Volume to Record Levels
summary: FedEx Corp. is forecasting a 10% increase in holiday package deliveries compared to an already record-breaking peak season in 2020, driven by continued consumer reliance on internet shopping. This volume represents 100 million more packages than pre-pandemic levels in 2019, with Cyber Monday alone expected to handle 32 million packages worldwide. Despite significant investments to handle the volume, the company faces challenges from worker shortages and supply chain congestion, which have increased costs by $450 million in its latest quarter.

title: Why Sabre is betting against multi-cloud
summary: Sabre, a travel technology company, has entered a 10-year, $2 billion partnership with Google Cloud, committing to a single cloud provider despite the prevailing multi-cloud trend among large enterprises. CIO Joe DiFonzo explains that an initial multi-cloud exploration led them to realize the inefficiencies of managing disparate architectures and the benefits of leveraging a single vendor's full capabilities and engineering mindset. This decision allows Sabre to focus on modernizing operations, decomposing applications into microservices, and integrating AI-powered services by leaning on Google's extensive technological advancements.

title: Global X signals intent in Europe with seven thematic ETF launches
summary: Global X has launched seven new thematic ETFs in Europe, expanding its UCITS range to 12 products. These ETFs cover various themes including autonomous vehicles, clean tech, cybersecurity, e-commerce, fintech, IoT, and robotics/AI, with TERs ranging from 0.50% to 0.60%. This move signifies Global X's robust growth and commitment to offering targeted exposure to disruptive global themes for European investors.

title: Alphabet (Google) targets $250m+ third quake catastrophe bond
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., is seeking to raise at least $250 million in California earthquake risk protection through its third catastrophe bond issuance, Phoenician Re Ltd. (Series 2021-1). This issuance will bring the total capital markets-backed earthquake coverage for Alphabet to over $580 million, demonstrating the company's continued reliance on ILS investors for efficient risk transfer. The new bond prices more aggressively than previous issues, reflecting a softening cat bond market in 2021.

title: Mario Gabelli Has an Astonishing Portfolio and Net Worth
summary: This article details the career and financial success of Mario Gabelli, founder, chairman, and CEO of GAMCO Investors. It highlights his astonishing portfolio holdings, including top picks in the Gabelli Multimedia Trust and Gabelli Equity Income Fund, and notes his substantial net worth of $2 billion. The piece also lists some of his top stock picks and the various boards he serves on.

title: Luxury NFTs Could Become a $56 Billion Market by 2030: Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley projects that luxury-branded non-fungible tokens (NFTs) could grow into a $56 billion market by 2030, driven significantly by increased demand stemming from the metaverse. The bank highlights how luxury brands are already engaging with digital assets through gaming and metaverse platforms, offering new revenue streams and broader audience reach. This shift is expected to capitalize on the increasing digitalization of consumer lives and the customization of virtual avatars.

title: IonQ Announces Third Quarter 2021 Financial Results
summary: IonQ announced its third-quarter 2021 financial results, highlighting total contract value (TCV) bookings of $15.1 million year-to-date and updated its 2021 TCV bookings guidance to $15.8 million at the midpoint. The company also reported significant technological milestones, including industry-first error correction demonstration and superior quantum computer performance, alongside strategic collaborations and a strong financial position after its business combination. Financial highlights included $223 thousand in revenue for the quarter, $587 million in cash and cash equivalents, and a net loss of $14.8 million.

title: Annual Small Business Saturday Bringing a Digitally Integrated Holiday Shopping Experience to Communities
summary: American Express announced its 12th annual Small Business Saturday on November 27th, aiming to drive $100 billion in consumer spending at small businesses by 2025. The campaign includes new marketing initiatives, a Google Shopping collaboration for shoppable digital murals, a Shop Small x ByBlack online marketplace, and a new grant program with Main Street America to support underrepresented small businesses. These efforts reflect a critical need for holiday sales for small businesses, with 78% stating holiday sales impact their ability to stay open in the coming year.

title: American Tower nears $10 billion deal to buy CoreSite
summary: American Tower Corp. is set to acquire CoreSite Realty Corp. in a deal valued at approximately $10.1 billion, including debt. The acquisition reflects ongoing consolidation in the data center REIT sector, driven by increasing demand for data infrastructure and cloud computing services. CoreSite operates 24 data centers and generates revenue not only from leasing but also from power and interconnection services.

title: Microsoft’s shift to the cloud is a lesson in corporate evolution
summary: This article details Microsoft's successful transition to cloud computing, highlighting the internal and external challenges faced and overcome. It examines how the company, under both Steve Ballmer and later Satya Nadella, navigated customer skepticism and internal resistance to redefine its business model. The narrative emphasizes the importance of anticipating market shifts and making bold strategic decisions even when ahead of current customer demand.

title: Network Security at Ignite ‘21: What to Expect
summary: Palo Alto Networks' Ignite '21 virtual event, running November 15-18, will feature a "Firewall Track" focusing on network security for the Zero Trust Enterprise and best practices for NGFW deployment. The event highlights Palo Alto Networks' tenth consecutive recognition as a Leader in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Network Firewalls and includes key speakers from companies like Cox Communications, AT&T, FTDI, Google, and Accenture, alongside Palo Alto Networks leaders. Sessions will cover protecting container deployments, leveraging Cloud IDS, managing identity in hybrid environments, optimizing firewall management with Panorama, and new ML-Powered NGFW technologies.

title: Facebook Is Under Fire, but It's Also Undervalued
summary: Despite ongoing controversies, regulatory scrutiny, and a company name change to Meta Platforms, Morningstar's analysis suggests that the stock is undervalued, trading at a 16% discount to its fair value estimate. The article highlights Meta's two business segments—its legacy apps and the new Reality Labs for metaverse development—and discusses the potential impacts of regulatory and antitrust risks, concluding that the stock remains the most attractive social-media play in Morningstar's coverage. The company's revenue growth is primarily driven by advertising, leveraging its vast user base and the shift towards online spending, while its wide economic moat is based on network effects and intangible data assets.

title: 26-Year-Old Alex Rodrigues Becomes Youngest Current CEO Of A Publicly Traded Company With $5 Billion Embark SPAC Merger
summary: Alex Rodrigues, at 26, has become the youngest current CEO of a publicly traded company after his autonomous trucking software company, Embark, went public via a $5 billion SPAC merger. Rodrigues, who developed a self-driving golf cart at 19, founded Embark to focus on 18-wheelers, aiming to revolutionize the trucking industry. He is estimated to be worth $500 million and lives a minimalist lifestyle, focused on growing Embark, which aims to fulfill over 14,200 reservations for Embark-enabled trucks by 2024.

title: Twitter-like Weibo sued in China for restricting data access
summary: Weibo, one of China's largest social media sites, is being sued by Eefung Software for alleged anticompetitive restrictions on data access, which Eefung claims is destroying its business model. This case is China's first civil antitrust lawsuit, highlighting increased awareness of Beijing's antitrust scrutiny among smaller firms against Big Tech companies. The lawsuit tests the limits of China's enhanced antitrust enforcement launched in the past year.

title: Unity to buy 'The Lord of the Rings' VFX studio Weta Digital in $1.63 bln deal
summary: Unity Software Inc. announced its acquisition of Weta Digital, the acclaimed visual effects studio behind "The Lord of the Rings," in a $1.63 billion cash-and-stock deal. This acquisition aims to enhance Unity's VFX tools and expand its presence in the burgeoning metaverse, while Weta Digital's VFX team will operate as a standalone entity, WetaFX, becoming Unity's largest media and entertainment customer. Analyst Franco Granda views the deal as central to building a platform for the metaverse, despite an initial 8% slump in Unity's shares.

title: Google-owner Alphabet breaches $2 trillion market cap, joins Apple and Microsoft
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., reached a $2 trillion market capitalization for the first time, driven by increased digital ad spending and growth in its cloud business. This achievement places Alphabet alongside Apple and Microsoft in the exclusive $2 trillion club. The company reported a record third quarter in 2021 with $65.1 billion in earnings.

title: Salesforce CEO Benioff invests in search engine startup You.com
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has invested $20 million in You.com, a startup aiming to challenge Google's dominance in search with a more customizable and privacy-focused engine. Benioff transferred ownership of the You.com domain name, which he had owned since the 1990s, to the startup. You.com, founded by former Salesforce AI scientists, plans to differentiate itself by not tracking users or selling "privacy-invasive ads," instead focusing on revenue from transactions and helping publishers generate ad revenue.

title: Google’s parent Alphabet breaches $2 trillion in market value
authors: Katrina Lewis and Nico Grant and Bloomberg
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., reached a $2 trillion market valuation for the first time, driven by strong growth in digital advertising and its cloud business. This puts Alphabet in an exclusive club with Apple Inc. and Microsoft Corp., with analysts remaining optimistic about its future growth due to a cheaper valuation and increasing cloud adoption.

title: Adobe issued a DMCA request to remove Clean Flash, an open source project that continued to support Flash
summary: Adobe has issued a DMCA request to shut down the "Clean Flash" open-source project, which aimed to continue supporting Adobe Flash Player worldwide after its official end-of-life on December 31, 2020. While Adobe officially stopped global distribution of Flash, it still supports the technology in China and for businesses, leading Clean Flash to provide a working and updated version independently. This move highlights ongoing debate within the developer community about the preservation of Flash content versus moving entirely to open standards like HTML5.

title: EXPLAINED: What is Metaverse and Why Facebook/ Meta Thinks it's the Future of Internet
summary: This article explains the concept of the metaverse, why Facebook (now Meta) views it as the future of the internet, and what its potential applications are. It details how the metaverse would work, from virtual interactions and business opportunities to the technologies being developed to build it, while also touching on data privacy concerns.

title: Google invests $1bn into Chicago Mercantile Exchange as part of cloud migration deal
summary: Google Cloud has signed a 10-year deal with CME Group to migrate all of CME's infrastructure and markets to the cloud starting in early 2022. As part of this agreement, Google has also made a $1 billion equity investment in CME Group. The partnership aims to enhance CME's services, introduce new products, and accelerate technological innovation in capital markets while strengthening Google Cloud's position in the financial services sector.

title: Google invests $1 billion in Chicago Mercantile Exchange Group
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., has invested $1 billion in the Chicago Mercantile Exchange Group (CME Group) through non-voting convertible preferred stock. This investment accompanies a 10-year strategic partnership with Google Cloud aimed at migrating CME Group's technology infrastructure to the cloud, starting in 2022 with data and clearing services. The collaboration seeks to enhance market access, data capabilities, and operational efficiencies in derivatives markets, marking Google's first direct investment in cryptocurrency-related products.

title: Nuro raises $600M from investors including Kroger and Google
summary: Autonomous delivery vehicle maker Nuro has raised $600 million in Series D financing from investors including Kroger and Google. This funding will accelerate Nuro's efforts to provide retailers with solutions for e-commerce order transportation without human workers and support its strategic partnership with Google Cloud for self-driving vehicle development. Nuro plans to use these funds to address logistics challenges exposed by the pandemic and recently invested $40 million in new test and manufacturing facilities in Nevada.

title: How To Target Your Audience Without Third-Party Cookie Data
summary: This article explores the impending demise of third-party cookies by late 2023 and its implications for digital advertising. It discusses how advertisers will face challenges in targeting ads and measuring performance, and outlines three potential scenarios for digital ad targeting: walled gardens, a consent economy, and identity innovation. The article also provides strategies for marketers to adapt, focusing on first-party data, direct publisher relationships, and contextual advertising.

title: Monthly Market Wrap - October 2021
summary: The October 2021 market wrap highlights a month of economic observations including rising inflation, the Federal Reserve's anticipated tapering, and varied performance across domestic and international equities. It also covers positive trends in alternative investments and the increasing integration of ESG factors into investment strategies. The report details specific market indices and economic indicators, providing a comprehensive overview of the financial landscape during the month.

title: Strategy Analytics: Ring, Nest, and Arlo Remain Among the Leaders in the Smart Home Camera Market
summary: Strategy Analytics reports that Ring, Nest, and Arlo continue to lead the smart home camera market, but a shift towards software-centric business models is underway. The report suggests that hardware-first models are becoming unsustainable, with companies like Amazon and Google, who are already investing in software, set to further dominate the market. Future success in this sector will depend on advanced software and services rather than just hardware specifications.

title: Ecobee acquired by generator company Generac for $770 million
summary: Generac Holdings has acquired Toronto-based smart home thermostat company Ecobee for $770 million, with the deal expected to close in the fourth quarter. Ecobee's CEO and founder, Stuart Lombard, will continue in his role, and the company will operate as a subsidiary of Generac, expanding its Toronto office. This acquisition combines Ecobee's smart home technology with Generac's energy management solutions, aiming to create a comprehensive home energy ecosystem.

title: A sea of opportunities in ASEAN’s post-pandemic future
summary: Despite short-term negative investor sentiment due to recurrent COVID-19 waves, ASEAN's long-term fundamentals remain strong. The region is poised for growth through enhanced regional integration, a booming digital economy, and increasing focus on green infrastructure. These factors suggest a promising post-pandemic recovery and new investment opportunities.

title: US tech company NetApp to open international headquarters in Cork
summary: US-based technology company NetApp is establishing its international headquarters in Cork, Ireland, aiming to create up to 500 jobs by 2025. This expansion is part of NetApp's strategy to grow its business and international presence, capitalizing on Ireland's strong ecosystem for tech companies and skilled graduates. The new office will support its global operations outside the US, aligning with the accelerated digital transformation trends observed during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Cadence Extends Battery Life and Improves User Experience for Next-Generation Hearables, Wearables and Always-On Devices
summary: Cadence Design Systems announced its new Tensilica HiFi 1 DSP, designed to extend battery life and enhance user experience in next-generation hearables, wearables, and always-on devices. This DSP offers increased voice- and music-processing performance with optimal neural network capability in a compact, ultra-low energy footprint. It improves efficiency for features like LC3 codec decoding and AI applications such as keyword spotting, enabling longer device operation and enhanced functionality.

title: Intel teams with Google Cloud to develop new class of data center chip
summary: Intel Corp and Google Cloud have collaborated to create "Mount Evans," a new class of chip called an "infrastructure processing unit" (IPU) aimed at optimizing cloud computing data centers. This chip separates and speeds up overhead tasks like setting up virtual machines, improving efficiency and security. Intel hopes to make this IPU an industry standard beyond Google, with both companies working on releasing free software tools.

title: Here's why this CEO says his $26M IPO was more than enough for his self-driving tech startup
summary: Cyngn, a self-driving vehicle software developer, recently raised $26 million in its IPO. The CEO, Lior Tal, expressed satisfaction with this amount, stating it was more than enough for the startup's needs. Cyngn is developing autonomous technology for industrial vehicles and emerged from the former smartphone OS company, Cyanogen.

title: Facebook’s reported name change reinforces its image as the new Big Tobacco
summary: Facebook is reportedly planning to rebrand itself with a new name, drawing comparisons to Philip Morris's name change to Altria Group two decades ago. Critics argue that a new brand name won't solve Facebook's fundamental problems, such as the negative effects of its platforms and its tendency to prioritize profit over public health, echoing sentiments that Big Tobacco used rebranding to distract from harmful practices. Experts suggest that for the rebrand to be successful, it needs to be accompanied by a genuine internal change in culture, values, and vision, rather than just a superficial PR move.

title: Trump wants his media company to rival Twitter, Netflix and Amazon
summary: Former President Donald Trump announced the launch of Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG), aiming to create a media network that rivals Big Tech platforms like Twitter, Netflix, and Amazon. The company plans to launch a social media site called TRUTH Social, develop a subscription video-on-demand service (TMTG+), and build internet technology infrastructure. This initiative comes after Trump's bans from major social media platforms and saw TMTG's stock surge over 350% on its debut through a merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp.

title: Ulta announces investments in deliveries and digital, disappoints with financial outlook
summary: Ulta Beauty announced plans to invest in new delivery improvements and digital capabilities, but disappointed investors with a lower-than-expected financial outlook for 2022-2024. The company expects net sales CAGR of 5% to 7% and diluted EPS CAGR in the low double digits, leading to a more than 10% drop in share prices. Strategic initiatives include omnichannel experiences, same-day delivery, "Beauty to Go" for BOPIS orders within two hours, and partnerships with Google and Adeptmind.
source: FashionNetwork - The World's Fashion Business News
source_domain: FashionNetwork - The World's Fashion Business News

summary: The article discusses the growing trend of enormous special stock awards for startup founders, often far exceeding compensation for CEOs of established companies. It highlights examples like Archer Aviation, Palantir Technologies, and GoodRx Holdings, whose founders received nine-figure packages even before their companies were profitable or generated revenue. This practice contrasts with earlier Silicon Valley norms where founders like Mark Zuckerberg and Jeff Bezos relied on the appreciation of their initial equity, and it raises concerns about shareholder dilution and corporate governance.

title: Shaping the Future of Delivery, Robot Serve Doesn’t Need a Delivery Man to Bring You Food
summary: Serve Robotics, spun off from Uber-acquired Postmates, has developed a semi-autonomous delivery robot aimed at sustainable and accessible deliveries. These all-electric robots navigate sidewalks using cameras and Lidar sensors, with a human remote override for complex situations. The article highlights Serve's features, such as its 50 lb storage capacity and 3 mph top speed, and discusses its potential impact on delivery costs, traffic, and local restaurant sales.

title: Quantum computer maker Rigetti to go public via $1.5 bln SPAC deal
summary: Quantum computer maker Rigetti & Co Inc announced its plan to go public through a merger with a blank-check firm, Supernova Partners Acquisition Company II Ltd, in a deal valued potentially at $1.5 billion. This move makes Rigetti the second quantum computer hardware maker to list publicly this year via a SPAC. The merger is expected to provide Rigetti with approximately $458 million in proceeds, including significant investments from major financial firms and strategic partners like Palantir Technologies Inc.

title: GM aims to build Netflix-sized subscription business by 2030
summary: General Motors announced its ambitious goal to generate $25 billion in annual revenue from in-car subscription services by 2030, putting it in the same league as Netflix. The automaker expects nearly $2 billion in revenue from these services this year, driven by its current base of 4.2 million subscribed vehicles and the upcoming Ultifi software platform. GM plans to monetize features like OnStar, Maps+, and fleet management solutions, projecting a serviceable addressable market of $80 billion by 2030.

title: PGE partnering with Google on Nest Renew, a service to help customers prioritize clean energy
summary: Portland General Electric (PGE) is partnering with Google on Nest Renew, a service designed to help customers prioritize clean energy. This collaboration offers options like Nest Renew Basic, which shifts electricity usage to cleaner energy times, and Nest Renew Premium, which matches estimated fossil fuel electricity usage with renewable energy credits. The initiative aims to provide customers with innovative ways to save energy, reduce their carbon footprint, and support renewable energy.

title: Friday’s analyst upgrades and downgrades
summary: This article details various analyst upgrades and downgrades on October 1, 2021, covering companies in the fertilizer, real estate, energy infrastructure, gaming, and renewable royalties sectors. Analysts from Citi, JP Morgan, TD Securities, Credit Suisse, RBC Dominion Securities, Raymond James, National Bank Financial, CIBC World Markets, Scotia Capital, and Piper Sandler provided updated ratings, price targets, and rationales for their investment recommendations. Key companies discussed include Nutrien Ltd., various Canadian REITs, Tidewater Midstream and Infrastructure Ltd., Enthusiast Gaming Holdings Inc., Altius Renewable Royalties Corp., and several large-cap internet stocks.

title: Starbucks pushes back against US workers’ cafe-by-cafe union vote
authors: Amelia Pollard and Josh Eidelson and Bloomberg
summary: Starbucks is opposing unionization efforts by workers in Buffalo, New York, arguing that any union vote should encompass all 20 of its Buffalo-area locations rather than individual cafes. The company's stance challenges a labor board precedent that typically favors smaller bargaining units, with a hearing officer noting that single-location units are "presumptively appropriate." This move by Starbucks aligns with employer preferences for larger units to make unionization more difficult, amidst a broader wave of labor activism at nonunion companies.

title: Papa Johns Opening Headquarters in Atlanta
summary: Papa John's International is relocating its headquarters for commercial, communications, development, operations, people operations, and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion teams to Atlanta. The Louisville-based pizza company will occupy the top two floors of Three Ballpark Center at The Battery, totaling 60,000 square feet, and expects to house 190 employees in the new location. This move follows Papa John's announcement last September about establishing a corporate office in Atlanta, joining other major companies in the area.

title: Cisco Named a Leader in 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for WAN Edge Infrastructure
summary: Cisco has announced its recognition as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for WAN Edge Infrastructure, highlighting its SD-WAN solutions. These solutions focus on enabling secure, predictable digital experiences for hybrid workforces, building dynamic workspaces, and securing multi-cloud environments, accelerating the transition to a SASE-enabled architecture. Cisco emphasizes its comprehensive capabilities in seamless multicloud access, integrated security, and optimized insights through ThousandEyes integration.

title: Inside Wells Fargo’s multicloud strategy
summary: Wells Fargo is implementing a decade-long multicloud strategy, partnering with Microsoft and Google to modernize its technology infrastructure for public cloud operations. This approach, while different from some competitors, aims for portability, resilience, and avoids vendor lock-in, addressing the challenges of migrating highly regulated data and upskilling its workforce. The financial institution plans to progressively move existing applications to the public cloud, prioritizing impact over speed, with the ultimate goal of moving away from traditional data centers.

title: Thousands of Netgear routers can be hacked — here's what to do
summary: A serious security flaw in Netgear Nighthawk routers, stemming from the Disney-designed Circle parental-control feature, leaves thousands of devices vulnerable to hacking. Eleven different Nighthawk models are affected, and users are urged to update their router firmware immediately to patch the vulnerability. The flaw allows remote attackers with network access to gain control of the router due to unencrypted Circle update files.

title: Wells Fargo cloud plans revealed amid sweeping IT overhaul
summary: Wells Fargo has unveiled a new multi-cloud infrastructure strategy, selecting Azure as its primary public cloud provider and Google Cloud for AI solutions, alongside existing HPE GreenLake contracts. This move is part of a sweeping IT overhaul aimed at driving technological speed, agility, and scalability, as well as addressing risk and compliance issues following a major scandal. The bank plans a hybrid approach, initially utilizing third-party data centers while aspiring to predominantly rely on public cloud offerings.

title: Salesforce values and culture driven innovation
summary: This article explores how Salesforce has evolved from a CRM company to a leading cloud and productivity organization, driven by its core values and culture. Field CTO Adam Spearing discusses how the company's focus has shifted towards digital transformation, accelerated by the pandemic, and highlights key acquisitions like Tableau and Slack. The piece emphasizes the importance of culture, customer-centric innovation, and collaborative ecosystems in Salesforce's strategy for future growth.

title: How Navi's FoF on Vanguard US Total Stock Market ETF could add value to your portfolio
summary: Navi Mutual Fund has filed for a new Fund of Fund (FoF) that will invest in the Vanguard Total Stock Market Index Fund ETF (VTI), a passively managed US-based ETF with a very low expense ratio. This FoF will allow Indian investors to access the broad US equity market, including companies typically unavailable in India, potentially adding value due to low correlation with the Indian market. However, investors should be aware of debt fund taxation rules for international funds.

title: Apple can’t force developers to use its in-app payment system, federal judge rules
summary: A federal judge ruled that Apple Inc. can no longer compel developers to use its in-app payment system, allowing them to bypass commission fees of 15% to 30%. This decision, stemming from the Epic Games Inc. case, could significantly alter how apps are distributed by dominant online platforms like Apple, Alphabet Inc. (Google), and Amazon.com Inc. However, the ruling stopped short of declaring Apple an antitrust monopolist.

title: Native Rust support on Cloudflare Workers
summary: Cloudflare Workers now officially supports writing Workers in 100% Rust, eliminating the need for JavaScript interaction. This is made possible through the new `worker` crate, which simplifies development by providing Rustacean-friendly APIs and removing boilerplate code. This development aims to simplify the developer experience on Cloudflare Workers, leveraging Rust's strengths in WebAssembly and its growing ecosystem.

title: Chevron to sell test batch of sustainable aviation fuel to Delta Air
summary: Chevron Corp plans to produce and sell a test batch of sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) to Delta Air Lines at Los Angeles International Airport. This initiative is part of a partnership with Google to track SAF emissions data using cloud-based technology. Delta aims to replace 10% of its jet fuel with SAF by 2030, and the companies hope to create a transparent model for analyzing greenhouse gas emission reductions.

title: Qualcomm Says It Will Supply Chip For New Renault Electric Vehicle
summary: Qualcomm Inc. announced it will supply a key computing chip for the digital dashboard in Renault SA's new Megane E-TECH Electric vehicle. The chip will power the vehicle's infotainment system, utilizing software from Alphabet Inc.'s Google. This move represents Qualcomm's continued expansion into the automotive sector, following a previous deal with General Motors Co.

title: Lennox announces new integration of its iComfort thermostat
summary: Lennox has expanded the compatibility of its iComfort thermostats to integrate with various smart home automation platforms, including premium systems like Control4 and popular virtual assistants such as Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Assistant, and IFTTT. This integration allows users to manage their Lennox heating and cooling systems through a wider range of smart home devices, offering enhanced convenience and control over their indoor environment. Control4 customers with Lennox HVAC systems and iComfort S30, E30, or M30 thermostats can request integration through their dealer, enabling centralized control from their smart home system.

title: Alphabet, Tesla and Amazon are among the most favourite stocks held by US-focused mutual funds. Here are top 10 stocks
summary: This article identifies Alphabet, Tesla, and Amazon as top stock holdings among U.S.-focused mutual funds available to Indian investors. It details 10 such mutual funds, highlighting their investment strategies, underlying assets, and historical performance. The funds provide Indian investors exposure to leading US companies and geographical diversification.

title: Google Cloud & C3 AI: Enterprise AI Alliance
summary: C3 AI and Google Cloud announced a new partnership to accelerate the application of AI solutions across various industries. This collaboration involves co-selling C3 AI's enterprise AI applications on Google Cloud's infrastructure and leveraging Google Cloud's ML and data analytics capabilities. The partnership aims to address real-world challenges in sectors like manufacturing, supply chain, financial services, healthcare, and telecommunications.

title: Arlo Offers Comprehensive Third-Party Compatibility With Amazon, Apple, Google, Samsung, And Others For Seamless Smart Home Security Experience
summary: Arlo Technologies announced enhanced compatibility for its smart home security systems with major platforms like Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Home Assistant, IFTTT, and Samsung SmartThings. These integrations provide users with seamless control over their Arlo devices through voice commands, notifications, and live video feeds on various smart home devices, reflecting Arlo's commitment to a robust and integrated security experience. The updates aim to offer peace of mind regardless of the user's preferred smart home ecosystem.

title: Cybersecurity giant Check Point acquires Israeli startup to protect cloud emails
summary: Cybersecurity firm Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. announced its acquisition of Israeli startup Avanan, a cloud email security provider, for an estimated $270-$280 million in cash and stocks. Avanan, founded in 2015, protects cloud collaboration solutions like Microsoft Office 365, G-Suite, and Slack from cyberattacks, with over 5,000 global clients and 2.5 million inboxes protected. This acquisition aims to integrate Avanan's technology with Check Point's existing threat prevention software to enhance cloud email security, especially in the context of increased remote work and phishing attacks.

title: Keysight Becomes a Part of Google Cloud Partner Initiative
summary: Keysight Technologies has joined Google Cloud's partner initiative to advance cloud-centric 5G ecosystems, enabling agile orchestration of 5G services at the network edge. This partnership aims to assist service providers in transitioning to cloud and edge computing for delivering advanced applications and use cases. Keysight's solutions will support the deployment of cloud-native 5G quickly and cost-effectively, catering to the increasing demand for low-latency cloud capabilities at the network edge.

title: Synopsys' AI-Assisted EDA Tools Aim To Cut GPU Design Costs in Half
summary: Synopsys' new AI-assisted Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools promise to significantly reduce the cost and time required for chip design, particularly for GPUs. The DSO.ai platform can optimize various aspects of chip design, potentially cutting development time from 24 months to 24 weeks and reducing costs by as much as 50%. Companies like Samsung, Google, and Nvidia are already adopting this technology, which could also democratize chip development for smaller firms.

title: Elastic acquisition spree continues as it acquires security startup CMD
summary: Elastic has announced its acquisition of Vancouver-based security vendor CMD, marking its second security-related acquisition in a short period. CMD's technology provides runtime security for cloud infrastructure using open-source eBPF, and its team, including co-founders Santosh Krishan and Jake King, will join Elastic to integrate their technology into the Elastic Stack platform. This acquisition aims to enhance Elastic's security capabilities, particularly for cloud and Kubernetes environments, following its previous acquisition of build.security.

title: Apple’s Proposed Protections Against Child Predators — a Challenge to Privacy?
summary: Apple announced a new system to identify child predatory content in its photo cloud, sparking varied reactions from law enforcement, child protection groups, and privacy defenders. The system involves on-device scanning of iCloud Photos using an algorithm to detect known child abuse images, raising concerns among critics about potential privacy invasions and governmental pressure to expand surveillance capabilities. The article discusses the technical implementation, immediate reactions, and the broader implications for Apple's long-standing commitment to user privacy amidst new challenges.

title: MicroSectors™ Launches FANG & Innovation ETNs, 'BULZ' & 'BERZ'
summary: REX Shares, LLC announced the launch of two new MicroSectors Exchange Traded Notes (ETNs), BULZ and BERZ, issued by the Bank of Montreal. These ETNs are linked to the Solactive FANG Innovation Index, which tracks major U.S.-listed tech and internet/media companies. The products aim to offer sophisticated investors leveraged and inverse leveraged exposure to prominent technology and innovation stocks.

title: Arch Capital appoint high flyers to board
summary: Bermuda-based Arch Capital Group Ltd has appointed Francis Ebong and Eileen Mallesch to its board of directors. Mr. Ebong brings extensive technology and innovation experience from Alphabet's X and Facebook, while Ms. Mallesch offers over 30 years of finance and risk expertise including senior leadership roles at Nationwide and other significant board positions. These appointments aim to enhance the board's capabilities in fintech transformation and broaden its talent and outlook for future growth.

title: Scared of flying commercial? Private flights and short-range jets are skyrocketing during the pandemic
summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has led to a significant surge in private flights and short-range jet travel, as individuals seek alternatives to crowded commercial airports. Affluent travelers are increasingly using membership carriers, luxury charters, and fractional ownership programs for more personalized and health-conscious journeys. This trend is also fueling growth in regional airports across California, with plans for expansion and new routes, and some companies envisioning a future of greener, more affordable short-haul air travel powered by new technologies.

title: Samsung Has Its Own AI-Designed Chip. Soon, Others Will Too
summary: Samsung is utilizing AI-designed chips developed with Synopsys's new software, DSO.ai, for its Exynos processors, marking a significant step in the semiconductor industry. This innovative approach, also being explored by companies like Google, Nvidia, and IBM, leverages reinforcement learning to automate and accelerate the complex chip design process, potentially leading to novel designs and improved performance. While AI-driven design is currently expensive, experts anticipate it will become a standard tool in the future.

title: Kroger kicks off pickup partnership with Google
summary: Kroger has partnered with Google to integrate pickup service functionality into Google Maps for 96 stores across Ohio, Kentucky, and Indiana, with plans for further expansion. This allows shoppers to manage their orders, receive reminders, and notify stores of their arrival directly through the app. The initiative aims to enhance convenience, attract new shoppers, and capitalize on the surge in online grocery demand driven by the pandemic and the spread of the delta variant.

title: Allbirds is One of the Latest Brands Facing a Lawsuit Over its Sustainability-Centric Advertising
summary: Allbirds is facing a class-action lawsuit alleging its sustainability-centric advertising is "false, deceptive and misleading." The lawsuit claims the footwear brand misrepresents its carbon footprint assessment, animal welfare practices, and transparency, leading consumers to pay more for products based on inaccurate "eco-friendly" claims. This case is part of a growing trend of lawsuits challenging corporate sustainability claims, signaling a shift in legal accountability for such marketing.

title: Pony.ai Reportedly Seeks Funds at $8 Billion Value Amid Listing Halt
summary: Pony.ai is reportedly seeking a new funding round to raise $500 million to $1 billion, potentially valuing the self-driving startup at $8 billion, after pausing its U.S. listing plans. The decision to halt the listing comes amid Beijing's crackdown on technology companies and overseas listings. Pony.ai, with Chinese origins, aims to strengthen its financial position to compete with rivals like GM's Cruise and Alphabet's Waymo in the self-driving technology sector.

title: HP Delivers Ultimate Chrome OS Experiences for Life and Work in Today's Hybrid World
summary: HP Inc. has expanded its Chrome OS ecosystem with the introduction of the HP Chromebook x2 11 and the HP Chromebase 21.5 inch All-in-One Desktop, along with the HP M24fd USB-C Monitor. These new devices are designed to offer versatility and mobility for hybrid work and family use, featuring innovations like the first Chromebook detachable powered by Snapdragon 7c and the first Chromebase All-in-One with a rotating display. The company emphasizes sustainable design in its new lineup, reflecting a focus on environmental responsibility.

title: Unity buys remote desktop streaming app Parsec for $320M, its biggest acquisition yet
summary: Unity Software Inc. is acquiring remote desktop provider Parsec Cloud Inc. for $320 million, marking its largest acquisition to date. This move underscores Unity's ambition to expand beyond video game development and attract more creators to its platform, leveraging Parsec's remote desktop streamlining capabilities for real-time 3D experiences. The acquisition coincides with Unity reporting strong second-quarter financial results, beating Wall Street's expectations with a 48% increase in revenue year-over-year.

title: NVIDIA maintains dominant position in 2020 market for AI processors for cloud and data center
summary: NVIDIA maintained its dominant position in the 2020 global market for AI processors used in cloud and data centers, holding an 80.6% share of global revenue. The company generated $3.2 billion in cloud and data center AI processor revenue, up from $1.8 billion in 2019, primarily due to its leadership in GPU-derived chips. Omdia predicts that alternative suppliers will gain significant market share in the coming years despite NVIDIA's current advantage.

title: Google’s upcoming plans for Israel: a server farm and fiber optics network
summary: Google is significantly expanding its operations in Israel following being awarded a government tender for cloud computing. This expansion includes establishing a server farm in the Sharon region and rolling out an ultra-high-speed fiber optics network, complementing its existing subsea cables. These investments aim to ensure maximum availability of Google's services, improve local internet infrastructure, and enhance Google's presence as a global telecommunications provider.

title: Google founders have sold $1 billion in stock since May, the most since 2017
summary: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin have sold over $1 billion worth of stock combined since May 2021, marking their first sales since 2017. Their stock sales, totaling more than $1.07 billion, occurred after the company's share price nearly tripled and Alphabet reported strong second-quarter earnings. Despite stepping down from executive roles in 2019, Page and Brin remain board members and control a majority of Alphabet's voting shares.

title: Vittorio Cretella left school at 17 to join the Italian Army. Now he’s CIO at Procter & Gamble.
summary: Vittorio Cretella, CIO of Procter & Gamble, discusses his unconventional career path from the Italian Army to leading digital transformation at the $300+ billion CPG company. He emphasizes the importance of diversity and inclusion in hiring, along with the pervasive role of digital transformation, machine learning, and cloud adoption in P&G's strategy. Cretella also highlights his work with NPower, a non-profit helping veterans and underserved youth find careers in tech, and P&G's neurodiversity hiring program.

title: On the Move with Growth Stocks: 'QQQA' Rides Large Cap Momentum
summary: The ProShares Nasdaq-100 Dorsey Wright Momentum ETF (QQQA) is presented as a smart beta ETF that uses a momentum strategy to select top-performing, equal-weighted companies from the Nasdaq-100 Index. Despite holding only 21 securities, QQQA is considered more diversified than the broader Nasdaq-100 and the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), particularly in its allocation to FANMAG companies and across various sectors, including a recent increase in healthcare exposure. The article highlights QQQA's unique approach to portfolio construction through momentum investing and equal-weighting to achieve diversification within a growth-focused universe.

title: The Energizer Bunny Taps SAP Software to Power Finance Transformation
summary: Energizer Holdings Inc. announced its adoption of RISE with SAP, implementing SAP S/4HANA for central finance on Google Cloud to streamline finance transformation, manage future mergers and acquisitions, and bolster product strategy. This move is expected to automate essential business processes, improve customer service, and fuel innovation, strengthening Energizer's global leadership.

title: Young Indian investors warming up to clean energy ETFs: Report
summary: A report by Globalise indicates that young Indian investors are increasingly interested in clean energy ETFs, alongside growth-oriented technology funds. The ARK Innovation ETF, Renaissance IPO ETF, Small Cap Growth Vanguard ETF, Invesco WilderHill Clean Energy ETF, and Invesco QQQ Trust Series 1 were among the top ETFs in demand. Young investors, particularly from states like Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Delhi, and Karnataka, are seeking to diversify their portfolios through global investing platforms.
