title: Facebook, Google and Snap stocks rocket to records as online ad market heats up
summary: Facebook, Google, and Snap Inc. stocks reached record highs Friday due to a surge in digital ad sales. This surge was signaled by better-than-expected earnings reports from Snap and Twitter, indicating a strong recovery in the online advertising market. Snap was a particular standout, exceeding revenue expectations significantly and seeing its shares jump 23.9%.

title: Facebook, Google and Snap stocks rocket to records as online ad market heats up
summary: Facebook, Google parent Alphabet, and Snap Inc. all reached record stock highs due to surging digital ad sales. This surge followed better-than-expected earnings reports from Snap and Twitter. Snap was a particular standout, exceeding revenue expectations significantly and seeing its shares jump 23.9%.

title: Rackspace Layoffs, Offshore Strategy Buried in 'Growth' Announcement -
summary: Rackspace Technology announced plans to invest up to $75 million in growth, while simultaneously conducting layoffs affecting 10% of its workforce and shifting job responsibilities offshore. The company's press release focused on growth and financial guidance, but an SEC filing revealed the "termination" of employees and the backfilling of roles in offshore service centers. This led to criticism of Rackspace's "overly ambitious PR spin" for obscuring the job cuts despite increasing financial forecasts.

title: Palo Alto Networks, Google Cloud Announce Intrusion Detection System
summary: Palo Alto Networks and Google Cloud have introduced Cloud IDS, a new network threat detection service built on Palo Alto Networks' Threat Prevention security service. Cloud IDS is designed to provide granular application-level visibility of traffic within a virtual private cloud (VPC) and detect various network-based threats. This service supports industry-specific security compliance and can be integrated with existing security solutions for automated responses.

title: Microsoft acquires security start-up CloudKnox
summary: Microsoft announced its acquisition of CloudKnox, a security start-up that develops software to help companies manage and reduce access permissions to their cloud resources. This acquisition is part of Microsoft's broader strategy to expand its security business, which has seen over $10 billion in revenue in the prior 12 months. CloudKnox's software functions across Microsoft Azure, Amazon, and Google public clouds, identifying and removing unused permissions and flagging unusual activity to prevent security breaches.

title: EU and China Announce Greenhouse Gas Reduction Plans
summary: The EU and China have announced significant plans to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The EU's plan involves cutting reliance on fossil fuels, imposing taxes on imports from high-emitting countries, and increasing renewable energy goals. China launched a domestic cap-and-trade style emissions market, doubling the global emissions covered under such a program.

title: Raleigh tech firm Bandwidth is betting millions on a full return to the office
summary: Raleigh tech firm Bandwidth is committing millions to an in-person, five-day-a-week office model, a contrast to the prevailing hybrid work trend in the tech industry. CEO David Morken believes this is crucial for preserving company culture, backing this conviction with a new headquarters featuring a Montessori school for employees' children, and stating that productivity increased with remote work, but the company prioritizes "presence". The company is not mandating COVID-19 vaccines but is encouraging vaccination and will continue to hire over 1,000 workers.

title: Zoom to buy cloud-based call center operator Five9 in $15 bln deal
summary: Zoom Video Communications announced its largest-ever acquisition, an all-stock deal to buy cloud-based call center operator Five9 Inc for $14.7 billion. This strategic move aims to expand Zoom's offerings beyond video conferencing into the $24 billion contact center market, enhancing its presence with enterprise customers. The deal is expected to close in the first half of 2022, with Five9 becoming an operating unit of Zoom.

title: Microsoft says Israeli group sold tools to hack Windows
summary: Microsoft and Citizen Lab reported that an Israeli company called Candiru sold software tools to hack Microsoft Windows and other widely used software platforms like Google Chrome. These tools were allegedly used to target civil society organizations, including a Saudi dissident group and an Indonesian news outlet, in countries like Iran, Lebanon, Spain, and the UK. Both Microsoft and Google have since patched the vulnerabilities exploited by Candiru's tools.

title: Why is Tesla incorporated in Delaware?
summary: This article explains why a disproportionate number of companies, including Tesla, Amazon, and Google, are incorporated in Delaware despite not being headquartered there. Key reasons include flexible corporate law, the efficient Court of Chancery, favorable tax treatment for out-of-state income, and a long-standing state focus on business formation. The article also touches on the challenges this presents for regional data and business coverage.

title: Partial victory for Sonos and EIP against Google over consumer electronics
summary: Sonos has achieved a partial victory against Google in a patent dispute concerning consumer electronics control technology. The Munich Regional Court dismissed Google's infringement lawsuit against Sonos, while the Hamburg Higher Regional Court upheld a preliminary injunction filed by Sonos against Google. This marks an escalation in their ongoing global patent battle.

title: Google is in the hottest antitrust seat, but Apple and the rest of Big Tech shouldn't breathe easy
summary: Google is currently facing its fifth government antitrust lawsuit in the U.S., specifically concerning Android and its app store, making it a primary target in global Big Tech investigations. Despite Google's prominent position, antitrust experts anticipate more inquiries into other major tech companies following President Joe Biden's recent executive order addressing competition in the tech industry. This indicates a broad governmental consensus that Big Tech poses a significant problem.

title: HCA AND THE FUTURE OF HEALTHCARE
summary: This article discusses HCA Healthcare's partnership with Google Cloud for digital transformation, its controversial past involving fraud and an insider trading scandal, and its subsequent comeback through strategic acquisitions and a return to public markets. It analyzes HCA's financial performance, growth strategies, and future prospects, especially concerning expanding into new healthcare markets like senior living and outpatient care. The author evaluates whether HCA stock is a good buy, considering its aggressive expansion, debt management, and potential long-term growth despite short-term revenue concerns.

title: News Corp. closes Knewz aggregator site
summary: News Corp. has shut down its news aggregation service, Knewz, just 18 months after its launch. The platform, which aimed to offer diverse news content as an alternative to Google and Facebook, cited a lack of profitability as the reason for its closure despite attracting millions of users. News Corp. stated that Knewz served as an important proving ground for technology that will continue to benefit its other businesses.

title: Google must face Voice Assistant privacy lawsuit -U.S. judge
summary: A federal judge ruled that Google must face much of a class-action lawsuit alleging illegal recording and dissemination of private conversations through its Voice Assistant. Plaintiffs claim Google uses "false accepts" of hot words for targeted advertising, violating privacy rights and contractual agreements. The judge allowed most claims to proceed, emphasizing that Google's privacy policy did not adequately disclose the use of recordings made without intentional activation.

title: Rigetti looks to scale up quantum computing with modular processor architecture
summary: Rigetti Computing Inc. is addressing the challenge of scaling quantum computers with a new modular architecture that links smaller qubit collections to function as one processor. This approach aims to overcome the limitations of building larger, single quantum chips that are prone to failure and low manufacturing yields. The company expects to make an 80-qubit system available on its Quantum Cloud Services platform later this year, believing this modular strategy offers the fastest path to practical quantum applications.

title: Southeast Asia’s most valuable company has an edge in the battle of the super-apps: Its gaming business
summary: Sea Limited, Southeast Asia's most valuable company, leverages its highly profitable gaming division, Garena, to fund the rapid expansion of its e-commerce platform, Shopee, and digital financial services arm, SeaMoney. This strategy gives Sea a significant advantage over rivals like Grab and GoTo in the competitive super-app market, allowing it to offer aggressive incentives and capture market share even while operating at an overall loss. The article details Sea's history, its founder's vision for mobile-first services in emerging markets, and the challenges and opportunities facing the company as it seeks sustained profitability and dominance.

title: A lot of laid-off and furloughed workers launched startups last year, according to Salesforce
summary: A Salesforce survey revealed that a significant number of laid-off and furloughed workers launched startups in 2020, often out of necessity due to COVID-19 related job losses. These "pandemic entrepreneurs" frequently adopted digital-first methodologies, with many businesses being direct-to-consumer and operating with minimal initial capital. The trend contributed to a 24% increase in new small businesses created in 2020 compared to 2019.

title: How Salesforce, Amazon, Google measure climate impact
summary: This article discusses how companies like Salesforce, Amazon, and Google are measuring their climate impact and the challenges involved. It highlights the increasing pressure on companies to demonstrate sustainability efforts through trusted data and metrics, moving beyond just reporting to actively using data to drive decarbonization. The piece also emphasizes the importance of internal communication, incentives, and policymaker involvement in achieving climate goals.

title: Breaking Down 'BLOK': Inside This ETF's Portfolio
summary: The Amplify Transformational Data Sharing ETF (BLOK) demonstrated its active management prowess by capitalizing on crypto market volatility in May, mitigating losses despite its high correlation to Bitcoin. BLOK strategically narrowed its holdings and increased exposure to digital platforms and exchanges, which typically thrive during periods of extreme market fluctuations. The ETF, with over $1 billion in AUM, focuses 80% of its portfolio on companies involved in blockchain technology but does not directly invest in cryptocurrencies.

title: How Western Union is fighting back against fintech startups
summary: Western Union, a long-standing player in cross-border payments, is actively combating competition from fintech startups by heavily investing in its digital operations. The company saw significant growth in digital money transfer revenues in 2020 due to the pandemic-driven acceleration towards digital services, and expects revenues to exceed $1 billion in 2021. Western Union is also expanding its offerings beyond payments, including launching a bank account, debit card, and multicurrency accounts in Europe, and modernizing its technology using cloud platforms and AI.

title: Payoneer Is Set to Merge With FTOC, Future Looks Bright
summary: Payoneer is set to go public through a reverse merger with the SPAC FTAC Olympus Acquisition Corp. (FTOC), with common stock expected to trade under "PAYO" on Nasdaq starting June 28. The company, which provides payment services for major firms like Amazon and Google, shows strong financials with expected 2021 revenues of $432 million and a reasonable valuation, making it a potentially attractive investment. Payoneer's business was significantly boosted by the COVID-19 pandemic and the shift to online transactions, with impressive growth reported in Q1 2021, and the company has recently undergone a rebranding effort.

title: Google delays Chrome's blocking of tracking cookies to late 2023
summary: Google has announced a delay in fully blocking tracking cookies in its Chrome web browser until late 2023, nearly two years later than initially planned. This decision comes amidst antitrust concerns from competitors and regulators, with Google citing the need for sufficient time for public discussion and for the advertising industry to adapt. The delay has positively impacted shares of companies reliant on cookies, while regulatory bodies like Britain's CMA and the EU's competition commission are actively involved in overseeing Google's changes.

title: Wattpad & WEBTOON Merge Studio Divisions into Fan-Driven Entertainment Outfit
summary: Wattpad and WEBTOON have merged their studio divisions into Wattpad WEBTOON Studios, a new entity focused on creating fan and data-driven TV shows, films, and books. This new studio, backed by Naver with a $100 million commitment, leverages the combined audience of over 166 million people and aims to develop global hits from their extensive IP libraries. Aron Levitz will lead the new studio as President, bringing together the expertise of both Wattpad Studios and WEBTOON Studios.

title: Reducing noise and bias in investing
summary: This article examines how broad-based ETFs can effectively reduce noise and bias in investing, drawing insights from the book "Noise: A Flaw in Human Judgment." It highlights that mechanical predictions are superior to human ones and that aggregating forecasts reduces noise. The author argues that diversified ETFs represent the aggregate forecasts of millions of market participants, offering a simple way to benefit from collective wisdom.

title: Sustainable equity ETFs cut Tesla, Microsoft, and Netflix
summary: Two of Australia's largest sustainable international equity ETFs, BetaShares Global Sustainability Leaders (ETHI) and VanEck Vectors MSCI International Sustainable Equity (ESGI), have divested from Tesla, Microsoft, and Netflix due to failures in ESG screens. These divestments highlight the active decisions passive sustainable funds can make based on rigorous environmental, social, and governance criteria, contrasting with Vanguard's Ethically Conscious International Shares ETF (VESG) which continues to hold these companies. The article examines the different screening methodologies used by these funds and their impact on holdings, performance, and diversification.

title: How fund managers are bracing for inflation
summary: This article explores how fund managers are adjusting their portfolios in response to rising inflation, which has surpassed central bank targets in both the UK and US. Fund managers are implementing strategies such as diversification, investing in cyclical stocks and commodities, seeking companies with strong pricing power, and utilizing real assets to protect investments against inflationary pressures. While some managers are making significant changes, others are maintaining their low-risk equity positions, acknowledging inflation as a risk but not necessarily requiring drastic portfolio overhauls.

title: New research shows social media has created a more
summary: New research from Sprout Social indicates that social media has intensified competition for brands, with 93% of marketers agreeing, but also serves as a critical tool for differentiation and staying ahead. The 2021 Sprout Social Index: Accelerate highlights that 90% of marketers rely on social data to gain a competitive edge, though few fully leverage this data for ROI measurement or business decisions. The study also reveals that while consumers expect strong customer service on social, marketers often deprioritize it, missing opportunities for engagement and bottom-line growth.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman On His Return-To-Work Plan: ‘If You Can Go To A Restaurant In New York City, You Can Come Into The Office’
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman has stated his firm stance on returning to the office, asserting that if employees can go to a restaurant in New York City, they can come into the office. This view aligns with other Wall Street bank CEOs like JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon and Goldman Sachs' David Solomon, who are pushing for a return to in-person work, especially for junior staff and to preserve company culture. In contrast, many tech companies are adopting more flexible hybrid work models.

title: J.B. Hunt, Waymo team up for self-driving deliveries in Texas
summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. and Waymo, the self-driving unit of Google-parent Alphabet, announced a partnership for autonomous freight delivery in Texas. This collaboration involves using Waymo Via platform's Level 4 autonomous driving technology to haul freight between Houston and Fort Worth, supervised by specialists. The trial will help both companies gather data, define future collaborations, and explore how autonomous technology can enhance safety and efficiency in trucking.

title: Waymo Via Partners With J.B. Hunt to Run Robotically Driven Freight From Houston to Fort Worth
summary: Waymo Via is partnering with J.B. Hunt Transport Services to test robotically driven freight from Houston to Fort Worth using autonomous Class 8 trucking units. The test runs will cover a 262-mile haul with a human driver and technician present to monitor operations. This collaboration aims to gather data, improve efficiency, enhance safety, and explore the long-term integration of autonomous driving technology in trucking fleets.

title: Zoom and Salesforce make quick $23 million profit after IPO of Israeli software vendor Monday.com
summary: Zoom and Salesforce each invested $75 million into Monday.com's IPO, quickly realizing a combined profit of $23 million as the stock jumped 15% on its debut day. This investment strategy is part of a larger trend for Salesforce Ventures, which has yielded significant gains from other IPOs like Snowflake, while Zoom is also beginning to use investments as a new business venture. Both companies are subject to a 180-day lock-up period before they can sell their shares.

title: Cognizant forms new business group dedicated to Google cloud
summary: Cognizant has established a new Google Business Group (GBG) to accelerate clients' cloud modernization journeys, expanding its existing relationship with Google Cloud. This initiative aims to combine their service capabilities and solution development to meet evolving business needs, particularly in vertical markets like retail, life sciences, healthcare, and financial services. The GBG will leverage industry solutions, data analytics, AI, process automation, and application modernization.

title: Whirlpool Corporation Migrates SAP Systems to Google Cloud for Sustainable Growth
summary: Whirlpool Corporation has expanded its strategic collaboration with Google Cloud by migrating its enterprise-wide SAP environment and applications to Google Cloud's secure, reliable, and sustainable infrastructure. This move aims to provide global teams with low-latency access to SAP systems and data, support future growth with elastic cloud infrastructure, and contribute to Whirlpool’s commitment to reaching net-zero emissions by 2030. The migration leverages Google Cloud's capabilities in AI, machine learning, and analytics, while ensuring business systems run on carbon-neutral infrastructure.

title: Microsoft’s Irish subsidiary posted £220bn profit in single year | Tax havens
summary: Microsoft's Irish subsidiary, Microsoft Round Island One, recorded a profit of $315 billion (£222 billion) in a single year, which is nearly three-quarters of Ireland's GDP, despite having no employees other than directors. The company is resident for tax purposes in Bermuda, which has no corporation tax, allowing it to pay no tax on income. This news emerged as G7 finance ministers discussed global minimum corporate tax rates to combat multinational tax avoidance.

title: KKR, CD&R take data analytics firm Cloudera private for $4.7 bln
summary: Private equity firms Clayton Dubilier & Rice LLC (CD&R) and KKR & Co (KKR.N) are taking cloud-based data analytics company Cloudera Inc (CLDR.N) private for $4.7 billion. Cloudera's shares jumped 23.9% following the announcement, nearing the offer price of $16 per share. The move is intended to help Cloudera transition more smoothly into hybrid cloud solutions without the pressure of quarterly reporting.

title: KKR, CD&R Strike $5.3 Billion Deal to Buy Cloudera
summary: Private-equity firms KKR & Co. and Clayton Dubilier & Rice LLC have agreed to acquire software company Cloudera Inc. for approximately $5.3 billion, taking the company private. The deal values Cloudera at $16 per share, representing a 24% premium over its closing price on the preceding Friday. Cloudera, founded by engineers from major tech companies, struggled to adapt to the public cloud market, facing stiff competition from larger firms.

title: China’s ‘Uber for Trucks’ Heads for Billion-Dollar-Plus U.S. IPO
summary: Full Truck Alliance Co., a Chinese startup providing an "Uber-like" service for the trucking industry, is planning a U.S. initial public offering. The company aims to raise at least $1 billion at a valuation between $20 billion and $30 billion, possibly raising up to $2 billion. Its prominent backers include SoftBank Group Corp.'s Vision Fund and Alphabet Inc.

title: Yes, You Can Invest in a Tech-Less Nasdaq-100
summary: The article discusses the First Trust NASDAQ-100 Ex-Technology Sector Index Fund (QQXT), an ETF that allows investors to gain exposure to the Nasdaq-100 without the heavy technology sector allocation. This fund offers diversification away from tech and communication services while still providing growth potential and has historically outperformed the S&P 500 with less volatility. QQXT is presented as a compelling option for investors seeking growth outside of traditional tech-heavy portfolios.

title: 10,800 women suing Google over gender pay disparity win class-action status
summary: A San Francisco state judge has granted class-action status to a lawsuit brought by nearly 11,000 women against Google, alleging gender pay disparity. The plaintiffs claim Google pays men more for the same job and are seeking over $600 million in damages for violations of California’s Equal Pay Act. This decision allows four lead plaintiffs to represent approximately 10,800 women in the case.

title: Women suing Google over gender bias win class-action status
summary: Four former female Google employees have won class-action status for their gender-pay disparity lawsuit against the tech giant, allowing them to represent nearly 11,000 other women. The lawsuit alleges Google pays women less than men for the same job and seeks over $600 million in damages for violations of California's Equal Pay Act. The women also claim Google's past policy of asking for prior salaries perpetuated lower pay for women.

title: Microsoft teams up with Accenture and Goldman Sachs to create energy efficient software
summary: Microsoft, Accenture, and Goldman Sachs, along with other organizations, are forming the Green Software Foundation to develop and share methods for creating software that produces fewer carbon emissions in data centers. Data centers currently account for about 1% of global electricity demand, projected to rise significantly, prompting the need for "green software engineering" skills. The foundation aims to build tools, establish standards for measuring software's climate impact, and provide training for engineers.

title: Oracle debuts its first Arm-based cloud instances
summary: Oracle has launched its first Arm-based cloud instances, OCI Ampere A1 Compute, offering customers more flexibility and high performance at lower costs for general-purpose and cloud-native workloads. This move signifies Oracle's increased investment in the Arm ecosystem, providing a compelling alternative to x86-based instances and competing with rival cloud providers by offering attractive pricing and scaling options. The company is also expanding developer resources and tools to encourage Arm-based application development on its cloud platform, including free tier offerings and a new development stack.

title: Morgan Stanley defies bank diversity trend
summary: Morgan Stanley recently announced significant leadership changes, positioning a slate of potential successors to CEO James Gorman that is predominantly white and male, contrasting with JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s recent moves to promote women to senior roles. This decision has sparked criticism regarding diversity in leadership, despite Morgan Stanley's spokesperson stating a commitment to diverse talent and the presence of qualified women and people of color on their operating committee. The article highlights that while some progress has been made across Wall Street, top jobs continue to be primarily held by white men, prompting calls from activists and former employees for more substantial change.

title: Apple Inc. stock falls Tuesday, underperforms market
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock fell 1.12% on Tuesday, closing at $124.85, amidst a broader market downturn with the NASDAQ Composite and Dow Jones Industrial Average also declining. This marked the stock's second consecutive day of losses, placing it $20.24 below its 52-week high. The article also notes Apple's performance compared to competitors like Microsoft, Alphabet, and IBM, all of which also experienced declines.

title: Western Union Launches Cross-Border Payments on Google Pay
summary: Western Union has teamed up with Google Pay to enable cross-border payments for Google Pay users. Initially available in the U.S. for sending funds to India and Singapore, the service will expand globally by year-end, allowing users to send money to numerous bank accounts, wallets, cards, and retail locations worldwide. This partnership simplifies international money transfers for Google Pay's large user base, especially important amidst global challenges.

title: Google Pay launches international money transfers with Wise and Western Union
summary: Google Pay has partnered with Wise and Western Union to enable international money transfers for its U.S. users, expanding its financial services offerings. The service initially supports transfers to India and Singapore, with plans to cover 80 countries via Wise and 200 via Western Union by year-end. This move escalates competition in the digital payments sector, leveraging the boom in online payments spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Azure vs Google Cloud: How They Compare
summary: This article provides a detailed comparison between Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform, covering their market position, pricing models, and specific services for storage, compute, and networking. It highlights their strengths and weaknesses, such as Azure's comprehensive solutions and Google Cloud's competitive pricing and strong container support. The piece aims to help users understand which cloud provider might be a better fit based on their specific needs and existing infrastructure.

title: Apollo’s $5bn bet on Yahoo aims to go beyond advertising
summary: Apollo Global Management's $5 billion acquisition of Verizon's media unit, now called Yahoo, aims to expand beyond advertising into new ventures like subscription services and sports betting. The deal includes brands such as AOL and TechCrunch, with Apollo seeking to leverage Yahoo's extensive user base and iconic assets. While Verizon struggled to make the media division profitable, Apollo plans to apply its expertise in managing diverse investments and potentially reorganize the new entity for growth.

title: Google to power Virginia data centers with 24/7 clean energy from AES
summary: AES has signed a 10-year agreement to exclusively supply 24/7 clean energy to three Google data centers in Virginia, utilizing a 500-MW portfolio of resources. This partnership aims to decarbonize Google's operations in the state and sets a precedent for other companies seeking to eliminate carbon from their energy supply. The AES portfolio will require approximately $600 million for its clean energy projects.

title: Vodafone teams up with Google Cloud on data analytics
summary: Mobile operator Vodafone Group Plc and Alphabet Inc's Google Cloud have formed a strategic partnership to jointly develop data services. This collaboration will involve about 1,000 workers creating "Nucleus," a cloud-based storage and analytics portal for Vodafone's data, and developing "Dynamo" for data transport across countries. The companies also aim to offer consultancy services to other multinational businesses for moving data to the cloud.

title: I'm Not Turning Off App Tracking On My iPhone, Because I’m A Total Cuck
summary: The author humorously explains her decision to not disable app tracking on her iPhone, despite Apple's new privacy feature allowing users to opt out. She describes herself as a "datacuck" who enjoys personalized ads and wants to see "how far this goes" when it comes to data collection, contrasting her personal choice with the recommended smart privacy practices. The article satirically delves into the perceived benefits of targeted advertising while acknowledging the serious implications of data privacy and Facebook's track record.

title: Highwoods Properties Inc (HIW) Q1 2021 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Highwoods Properties Inc. (HIW) reported Q1 2021 FFO of $0.91 per share and increased its full-year FFO outlook, driven by improved leasing activity and strong performance in its Sunbelt markets. The company also announced plans to acquire a portfolio of office assets from Preferred Apartment Communities for $769 million, funded by selling $500-600 million in non-core assets. Executives highlighted rising office utilization rates, significant job growth announcements in their key markets like Raleigh and Nashville, and continued optimism for long-term growth.

title: Google (GOOGL) stock hits all-time high on Q1 2021 earnings, announces $50 billion buyback
summary: Alphabet (Google's parent company) reported record Q1 2021 earnings, with revenues of $55.31 billion and EPS of $26.29, significantly beating analyst estimates. Google's stock hit an all-time high of over $2400/share in after-hours trading following the announcement. The company also announced a new $50 billion share repurchase program for its Class C capital stock.

title: What do Apple’s new privacy settings mean for you?
summary: Apple is rolling out new privacy settings requiring app developers to explicitly ask users for permission to track their browsing habits across other apps and websites. This change is expected to significantly impact the mobile advertising market as many users are anticipated to decline tracking, potentially reducing ad effectiveness and revenue for businesses and publishers. The move has created a rift with companies like Facebook, which argues it will harm small businesses.

title: Apple and Google Are Killing the (Ad) Cookie. Here’s Why
summary: Apple and Google are implementing separate changes that will effectively end the use of third-party advertising cookies, significantly altering how marketers track online activity and target ads. Apple is requiring app developers to gain user permission for tracking across apps and websites, while Google is developing a cookie alternative that allows for targeted advertising without relying on individual web history. Both tech giants cite privacy as the driving force behind these changes, though Google also emphasizes balancing privacy with the financial viability of web publishing.

title: Nature as a building block for Microsoft’s new Silicon Valley Campus
summary: Microsoft's new Silicon Valley campus in Mountain View, California, is designed as an ecologically integrated site, earning it a spot on the COTE Top Ten list for its sustainable features. The campus incorporates water reuse, clean energy production, carbon reduction, and native ecology restoration. Key elements include an extensive solar panel system, an integrated water management system for net-zero non-potable water, and the use of Cross Laminated Timber to reduce its carbon footprint.

title: Double down on health and fitness with Garmin’s Venu 2 Series GPS smartwatch
summary: Garmin announced the Venu 2 and Venu 2S GPS smartwatches, designed to help users achieve a healthier lifestyle with new features like fitness age, advanced sleep tracking with sleep score, and numerous health monitoring tools. The Venu 2 series offers over 25 built-in sports apps, enhanced battery life, and smart features for daily convenience. Available in two sizes, these smartwatches are priced at $399.99 and aim to provide deeper insights into overall wellness.

title: Mr. Cooper secures deal with Google Cloud for mortgage servicing platform
summary: Mr. Cooper Group has partnered with Google Cloud to develop a new digital mortgage servicing platform. This platform will leverage AI and machine learning to automate loan documentation processes, aiming to make mortgage servicing easier for homeowners and improve operational efficiency. The collaboration builds on Mr. Cooper's existing technological investments and aims to make these advancements available to the broader industry.

title: Here's how much money you'd have if you bought $1,000 worth of Netflix stock in 2011
summary: This article examines the significant return on investment for Netflix stock over the past decade. A $1,000 investment in Netflix in 2011 would have grown to over $15,000 by April 2021, far outpacing the S&P 500, Google, and Apple. Despite recent subscriber growth concerns, analysts believe Netflix is well-positioned for the long term due to its first-mover advantage and extensive content investments, even amidst increasing competition from other streaming services.

title: The ARKW ETF: Leading the Future of Advertising
summary: The ARK Web x.0 ETF (ARKW) is an actively managed ETF focused on disruptive growth and internet-driven themes, including internet advertising. The article highlights ARKW's leverage to the increasing shift towards digital advertising, particularly as retail footprints decline. It projects significant growth in US digital ad spending, suggesting its critical role in the future economy.

title: UiPath IPO raises $1.3 billion by pricing shares above marketed range
summary: UiPath Inc. and its shareholders raised $1.3 billion in an initial public offering, pricing shares above the marketed range at $56 each, valuing the company at $29 billion. This valuation is below its February funding round valuation of $35 billion, partly due to a dip in software stocks. The company, founded in Romania, has grown significantly and its CEO, Daniel Dines, retains significant voting power.

title: Synchronoss CEO still has high hopes for RCS in U.S.
summary: Despite the dissolution of the Cross Carrier Messaging Initiative (CCMI), Synchronoss Technologies remains optimistic about the future of Rich Communications Services (RCS) in the U.S., with CEO Jeff Miller believing in its eventual success and interoperability. The company, which was contracted to provide the RCS platform for CCMI, is now focusing on one-on-one partnerships with carriers who are still bullish on the technology. Synchronoss sees a significant opportunity for brands to engage consumers through RCS, with a model similar to its successful deployment in Japan, offering a richer, more interactive experience than traditional SMS.

title: Microsoft to invest $1 bln in Malaysia to set up data centres - Malaysian PM
summary: Microsoft Corporation announced a $1 billion investment over the next five years in Malaysia to establish its first "datacentre region" in the country. This initiative is part of a new partnership program with the Malaysian government and local companies, aiming to boost the nation's digital economy and provide digital skills training for up to a million Malaysians. The investment follows Malaysia's efforts to attract foreign direct investments after a significant decline last year.

title: Zscaler Acquires Trustdome for Cloud Security Posture Management Boost -
summary: Zscaler is acquiring Trustdome to enhance its cloud security posture management (CSPM) capabilities, aiming to help MSSPs, MSPs, and customers mitigate security risks across major cloud platforms. Trustdome's Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM) platform will strengthen Zscaler's existing CSPM offerings by providing granular governance over data, applications, and services in public cloud environments. This acquisition comes amidst booming demand for CSPM solutions, with market revenues projected to reach $9 billion by 2026.

title: Alianza entre Televisa y Univision crea un gigante de contenidos de habla hispana
summary: Grupo Televisa and Univision Holdings have merged their content assets to create the largest Spanish-language media group, focusing on a new streaming platform targeting 600 million Spanish speakers. Televisa will receive USD 4.8 billion and become the largest shareholder with 45% of the new Televisa-Univision, which also secured USD 1 billion in strategic investments from partners like Google and SoftBank. The new entity is projected to achieve USD 4 billion in sales and USD 1.6 billion in EBITDA, positioning it for digital transformation and global content leadership.

title: Cogent Communications signs lease for T5@Minneapolis data center
summary: Cogent Communications has signed a lease with Legacy Investing for space in the T5@Minneapolis data center, located within the Sleep Number Corp. headquarters building in downtown Minneapolis. This is described as a significant signing for the data center, which is owned and operated by Legacy Investing.

title: Mexico’s Televisa to Merge Content Business With Univision
summary: Mexico's Grupo Televisa SAB is merging its content business with Univision Communications Inc. to create a new company called Televisa-Univision. This tie-up aims to expand streaming-video services in Spanish-speaking markets, with SoftBank Group Corp. and Google Inc. investing $1 billion. The move comes as traditional broadcasters face increasing competition from streaming services.

title: TELEVISA Y UNIVISION COMBINAN ACTIVOS EN MATERIA DE CONTENIDOS
summary: Grupo Televisa and Univision Holdings Inc. have announced a definitive agreement to combine Televisa's content assets with Univision, forming the largest Spanish-speaking media group globally. This new entity, Televisa-Univision, will leverage the combined content libraries and production capabilities to target the 600 million Spanish speakers worldwide, supported by strategic partners like SoftBank, Google, and The Raine Group. Televisa will maintain control over its broadcasting concessions in Mexico and telecommunications businesses, while increasing its stake in Univision.

title: Televisa to Merge its Media, Content and Production Assets with Univision in Landmark Transaction, Creating the Premier Global Spanish-Language Media Company
summary: Grupo Televisa and Univision Holdings, Inc. announced a definitive transaction agreement to combine Televisa’s content and media assets with Univision, forming the largest Spanish-language media company globally: Televisa-Univision. This merger will create a premier media entity with extensive content libraries and production capabilities to serve the underserved global Spanish-language streaming market. The transaction is valued at $4.8 billion from Televisa's content assets, including cash, equity, and other sources, and is partially financed by a $1 billion Series C preferred investment led by SoftBank Latin America Fund.

title: The Fastest-Growing Sport Might Surprise You
summary: Esports are rapidly growing, attracting a massive global viewership and disrupting traditional sports. Despite its significant growth and investment from companies like Amazon (who bought Twitch for $970 million in 2014), the esports market is still early in its development, valued at $1.1 billion in 2021. Investors can gain exposure to this industry through ETFs like the Global X Video Games & Esports ETF (Nasdaq: HERO).

title: Manager Question of the Month: How Active Fund Managers Cope With Index Concentration
summary: This article discusses the challenges active fund managers face due to increasing index concentration, particularly in U.S. large-cap growth benchmarks dominated by a few technology companies. It explores how managers adapt their strategies, including considering a switch from diversified to nondiversified funds, and the trade-offs involved in maintaining performance against highly concentrated indexes while adhering to SEC diversification rules. The piece highlights various approaches taken by investment firms like T. Rowe Price and Wellington Management.

title: Today In Retail: PriceSmart’s Revenues Increase 3.4 Pct; Handy Collaborates With Gotham Properties
summary: PriceSmart reported a 3.4 percent increase in total revenues for the second quarter of fiscal 2021, and Handy partnered with Gotham Properties to offer home services to tenants. Additionally, Levi Strauss plans to open new stores and expects a 25 percent rise in first-half sales, while UPS is acquiring electric vertical takeoff aircraft to enhance delivery efficiency and reduce emissions.

title: JPMorgan’s Chief Sees a Boom Coming (Published 2021)
authors: Andrew Ross Sorkin Jason Karaian Sarah Kessler Michael J. de la Merced Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni
summary: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon predicts a potential economic boom extending into 2023 driven by excess savings, deficit spending, infrastructure plans, and vaccine-induced euphoria, though he warns of potential inflation and aggressive interest rate hikes. He also addresses concerns about the growing influence of shadow banking and big tech in finance, China's perception of American decline, and the complexities of addressing climate change. Dimon's annual letter also touched on remote work reducing office space needs, cybersecurity spending, and specific tax loopholes he believes should be closed.

title: Meet the highest paid CEO in S&P 500, Paycom’s $211M man
summary: Chad Richison, the founder and CEO of Paycom Software Inc., was awarded compensation valued at $211 million in 2020, making him the highest-paid CEO in the S&P 500 based on disclosures so far. This compensation package, centered on restricted shares, could be worth over $2 billion if Paycom's stock price significantly increases, demonstrating a performance-based alignment with shareholder interests. Richison's equity award is contingent on the company's share price more than doubling and reaching specific targets within the next decade.

title: First Look: The New Sonos Roam Speaker Is Versatile but Pricey | Reviews by Wirecutter
summary: The article provides a first look at the new Sonos Roam speaker, highlighting its versatility as a portable Bluetooth speaker, a smart speaker with voice activation, and an integrated part of a Sonos multiroom system. While impressed by its sound quality and portability, the review notes its high price ($170) and short battery life as potential drawbacks. The Sonos Roam is presented as an ideal entry point for those looking to start a multiroom speaker system.

title: As Ad Spending Explodes, Look to These Communications ETFs
summary: The U.S. advertising market is projected to grow significantly in 2021 as businesses increase spending to recover from the pandemic, with an anticipated 15% expansion excluding political advertising. This resurgence is driven by stimulus measures and economic recovery, particularly benefiting digital ad platforms like Facebook and Google. Investors can capitalize on this trend through communication services ETFs such as XLC, FCOM, and VOX, which include major players in the digital advertising space.

title: Newfound Popularity of Thematic ETFs
summary: Thematic ETFs, which invest in baskets of stocks benefiting from emerging trends, technology, or evolving economic landscapes, have seen a significant surge in popularity since October 2020, with AUM growing by 132%. Despite this growth, the article highlights potential risks associated with these ETFs, including the reversal of investor enthusiasm impacting fund flow and performance, the concentrated holdings of individual stocks within the ETFs, and the potential for misleading diversification that may dilute thematic exposure and justify higher fees. Investors are advised against chasing "hot" ETFs without understanding their underlying holdings and potential risks.

title: Brinker International's Virtual Brand, It's Just Wings, Integrates With Google To Offer New Pickup Option
summary: Brinker International's virtual brand, It's Just Wings, has integrated with Google to provide a new pickup option for its customers. Guests can now easily order and pick up their favorite wings directly through Google Search and Google Maps from over 1,000 participating kitchens nationwide. This integration aims to enhance the digital guest experience by offering convenience, value, and a seamless ordering process with contactless payment options.

title: Iconic American Automaker Ford Motor Says Employees Can Work From Home ‘Indefinitely’ With Its Newly Redesigned Hybrid In-Office And Remote Model
summary: Ford Motor Company announced a new progressive, flexible, hybrid work model allowing approximately 30,000 white-collar employees to work from home indefinitely with flexible hours. The company plans to redesign its corporate office interiors to be versatile for collaborative work, driven by a survey showing 95% of office workers prefer self-determined work arrangements. This shift aligns Ford with other major corporations embracing remote work, leading to an exodus from big cities to more affordable locations and potential benefits for both employees and companies.

title: Google Cloud Pricing vs AWS: A Fair Comparison?
summary: This article provides a detailed comparison of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Amazon Web Services (AWS) pricing for compute instances and storage. It highlights differences in market positioning, on-demand and reserved VM pricing, and various storage options, noting where direct comparisons can be misleading due to differing structures. The article also discusses cost optimization strategies using NetApp Cloud Volumes ONTAP.

title: Clarivate celebrates BD’s culture of innovation
summary: Clarivate has named BD to its Top 100 Global Innovators 2021 list for the sixth time, recognizing the company's significant investment in innovation and its commitment to protecting intellectual property. BD invests over a billion dollars annually in innovation, contributing to advancements in medical technology, and holds approximately 27,000 active, issued patents worldwide. The recognition highlights BD's ongoing efforts to advance global health through pioneering solutions and a robust intellectual property portfolio.

title: Technology and the Free Press: The Need for Healthy Journalism in a Healthy Democracy
summary: This article by Brad Smith, Vice Chair & President of Microsoft, discusses the critical relationship between technology and a healthy free press in a democracy. It highlights how technology, particularly the dominance of companies like Google in digital advertising and content aggregation, has negatively impacted the financial viability of journalism, especially local news. Smith advocates for a multi-faceted solution involving continued evolution within journalism, greater responsibility from tech companies, and government intervention through legislation modeled after Australia's recent law to restore competition and support news organizations.

title: How Google’s New Career Certificates Could Disrupt the College Degree (Exclusive)
summary: Google is launching new career certificate programs on Coursera in project management, data analytics, and user experience design, aimed at bridging skills gaps and providing high-paying job qualifications without requiring a college degree. These programs are designed to be completed in six months or less and are supported by need-based scholarships and partnerships with over 130 employers committed to hiring graduates. Google is also enhancing its search engine to help job seekers find opportunities based on education and experience levels, including "no degree" options, contributing to economic recovery and addressing unemployment exacerbated by the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: The 10 most innovative companies in consumer electronics
summary: This article highlights the top 10 most innovative companies in consumer electronics, showcasing how they adapted and thrived during the pandemic by releasing useful new products. It features companies like Corning, Apple, and Samsung alongside newer players such as Raspberry Pi, Tempo, and Aira. The piece details Corning's advancements in Gorilla Glass and Ceramic Shield, emphasizing their impact on device durability.

title: Liberty Media CEO Sees Amazon Driving Big Tech’s TV Sports Rights Ambitions
summary: Liberty Media CEO Greg Maffei believes Amazon is leading the charge for Big Tech platforms to acquire more international sports rights, driven by their increasing involvement in agreements like NFL games. Maffei highlighted the growing seriousness of Amazon's investments in sports content and predicted other tech giants would follow suit. He also noted that the break up of the cable bundle and pressure on regional sports networks are contributing factors to Silicon Valley's pursuit of global sports rights.

title: Stock Prices & Quotes with Live Stock Market Charts
summary: This article provides real-time stock prices, quotes, live stock charts, and historical information for publicly traded companies. It features a comprehensive list of top stocks by market capitalization, including major technology and financial firms, along with their current prices, daily changes, volume, and P/E ratios. The platform also offers market data for total market cap, BTC dominance, 24h volume, BTC price, S&P 500, gold, and USD/EUR exchange rates.

title: BUZZ, the ETF of Social-Media Darlings, Drops in Trading Debut
summary: The VanEck Vectors Social Sentiment ETF (BUZZ) began trading, aiming to capitalize on the retail-investing trend and the influence of social media buzz on stock performance. This ETF includes stocks like Tesla and DraftKings, aiming to capture the "new era of investing" where information is sourced and shared online.

title: KT and LG U+ buy into OneStore, the Google Play killer
summary: South Korean mobile carriers KT and LG U+ have acquired stakes in One Store, a local app market, joining SK Telecom to challenge the dominance of Google Play and Apple App Store. This strategic investment aims to bolster the domestic IT ecosystem and comes as foreign app markets face increasing criticism over their in-app payment policies. One Store saw a significant increase in transaction volume and turned a profit for the first time in 2020, benefiting from the controversy surrounding Google's 30 percent commission policy.

title: Murphy’s Law: Fiserv Had ‘Most Overpaid’ CEO
summary: A new study by "As You Sow" found that former Fiserv CEO Jeffery Yabuki was the 15th most overpaid CEO in 2020, making 428 times the average worker's salary. His annual compensation was $27.6 million, $13.8 million more than deemed appropriate, highlighting the growing wealth gap. The report also identified Sundar Pichai of Alphabet Inc. and David M. Zaslov of Discovery, Inc. as the top two most overpaid CEOs, with shareholder opposition to such pay packages increasing.

title: Wearable Device Maker Huami Steps Out of Xiaomi’s Shadow
summary: Huami Corp. is rebranding outside China to Zepp Health Corp. and changing its ticker symbol to ZEPP, indicating a strategic move away from its long-standing relationship with Xiaomi. This rebranding is supported by a series of global acquisitions, investments, and partnerships aimed at establishing its own identity and improving its financial margins, which have been pressured by its association with Xiaomi. Despite declaring independence, Huami recently extended its "most preferred partner" status agreement with Xiaomi, highlighting a cautious approach to separation.

title: Manbang Group loads up billion-dollar IPO
summary: Manbang Group, a China-based trucking services provider backed by Tencent, SoftBank, and Alibaba, has confidentially filed for a US IPO aiming to raise at least $1 billion. The company, also known as Full Truck Alliance, operates an online platform for truck bookings and was valued at nearly $12 billion in its last funding round in November 2020, where it secured $1.7 billion. Previous investors include Alphabet’s CapitalG unit, Vision Fund, and various other capital firms.

title: Google Sued for Refusing to Redeem Google Play Gift Cards
summary: Google and Alphabet, Inc. are facing a class-action lawsuit for allegedly refusing to redeem Google Play gift cards in accordance with California law. The lawsuit claims Google erects barriers to redemption, including demanding detailed purchase information, which can render gift cards "impossible" to use, especially for recipients of gifts. The plaintiff, who experienced these issues, alleges that Google's conduct violates California's Gift Card Law, Unfair Competition Law, and constitutes a breach of contract, seeking class certification, restitution, damages, and other relief.

title: Security top of mind for digital transformation projects
summary: A new ASUG and Onapsis survey reveals that security is a top concern for SAP customers undertaking S/4HANA migrations and other digital transformation projects, especially when moving to the cloud. The survey indicated that these modernization projects have not been significantly slowed by the COVID-19 pandemic. While cloud providers handle some security aspects, organizations remain responsible for data security and for addressing the unique complexities and vulnerabilities of SAP applications in a hybrid IT environment.

title: ADT and DISH Network Partner to Bring Smart Home Security to More Customers
summary: ADT Inc. and DISH Network Corporation announced a partnership where DISH will provide marketing, sales, and installation services for ADT smart home security products. This collaboration expands ADT's reach to existing and potential subscribers, particularly in rural and exurban areas, leveraging DISH's nationwide network and its subsidiary OnTech Smart Services. The partnership aims to offer integrated smart home and security solutions to DISH's more than 20 million subscribers.

title: Arrastrados por Banco Supervielle, el S&P Merval perdió 3,3% y los ADR cayeron hasta 10%
summary: On February 22, 2021, the S&P Merval index fell 3.3%, primarily driven by a significant drop in Banco Supervielle shares. Argentine ADRs also experienced declines of up to 10%, while the country risk rose by 0.9%. This downturn mirrored negative trends on Wall Street, influenced by rising US Treasury bond yields and inflation concerns.
source: El Economista: Últimas noticias económicas y financieras
source_domain: El Economista: Últimas noticias económicas y financieras

title: J.B. Hunt, Google partner to develop new supply chain technology
summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. and Google have formed a multi-year partnership to accelerate J.B. Hunt's digital transformation and develop next-generation supply chain technology, leveraging Google's Data Cloud and AI/ML tools. This collaboration aims to enhance J.B. Hunt 360, centralize data, improve efficiency, and provide predictive analytics for the logistics industry. Analysts from Stephens Inc. see this alliance as a significant driver for J.B. Hunt's strategic plan and their long-term position as a digital disrupter in the transportation sector.

title: J.B. Hunt Enlists Google to Match Carriers With Shippers
summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. is partnering with Google to leverage AI and machine-learning models to enhance its freight-matching segment. This collaboration aims to improve the pairing of shippers with carriers on its J.B. Hunt 360 platform. The goal is to help shippers predict supply and demand and enable carriers to estimate future fuel and transportation costs more accurately, strengthening J.B. Hunt's brokerage business amidst competition from digital-only rivals.

title: Google and J.B. Hunt Announce Strategic Alliance to Accelerate Innovation in Transportation and Logistics
summary: Google and J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. have announced a multi-year strategic alliance to accelerate J.B. Hunt's digital transformation and collaborate on next-generation supply chain platform technology. By leveraging Google Cloud's AI and ML tools, J.B. Hunt aims to enhance its J.B. Hunt 360° platform, enabling greater efficiency, visibility, and predictive analytics in the transportation and logistics industry. This partnership seeks to digitally transform the shipping experience for shippers, carriers, and service providers, ultimately creating a more efficient transportation network in North America.

title: An Interview With Twilio CEO Jeff Lawson
summary: This article features an interview with Twilio CEO Jeff Lawson, author of "Ask Your Developer," discussing how companies can harness the power of software developers to win in the 21st century. Lawson emphasizes the "build or die" philosophy, where software development is a core competency for modern businesses and highlights the importance of organizing companies into small, autonomous teams and empowering developers to solve business problems rather than just implementing prescribed solutions. The interview also touches on Twilio's own practices, including requiring all employees to build an app, and the company's focus on markets outside of China.

title: Bumble CEO: 'If you want to behave poorly, you cannot do it here'
summary: Bumble CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd emphasizes the dating app's strict zero-tolerance policy against hate speech and toxic behavior, including body shaming, racism, and homophobia. The company, which recently went public, aims to hold users accountable for their actions online, reflecting Herd's personal mission to empower women and curb harmful conduct. Bumble has also supported legislation against cyberflashing and plans to expand its services to support women through various life stages.

title: Global Payments and Google Form Strategic Partnership to Reimagine Digital Payments
summary: Global Payments and Google have announced a multi-year strategic partnership to transform digital payments for merchants worldwide. This collaboration involves Global Payments migrating its merchant acquiring technology to Google Cloud and becoming Google's worldwide merchant acquiring provider. The partnership will also focus on co-selling opportunities and product innovation, integrating Google's public APIs with Global Payments' software to offer a comprehensive suite of cloud-based solutions to merchants.

title: BNY Mellon, Google Cloud technology to predict Treasury settlement failures
summary: BNY Mellon has partnered with Google Cloud to develop AI and machine learning technology aimed at predicting U.S. Treasury settlement failures for its clients. This new technology can predict around 40% of eligible settlement failures with 90% accuracy, helping to mitigate liquidity problems in the $22 trillion U.S. Treasury market. The model analyzes supply and demand, trading velocity, and counterparty activity to make these predictions.

title: Here’s how the FAANG companies stack up this earnings season
summary: This article examines the performance of FAANG companies during the latest earnings season, highlighting their continued impressive growth in revenue and display of pricing power. Despite their large size and the challenges posed by the pandemic, these companies maintained successful growth strategies in the fourth quarter and throughout the previous year. The piece underscores the dominance of FAANG stocks in earnings reports.

title: EX-99.2
summary: CCC Information Services Inc. is set to go public through a SPAC merger with Dragoneer Growth Opportunities Corp. in a deal valuing the IT provider for car insurers at $6.5 billion. The total deal, including debt, is worth $7 billion, confirming an earlier Wall Street Journal report. The transaction, expected to close in the second quarter, will generate nearly $1 billion in proceeds for CCC, which plans to invest in software research and development.

title: White & Case Advises Deutsche Bank on Strategic Partnership with Google Cloud
summary: Global law firm White & Case LLP advised Deutsche Bank AG on a strategic, multi-year partnership with Google Cloud. This partnership aims to accelerate Deutsche Bank’s transition to cloud services and facilitate the co-innovation of new products and services. White & Case provided comprehensive advice on contractual, regulatory, IP, and data protection aspects of the transaction.

title: Apple, Its Control Over the iPhone, and The Internet
summary: This article examines Apple's extensive control over the iPhone ecosystem and its implications for the internet, competition, and future digital economies. It argues that Apple's policies, while leading to success, inhibit innovation and create anti-competitive barriers for developers and users through its App Store, payment systems, and technology decisions. The author suggests regulatory intervention to force competition in app distribution and payments, allowing users to download apps from any source and developers to use alternative payment solutions.

title: ‘Bad Bets’: Antitrust Class Action Alleges Major Brokerages, Hedge Funds, Clearinghouses Conspired Against Ordinary Investors
summary: An antitrust class action lawsuit alleges that major brokerages, hedge funds, and clearinghouses conspired to prevent non-professional investors from controlling their investments during a social media-driven price surge. The complaint asserts that these entities disabled buy features on trading platforms for certain "meme stocks" like GameStop, forcing retail investors to sell at lower prices and artificially reducing stock values to mitigate losses from their short positions. The lawsuit seeks to represent investors who purchased specific securities and were impacted by the alleged anticompetitive conduct between January 1, 2021, and the cessation of the illicit activities.

title: Businesses Gain Unparalleled Collaboration and Productivity With Motorola Solutions’ New Smart Radio
summary: Motorola Solutions announced the launch of its new MOTOTRBO Ion smart radio, designed to enhance collaboration and productivity for businesses. This smart radio combines reliable voice communication with broadband data, a full Android interface, and an open application ecosystem. It aims to integrate business workflows, leveraging capabilities like a 13-megapixel camera and a 4-inch touchscreen for various industries.

title: Clarivate Launches Web of Science My Research Assistant Mobile Application
summary: Clarivate Plc launched Web of Science My Research Assistant, a new mobile application designed to help scientific researchers search, save, and share publication records from the Web of Science citation index. The app offers features like personalized feeds and reading lists, with both free and unlimited functionality available depending on the user's institutional affiliation. This initiative aims to improve the researcher experience by providing a more personalized service and fostering collaboration within the science community.

title: Microsoft Is Leasing The Most Data Center Capacity In US
summary: Microsoft led U.S. data center capacity leasing in 2020, with capacity tripling nationwide compared to 2019. The company leased 178 megawatts in Virginia alone and is expanding its global data center footprint to support Microsoft Azure. Other major leasers included Bytedance (TikTok), Facebook, Oracle, Google, and Twitter, driven by the shift to remote work during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Google Defends Against Allegations Of Collusion With Facebook On Ads
summary: Adam Cohen, Google's director of economic policy, has refuted claims of collusion with Facebook regarding ad-sharing agreements, calling allegations by Texas attorney general Ken Paxton "misleading." The defense comes after a New York Times expose detailed an antitrust lawsuit suggesting Google provided special advantages to Facebook. Cohen clarified that Facebook competes in a crowded online advertising space and that their Open Bidding program is not manipulated in Facebook's favor, constituting less than 4% of Google's display ads.

title: Howard Alum & 1st Black Female Google VP Appointed to PagerDuty Board of Directors
summary: Howard University alumna Bonita Stewart, the first Black female vice president at Google, has been appointed to the Board of Directors at PagerDuty, Inc. Stewart brings over 20 years of experience in leading multi-billion dollar operations and accelerating digital technology adoption. She also has public company board experience with Pluralsight (NASDAQ:PS) and Decker Outdoor Corporation (NYSE:DECK), and her appointment is seen as a move towards greater diversity and inclusion in tech.

title: These Hot Stocks Made This American Century's Best 2020 U.S. Diversified Stock Fund
summary: The American Century Focused Dynamic Growth Fund (ACFSX) was the top-performing U.S. diversified stock fund in 2020, up 73.63% compared to the S&P 500's 18.40%. The fund achieved this success by investing in high-growth companies like Amazon, Facebook, Alphabet, Tesla, Square, DocuSign, Nike, Chipotle Mexican Grill, and Chegg, focusing on those with high sustainable growth rates and strong fundamentals, consistent with CAN SLIM principles. Its strong performance has earned it repeated IBD Best Mutual Funds Awards.

title: Tesla market value crosses $800 billion for the first time
summary: Tesla Inc.'s market capitalization surpassed $800 billion for the first time, driven by a significant jump in its stock price on Friday. This surge has also propelled CEO Elon Musk to become the world's richest man, surpassing Amazon's Jeff Bezos. The company's valuation now places it among Wall Street's most valuable firms, despite its production volume being a fraction of larger automotive rivals.

title: YouTube Restores News Corp-Owned TalkRadio’s Channel After Brief Suspension
summary: YouTube briefly suspended the channel of News Corp-owned U.K. radio station TalkRadio due to alleged COVID-19 misinformation, but reinstated it hours later after further review. The platform cited its policy against content contradicting health authorities but made an exception, while TalkRadio maintained its robust editorial controls. The incident follows YouTube's expanded policies on COVID-19 and vaccine misinformation.

title: Ad-Tech Company AdTheorent Reaches $1 Billion SPAC Deal to Go Public
summary: Ad-Tech Company AdTheorent is nearing a SPAC deal valued at approximately $1 billion to go public. The firm, which uses machine learning to optimize advertising campaigns without relying on sensitive personal data, joins other digital advertising companies in leveraging SPACs for public listing. This move allows AdTheorent to bypass the traditional IPO process.

title: Google’s self-driving spinoff signals big Mountain View expansion with sublease
summary: Waymo, Google's self-driving car spinoff, is expanding its presence in Mountain View with a new sublease for office space. This marks the first time Waymo's South Bay corporate employees will be housed outside of its Googleplex headquarters. The move signals a significant expansion for the autonomous driving technology company.

title: How cloud computing can speed materials design
summary: Cloud computing is dramatically accelerating materials discovery by enabling scientists to screen millions of virtual compounds and predict their properties in a fraction of the time previously required. This advancement, building on computational materials science successes like Gorilla Glass, allows for more efficient design of novel materials across various fields. The use of large-scale physics-based simulations on cloud platforms like Google Cloud generates high-quality training data, boosting machine-learning models for even faster and more accurate material predictions.

title: Yext CEO Howard Lerman returns to the OMR Podcast
summary: Yext CEO Howard Lerman returned to the OMR Podcast to discuss the current search landscape and the importance for companies to provide search alternatives to Google. Lerman emphasizes that brands need to optimize their websites for search to keep customers from going to Google and finding competitors, highlighting Yext's mission to revolutionize company search functions. He also discusses the company's $2 billion valuation.

title: Cloud recasts global data center switch market
summary: The global data center switch market is being reshaped by cloud providers and enterprise cloud makers, leading to a decline in traditional networking gear sales. White box switches, favored by large-scale cloud environments, saw significant growth while established vendors like Arista Networks, Cisco, and Juniper Networks experienced revenue drops. This shift demands that vendors reconfigure their products and software to be cloud-focused, addressing enterprise needs for independent management software and hybrid environments.

title: Quantum computing applications for the energy industry
summary: This article explores the potential applications of quantum computing in the energy industry, discussing its fundamental principles like superposition and entanglement, and contrasting it with classical computing. It highlights specific areas where quantum technology, including quantum annealers and quantum-inspired computing, can provide solutions, such as simulating molecules for material science, solving complex combinatorial optimization problems in planning and logistics, and improving machine learning algorithms. The article emphasizes early opportunities for quantum computing in chemistry simulation and optimization due to current hardware limitations (NISQ devices) and looks ahead to future advancements.

title: Digital Ad Spending Poised for Exceptional Growth
summary: Digital ad spending is expected to see strong growth in 2021 and beyond due to increased online consumer activity during COVID-19. While major digital ad players like Snap, Pinterest, Twitter, and Spotify are considered overvalued, Facebook and Alphabet are viewed as reasonably valued and well-positioned to benefit from this trend. The shift towards e-commerce and increased time spent online has accelerated advertisers' move to digital channels, with direct-response ads providing a stable option during economic uncertainty, though brand marketing remains crucial for long-term customer value.

title: Zepp Z review: An excellent watch hampered by two software flaws
summary: The Zepp Z smartwatch is reviewed as a well-built device with great health tracking features and strong battery life but is hindered by poor notification handling and a lack of a third-party app ecosystem. Despite its premium hardware and responsive software, these two software flaws prevent it from being a top contender, especially when compared to competitors like the TicWatch Pro 3 and Samsung Galaxy Watch 3.

title: The dark reality behind Slack’s billion-dollar sale to Salesforce
summary: The article discusses Slack's acquisition by Salesforce for $27.7 billion, framing it as a "defensive" move rather than a success story. It argues that Slack, despite its innovative product, was unable to compete against Microsoft's bundling of Teams, highlighting a broader issue of tech giants stifling smaller innovators through monopolistic practices. The author suggests that this trend threatens consumer choice and calls for a rebalancing of the playing field against unchecked corporate power.

title: Deutsche Bank and Google Cloud sign pioneering cloud and innovation partnership
summary: Deutsche Bank and Google Cloud have formed a strategic, multi-year partnership to accelerate the bank's transition to cloud technology and co-innovate new financial products and services. This collaboration aims to improve resilience, speed up market delivery of new capabilities, and reduce costs for Deutsche Bank, while also exploring new lending products, unified retail interfaces, and enhancements to its Autobahn platform. The partnership signifies a move towards more intelligent data use and a flexible environment for delivering innovative banking solutions to clients.

title: Chasing the hydrogen dream: Ballard on quest to transform long-haul transportation
summary: Ballard Power Systems, a Canadian pioneer in hydrogen fuel cell technology, is experiencing a resurgence in investor interest and market capitalization after a tumultuous history. The company, which specializes in fuel cells for heavy-duty transportation, is banking on global demand for clean energy and government initiatives to drive widespread adoption, despite past setbacks and competition from battery electric vehicles. With strategic partnerships and a focus on automation to reduce costs, Ballard aims for significant revenue growth from China, Europe, and North America in the coming years.

title: Alphabet (Google) returns for second cat bond to top up quake cover
summary: Alphabet, Inc. (Google's parent company) has issued a second catastrophe bond, Phoenician Re Ltd. (Series 2020-2), for $95 million, quickly following its initial $237.5 million transaction. This second cat bond further increases its California earthquake insurance coverage, attaching where the first bond exhausts, demonstrating Alphabet's satisfaction with the efficiency and pricing offered by the capital markets for risk transfer. The move highlights the growing appeal of catastrophe bonds for large corporations seeking diversified and cost-effective insurance solutions for significant exposures.

title: Judge throws out Trump rules limiting skilled-worker visas
summary: A federal judge in California has struck down two Trump administration rules that aimed to significantly reduce the number of H-1B visas issued to skilled foreign workers. The judge ruled that the government failed to follow proper transparency procedures and that its argument of an emergency response to COVID-19 job losses was unconvincing. This decision is seen as a significant relief for companies and current H-1B visa holders.

title: Is Zoom a Chinese Company?
summary: This article addresses the common question of whether Zoom Video Communications Inc. is a Chinese company, clarifying its U.S. base despite its founder's origins and global operations. It also delves into Zoom's history, its market competitors, and its freemium business model, particularly highlighting how the COVID-19 pandemic fueled its growth. The piece concludes by touching on Zoom's tax collection practices in the U.S.

title: Alphabet’s (Google’s) first catastrophe bond priced on-target at $237.5m
summary: Alphabet (Google's parent company) has successfully priced its first catastrophe bond, Phoenician Re Ltd. (Series 2020-1), at the target size of $237.5 million. This cat bond will provide Alphabet with California earthquake insurance protection through its captive insurer and Hannover Re, marking a significant step for a major tech company entering the catastrophe bond market for efficient risk transfer. The bond offers a 3% coupon to investors across a three-year term.

title: Global Over the Top Market - Featuring 8*8 Inc., Alphabet Inc., and Amazon.com Inc. Among Others | Technavio
summary: The global Over the Top (OTT) market is projected to grow by USD 88.85 billion during 2020-2024, at a CAGR of almost 14%. This growth is primarily driven by the increasing demand for cloud streaming services and the rising adoption of target advertisement-based streaming applications. Technavio's report provides a comprehensive analysis including market sizing, forecast, trends, growth drivers, challenges, and vendor analysis featuring key players like 8x8 Inc., Alphabet Inc., Amazon.com Inc., and Netflix Inc.

title: The Value of Data in a Digital World
summary: This article discusses the increasing value of data in a digital world, contrasting it with the historical valuation of companies based on tangible assets. It explores why data should be considered an asset, despite current accounting rules, and proposes three approaches for data valuation: market-based, cost-based, and cash flow-based, providing examples for each. The article also touches on how data-rich enterprises can seize opportunities and mentions related ETFs that invest in data-centric technologies.

title: BuzzFeed acquires news website HuffPost from Verizon Media
summary: BuzzFeed has acquired news website HuffPost from Verizon Communications Inc., marking further consolidation in the online media sector. This deal brings two properties, previously struggling for ad dollars, under the control of HuffPost's co-founder, Jonah Peretti, with Verizon also taking a minority stake in the combined company. The acquisition aims to leverage a more affluent and age-diverse audience and explore new monetization opportunities.

title: BREAKING: Johnson & Johnson finally unveils its new robot-assisted surgery system
summary: Johnson & Johnson has unveiled Ottava, its new robot-assisted surgery system designed for unrivaled flexibility and control with six arms integrated into the operating table. The company plans to begin verification and validation processes in 2021, followed by clinical trials in 2022, and aims to combine it with the FDA-cleared Monarch platform for minimally invasive procedures and targeted drug delivery. J&J remains optimistic about the medtech market's recovery post-pandemic, expecting double-digit operational sales growth in 2021.

title: Who’s a Very Good Pandemic Business? Chewy Is. Oh, Yes It Is
summary: Chewy (CHWY) has experienced phenomenal growth in 2020, becoming a top pandemic business as pet care surged. CEO Sumit Singh's 2019 compensation of $108.2 million placed him among the highest-paid executives, despite the company not yet achieving profitability in its nine years of existence. This success highlights the booming online pet supply market.

title: 115 Amazon lobbyists. 1 works on climate
summary: Despite Amazon's public stance on climate action and its "Climate Pledge," an analysis reveals that only one out of its 115 lobbyists is focused on environmental issues. This raises questions about the company's commitment, with critics suggesting it may be "greenwashing." Other tech giants like Facebook also show similar discrepancies, while Microsoft, Apple, and Google appear to align their lobbying efforts more closely with their climate concerns.

title: Buy now! COVID-19 sparks Southeast Asian e-commerce boom
