summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has significantly accelerated e-commerce growth in Southeast Asia, with spending expected to triple to over $300 billion by 2025. While online travel and transport were hit, overall digital adoption surged, bringing 40 million new internet users online in the region in 2020. Indonesia's digital economy is also projected to nearly triple despite the wider economic downturn.

title: Google parent Alphabet turns to cat bonds for earthquake insurance
summary: Alphabet, Google's parent company, has entered the catastrophe bond market for the first time, seeking $237.5 million in earthquake insurance protection. This is facilitated through a Phoenician Re Ltd. cat bond transaction with capital market investors. The move highlights how major tech companies are utilizing the insurance-linked securities (ILS) market for efficient capacity to manage significant catastrophe exposures like California earthquakes.

title: Toyota-backed startup Pony.ai raises $267 mln in latest fundraising
summary: Pony.ai, a self-driving startup backed by Toyota, announced it raised $267 million in the initial phase of its latest fundraising round, valuing the company at $5.3 billion. This investment, led by Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan Board, aims to boost its presence in the United States and China and explore mobility services with Toyota. The company plans to use the funds for technology development and fleet expansion, including autonomous trucks.

title: Smart Offers: Sabre Partners With Google on AI-Powered Personalized Travel Tech
summary: Sabre, in partnership with Google, is launching an AI-powered "Smart Retail Engine" in early 2021 to offer personalized travel options. This technology aims to customize offerings for travelers, increase satisfaction, and boost industry revenue by leveraging AI and machine learning. The partnership seeks to transform customer experience and pricing in the travel sector.

title: A Look Behind the Vimeo Brand
summary: This article explores Vimeo's unique position in the crowded video platform market, highlighting its focus on community, storytelling tools, and value proposition compared to competitors like YouTube. Author Bryan Elliott shares insights from his professional experience and an interview with Vimeo CMO Harris Beber, discussing Vimeo's features, OTT capabilities, and a new service connecting creators with video professionals. The piece also delves into the author's personal journey in content creation, including his early experiences in the entertainment industry and the inspiration behind his career path, concluding that now is an optimal time for video storytelling.

title: Marvell to buy Inphi in $10bn semiconductor deal
summary: Semiconductor company Marvell Technology Group is set to acquire Inphi Corp in a $10 billion cash-and-stock deal. The acquisition aims to strengthen Marvell's leadership in cloud infrastructure and expand its 5G presence, leveraging Inphi's expertise in fiber-optic data traffic and its customer base including Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Facebook. This move is part of a broader trend of consolidation within the semiconductor industry.

title: Facebook, Google and Microsoft 'avoiding $3bn in tax in poorer nations'
summary: ActionAid estimates that Google, Facebook, and Microsoft are avoiding up to $2.8bn (£2.2bn) in tax revenue in developing nations, a sum that could significantly boost public services like healthcare and education. The charity is advocating for a new global tax system, ideally under the United Nations, requiring large corporations to pay a minimum tax rate based on their "real economic presence." This initiative highlights long-standing concerns about tech giants' tax contributions and their impact on global south countries, especially as these companies have seen soaring revenues during the pandemic.

title: Apple, Google and a Deal That Controls the Internet (Published 2020)
summary: The Justice Department has filed a landmark antitrust lawsuit against Google, targeting a secretive partnership with Apple worth billions where Google's search engine is the preselected choice on Apple devices. This alliance, seen as "co-opetition" by former Apple counsel, is now under scrutiny for potentially stifling competition and preventing smaller companies from flourishing. The lawsuit highlights the complex relationship between the two tech giants and their role in controlling web search.

title: How to invest in the S&P 500 without betting hard on the ‘FAAMG’ stocks that are 20% of the index
summary: This article discusses a strategy to invest in the S&P 500 without being overly exposed to the "FAAMG" stocks (Facebook, Apple, Amazon.com, Microsoft, and Google/Alphabet) which collectively represent 20% of the index's valuation. It suggests that when investing in a typical S&P 500 index fund, one is inherently making a significant bet on the continued success of these five dominant companies. The piece broadly hints at an "equal-weight S&P 500 ETF" as a potential solution for investors seeking diversification away from these outsized positions.

title: AT&T Has The Most Disappointing Big Company Stock This Year
summary: AT&T Inc. (NYSE: T) has recorded the worst stock performance among large-cap companies this year, dropping 27% while the S&P 500 gained 7%. This decline is significant compared to top companies like Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet, and Facebook, which have seen substantial gains. The company also reported a 5% fall in operating revenue and a 22% drop in EPS, coupled with massive long-term debt, despite an impressive dividend yield.

title: ExxonMobil Deploys QR Codes And NFC Tags for Streamlined Mobile Payment at the Pump
summary: ExxonMobil is implementing QR codes and NFC tags at over 11,500 U.S. stations to enable streamlined mobile payments with Apple Pay and Google Pay. This system leverages Apple App Clips for iPhone users without the ExxonMobil app and provides a web-based solution for Android users, enhancing contactless payment options at the pump. The initiative is part of ExxonMobil's ongoing efforts to innovate and offer secure, convenient payment methods, building on prior contactless payment solutions like "Alexa, Pay for Gas."

title: Apple, Google Worked as ‘One Company’ on Search Deal, U.S. Says
summary: The U.S. Justice Department has filed an antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet Inc.'s Google, accusing it of abusing its monopoly in search through a multibillion-dollar deal with Apple Inc. This agreement makes Google the default search engine on iPhones and other Apple devices. Documents from Google reportedly describe the potential loss of this deal as a "Code Red."

title: Expedia Group CEO on Google antitrust case: 'Very pleased to see the government finally taking action'
summary: Expedia Group CEO Peter Kern expressed satisfaction with the U.S. Justice Department's antitrust complaint against Google, hoping it will lead to a fairer marketplace for online travel companies. Kern stated that Expedia has "no axe to grind against Google" but believes the current market is not equitable, pointing out Google's dual role as a search platform and competitor. He emphasized that Expedia's goal is merely "a fair fight" in the industry.

title: Fisker closes deal for supplier Magna to build its SUV, take stake in startup
summary: Fisker Inc. announced a deal with Magna International Inc. for Magna to supply the vehicle platform and build its Ocean SUV, with Magna also receiving warrants for up to a 6% stake in Fisker. This partnership marks Magna's first entry into contract manufacturing for an EV startup and is seen as critical for Fisker's future, targeting significant sales volumes for the Ocean SUV starting in 2022. Fisker's merger with Spartan Energy Acquisition Corp. is expected to close on Oct. 30, with shares trading as "FSR" on the NYSE.

title: Free Apple 5G iPhones are offered by carriers to lure upgraders
summary: US carriers such as AT&T and Verizon are offering free Apple iPhone 12 devices to new and existing customers to attract subscribers during the 5G upgrade cycle. These promotions require qualifying trade-ins and unlimited plans. The carriers are gambling that by covering the phone cost, subscribers will sign up for higher-priced unlimited data plans, despite potential economic headwinds and initial limited 5G network speeds.

title: Augmented Reality (AR) Market Will Showcase Positive
summary: Technavio predicts that the Augmented Reality (AR) market is poised to grow by USD 76.99 billion during 2020-2024, driven significantly by the adoption of AR-enabled smart glasses. The market is concentrated with major players like Alphabet Inc. and Facebook Inc., and is expected to decelerate in concentration over the forecast period. The report highlights the increasing popularity of AR in smartphones and tablets as a key growth driver, offering detailed market analysis and segmentation.

title: Total and Google Cloud develop Solar Mapper, a tool for estimating the solar energy potential of houses’ roofs
summary: Total and Google Cloud have collaborated to develop "Solar Mapper," an AI-powered tool designed to accurately estimate the solar energy potential of residential roofs. This innovation aims to accelerate the deployment of solar panels for individuals, initially in Europe and globally thereafter. The tool leverages artificial intelligence to provide sharper estimations and broader geographical coverage, contributing to Total's goal of becoming a leader in renewable energies.

title: Bandwidth to Acquire Voxbone, Propel Global Expansion
summary: Bandwidth announced its plan to acquire Voxbone for approximately $527 million, with the aim of expanding its global reach and creating a single cloud communications platform spanning over 60 countries. This acquisition is expected to accelerate Bandwidth's international expansion, leveraging Voxbone's strong presence in Europe and Asia, and enable extensive cross-selling opportunities and a simplified "one-stop shop" for cloud communication services. The deal reflects the increasing momentum in cloud communications, expedited by the pandemic, making time more valuable than money for market expansion.

title: Ford to keep office workers at home through at least next June
summary: Ford Motor Co. has announced that its North American white-collar workers will continue to work from home through at least June of next year, extending a policy put in place at the start of the coronavirus pandemic. This decision mirrors similar extended remote work plans by other major companies like General Motors, Rocket Companies, Google, Facebook, and Amazon, as COVID-19 cases continue to rise across the U.S. By the time these policies expire, many employees will have been working remotely for approximately 15 months.

title: Private equity giant Blackstone set to open tech office in Miami
summary: Private equity firm Blackstone plans to open a technology-focused headquarters in Miami, creating up to 215 tech jobs with an average salary of $200,000. Miami-Dade County will provide up to $650,000 in job incentives, anticipating $910,303 in new tax revenue. This move signifies Miami's growing appeal as a tech hub, attracting other companies like Google, Microsoft, and Softbank.

title: Damco Solutions added monday.com to its partnership pool to prioritize workplace transformation
summary: Damco Solutions Inc. has announced a partnership with monday.com, a SaaS-based collaboration and productivity platform, to help businesses create future-ready digital workplaces. This strategic alliance aims to simplify project management and supercharge workforces with custom workflows, easy collaboration, automation, real-time reporting, and integrations. The partnership leverages Damco's IT services expertise and monday.com's platform to drive transformational experiences for global teams, especially expanding monday.com's presence in North America.

title: D-Wave Systems unveils new hardware, business model in race to commercialize quantum computing
summary: D-Wave Systems Inc. has unveiled a re-engineered quantum computer chip and a retooled business model, shifting from selling hardware to offering online access to its capabilities. The company is now focusing on practical applications for customers' immediate needs, promoting a hybrid computing model. This move aims to address past criticisms and demonstrate value beyond achieving "quantum supremacy," with applications being explored by companies like Save-On-Food, Menten AI, and Volkswagen.

title: Mediaweek Roundup: Simon Reeve, Netflix, Dean Jones, ABC + more
summary: This Mediaweek Roundup covers several key media industry stories, including a coalition of smaller app companies forming to challenge Apple and Google's app store policies, former Seven Network presenter Simon Reeve suing the network for over $500,000, and a call for Netflix to contribute more to Australian content production. It also touches on celebrity manager Sam Mangan's "virtual" LA office, Peter V'landys suing ABC, and the passing of cricket legend Dean Jones.

title: Amazon’s Drone Delivery Fleet Hits Milestone With FAA Clearance
summary: Amazon Prime Air has received certification from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to operate as a drone airline, allowing it to begin commercial deliveries under a trial program in the U.S. This makes Amazon one of only a few companies, alongside Wing and UPS, to achieve this crucial step towards widespread drone delivery. While this is a significant milestone, routine deliveries are still years away as regulatory and technical hurdles, such as autonomous flight standards and low-altitude air traffic systems, still need to be addressed.

title: To Fight Apple and Google, Smaller App Rivals Organize a Coalition (Published 2020)
summary: Smaller app developers like Spotify, Match Group, and Epic Games have formed the "Coalition for App Fairness" to challenge the dominance and app store practices of Apple and Google. This move comes as scrutiny intensifies on major tech companies for alleged antitrust violations. The coalition aims to advocate for changes in app store policies and "protect the app economy."

title: Spotify, Match Launch Coalition to Protest App Store Rules
summary: Spotify, Match Group, Epic Games, and 10 other organizations have formed the Coalition for App Fairness to challenge the app store rules of Apple and Google. The coalition introduced "App Store Principles," advocating against platform owners using developer data to compete and requiring exclusive use of their app stores or payment systems. This move aims to pressure Apple and Google into modifying their existing app store guidelines.

title: ClassEDU Launches to Bring "Class for Zoom" Product to Market to Help Millions of Teachers and Students Learning Online Due To COVID
summary: ClassEDU Inc. announced its launch and secured $16 million in seed financing to bring its "Class for Zoom" product to market. This platform aims to enhance online learning by adding features like attendance tracking, assignment distribution, and quizzes to Zoom, making virtual classrooms feel more like in-person ones. The funding round saw participation from key Zoom investors and prominent education leaders, recognizing the critical need for improved remote learning solutions hastened by the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Oracle is a distant laggard in cloud infrastructure market even after TikTok deal
summary: Despite recent high-profile customer wins like TikTok and Zoom, Oracle remains a "niche player" in the cloud infrastructure market, significantly trailing leaders Amazon, Microsoft, and Google. Gartner estimates Oracle's market share at around 2%, and analysts note that its growth is still heavily reliant on traditional database software, with its stock performance lagging behind major cloud competitors. The TikTok deal, while a "shot in the arm," is viewed by some analysts as politically motivated rather than a testament to Oracle's competitive cloud capabilities.

title: Peacock Now Available on the Roku Platform
summary: Peacock announced its app is now available nationwide on the Roku® platform, reaching an estimated 100 million people. This partnership expands Peacock's reach and provides Roku users with access to over 20,000 hours of on-demand movies, shows, live news, and sports programming, including a free tier offering 13,000 hours of premium content. Both companies expressed excitement about delivering high-quality content to engaged streamers.

title: Wall Street-Backed Exchange Launches as Rival to NYSE, Nasdaq - WSJ
summary: Members Exchange (MEMX), a new low-cost competitor backed by Wall Street firms and BlackRock Inc., launched Monday to rival NYSE and Nasdaq. The exchange aims to attract trading activity with an aggressive pricing strategy, starting with trades in seven stocks and planning to expand to all U.S. exchange-listed securities by Sept. 29. This launch follows years of frustration among banks and trading firms with existing exchanges' fees.

title: TikTok Ban Averted: Trump Gives Oracle-Walmart Deal His 'Blessing'
summary: President Trump has tentatively approved a deal involving Oracle and Walmart to keep TikTok operational in the U.S., averting a ban set for midnight, Sunday. The agreement aims to address national security concerns regarding American user data, even though Chinese company ByteDance is expected to retain a majority ownership stake. This deal is expected to boost Oracle's cloud computing business and allow Walmart to integrate e-commerce into the app.

title: Trump Blesses Oracle’s TikTok Deal, Delaying Potential U.S. Ban
authors: Jennifer Jacobs and Shelly Banjo / Bloomberg
summary: President Trump approved Oracle Corp.'s bid for TikTok's American operations, delaying a potential U.S. ban on the video-sharing app. The deal involves the creation of TikTok Global, with Oracle taking a 12.5% stake and Walmart Inc. taking 7.5%, and includes a $5 billion contribution to a U.S. education fund as well as the creation of 25,000 jobs. This agreement aims to address U.S. national security concerns while allowing TikTok to continue operating in the country.

title: Goldman Sachs: Labor Day Weekend Total Beer Sales +7%; Hard Seltzer Sales +137%
summary: A Goldman Sachs report indicates that total beer sales increased 7% over Labor Day weekend 2020 compared to the previous year, with distributors anticipating a strong finish to the year for off-premise beer sales. Hard seltzer sales surged an impressive 137% over the same period, despite widespread out-of-stock issues for both categories. The report highlights that Boston Beer's Truly Hard Seltzer and Mark Anthony Brands' White Claw continued to dominate the hard seltzer market, with breweries actively increasing capacity to meet demand.

title: Oracle (ORCL) Trading Lower After TikTok Download Ban
summary: Oracle (ORCL) stock is trading lower after the U.S. Commerce Department banned TikTok and WeChat downloads, effective Sunday. The announcement creates uncertainty around Oracle's potential deal for TikTok's U.S. operations, with the stock needing to hold the $57 to $57.50 price zone to maintain a bullish technical outlook. Long-term patterns suggest only modest upside even if a deal is finalized, and a failed deal could trigger a bearish double top pattern.

title: What to Expect with the Release of Apple iOS14
summary: Apple's iOS14 update introduces significant privacy changes, requiring consumer opt-in for sharing personal data with third-party apps for ad targeting, primarily affecting the use of the IDFA. This shift presents challenges for app advertisers and platforms like Outbrain, which are adapting by participating in Apple’s SKAdNetwork framework, working with Mobile Measurement Partners, and leveraging their extensive network on the open web. The changes are expected to have a massive impact on in-app advertising, particularly for social platforms like Facebook, making it crucial for advertisers to diversify their media mix.

title: -ByteDance picks Oracle as partner to try to save TikTok U.S.
summary: ByteDance has chosen Oracle as its technology partner to keep TikTok operating in the United States, sidestepping an outright sale but structuring the deal as a partnership. This decision comes after intense pressure from the U.S. government, with Oracle expected to manage TikTok's U.S. user data and potentially acquire a stake in its U.S. operations. The proposal will undergo review by the U.S. Treasury Department and CFIUS to address national security concerns.

title: Digital Billboards: A Game Changer for Auto Advertisers in the Out-of-Home Market
summary: This article discusses the increasing importance of digital billboards (DOOH) for auto advertisers in the Out-of-Home (OOH) market. It highlights the growing revenue generated by DOOH, its effectiveness in driving consumer action, and the innovative ways auto companies like Porsche and Kia are utilizing this advertising medium. The article also touches on the challenges of quantifying OOH impact and the advantages DOOH offers over traditional advertising methods, including affordability and flexibility.

title: Russian Intelligence Hackers Are Back, Microsoft Warns, Aiming at Officials of Both Parties (Published 2020)
authors: David E. Sanger and Nicole Perlroth
summary: Microsoft has warned that Russian military intelligence hackers, previously responsible for the Democratic National Committee attack, are targeting campaign staff, consultants, and think tanks associated with both Democrats and Republicans with new, stealthier methods. This assessment follows a whistle-blower claim about suppressed intelligence regarding Russian interference. While Microsoft also found Chinese and Iranian hacker activity, the Chinese attacks were primarily focused on Biden campaign staff members' private email accounts and other prominent individuals, potentially complicating previous government assessments.

title: The ABCs of AI
summary: This article provides a primer on artificial intelligence (AI) and its applications, particularly within the printing industry. It explains what AI is, its historical context, and how it can help print businesses optimize operations, cut costs, and streamline workflows, especially in the context of increasing automation and customization demands accelerated by COVID-19. Kodak's PRINERGY Software and On Demand Platform are highlighted as examples of AI-powered solutions in print.

title: Helium Is Soaring on Red-Hot Demand, Shrinking Supply
summary: This article discusses the increasing demand and shrinking supply of helium, highlighting its critical role in various high-tech applications beyond balloons. It points out that new large helium deposits are becoming rare and existing reserves, like the U.S. National Helium Reserve, are projected to be depleted soon. The piece also suggests investment opportunities in helium exploration companies like Desert Mountain Energy, comparing the commodity's rarity to gold.

title: Montana GOP lawmakers made fortunes at tech giant Oracle — and became its best friends in D.C.
summary: Montana Republicans Senator Steve Daines and Representative Greg Gianforte accrued significant wealth through their past association with tech giant Oracle, leveraging their positions to promote legislation and initiatives that benefited the company. Their financial ties stemmed from Gianforte's sale of RightNow Technologies to Oracle and shared real estate ventures, while both lawmakers supported Oracle's lobbying efforts on cybersecurity, AI, and other policy issues, often opposing Oracle's competitors like Google. This close relationship has also seen Oracle contribute to their political campaigns, highlighting a pattern of mutual financial and legislative support.

title: Axis Global Equity Alpha Fund of Fund Review: Should You Invest?
summary: This article reviews the Axis Global Equity Alpha Fund of Fund, which invests in Schroder International Selection Fund Global Equity Alpha. The author discusses the underlying fund's performance against its benchmark, highlighting a poor track record and high expense ratios, especially for the regular plan. The article concludes by recommending investors consider alternatives with lower expenses, such as the Motilal Oswal S&P 500 Index Fund, for international diversification.

title: Oatly is defending itself after selling stake to Trump donor Schwarzman's Blackstone Group
summary: Oatly, the vegan milk brand, is facing backlash and potential boycotts from its customers and the coffee industry after selling a 10% stake to a group of investors led by Blackstone Growth. The controversy stems from Blackstone CEO Stephen Schwarzman's significant donations to Donald Trump's reelection campaign, and past accusations against Blackstone-owned Hidrovias regarding Amazon deforestation. Oatly is defending its decision, stating the partnership helps expand its sustainable mission and influences leading private equity to invest in sustainability.

title: Apple delays iPhone change that's expected to make it harder for Facebook and other apps to target ads
summary: Apple announced a delay until early 2021 for a planned change to the iPhone operating system that would impact how mobile advertisers track users. This privacy-focused update, previously set for iOS 14, gives developers more time to adapt to new rules requiring user permission to track their activity. The change is expected to significantly affect mobile advertising, with Facebook warning of potential revenue drops for publishers.

title: AT&T explores sale of its digital advertising business Xandr
summary: AT&T Inc. is reportedly exploring the sale of its Xandr digital advertising unit as it focuses on entertainment and debt reduction. This potential sale signals a shift away from challenging Alphabet Inc. in online ads, with the unit not generating robust revenue growth after being acquired as AppNexus for approximately $1.6 billion in 2018.

title: What Enabled Adobe to Raise Its Digital Media ARR?
summary: Adobe's Digital Media ARR increased due to the continued migration of its Creative Suite and the addition of new Creative Cloud subscriptions. The company saw significant growth in its Digital Media segment, with Creative Cloud revenues rising 44% year-over-year, leading Adobe to raise its fiscal 2016 Digital Media ARR guidance to $4.0 billion. Fiscal 1Q16 was the last quarter Adobe provided specific Creative Cloud subscriber figures.

title: Amazon’s Drone Delivery Fleet Hits Milestone With FAA Clearance
summary: Amazon Prime Air has received certification from the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to operate as an "air carrier," allowing it to begin commercial drone deliveries under a trial program. This certification signifies the FAA's confidence in Amazon’s drone operating and safety procedures, placing it alongside Wing (Alphabet Inc. subsidiary) and UPS as companies approved for such operations. While this is a significant step, routine drone deliveries are still years away due to the need for further regulatory frameworks regarding autonomous flights, design standards, and a new air-traffic system for low-altitude drones.

title: Apple and Tesla shares spike after stock splits kick in
summary: Apple and Tesla shares surged on Monday after their stock splits took effect, attracting significant investor buying. Apple jumped over 4 percent after its 4-for-1 split, while Tesla rallied 10 percent following its 5-for-1 split, elevating its market capitalization to over $440 billion and showcasing the impact of increased affordability for individual investors. The success of these splits may encourage other companies with high-priced stocks to consider similar moves, as both Silicon Valley companies have strong individual investor followings.

title: Coronavirus Recovery: A Tale of Two Markets
summary: This article examines the differing impacts of market concentration on the recovery of the U.S. and Canadian markets from the coronavirus pandemic. It highlights how the concentration of FAANG-type stocks boosted the U.S. market's recovery, while Canada's concentration in underperforming companies and the energy sector hindered its rebound. The author emphasizes the importance of portfolio diversification to mitigate risks associated with market concentration.

title: How to Invest In Telehealth and Digital Medicine
summary: The article discusses investment opportunities in telehealth and digital medicine, highlighting the accelerated adoption due to the COVID-19 pandemic. It differentiates between telehealth and telemedicine, and provides examples of public companies and ETFs for investors looking to capitalize on this growing sector. The piece emphasizes the long-term growth potential in virtual healthcare, driven by demographic trends and technological advancements.

title: Google, T-Mobile, Silicon Labs among partners with ioXt Alliance to secure IoT devices
summary: The ioXt Alliance, a global standard for IoT security, announced that major technology companies like Google, T-Mobile, and Silicon Labs have certified a wide range of their devices through the ioXt Alliance Certification Program. This initiative aims to address increasing consumer and retailer demand for secure IoT products by providing a comprehensive and scalable security compliance program. The certified devices span various categories, from cell phones and smart home devices to automotive technology, ensuring transparency and assurance in IoT security.

title: To get skin tones right, Pinterest’s AI went way beyond facial recognition
summary: Pinterest has updated its AI to more accurately detect skin tones in a wider array of images, moving beyond facial recognition. This helps users find more relevant beauty and style tips, and supports features like their augmented-reality Try On tool. The new system avoids biases associated with facial recognition and can analyze images beyond just faces, such as close-ups of body parts or accessories.

title: Apple Becomes First U.S. Company Worth More Than $2 Trillion
summary: Apple achieved a new financial milestone, becoming the first publicly traded U.S. company to reach a market capitalization of over $2 trillion. This valuation marks a doubling in just two years, driven by a strong stock performance, especially during the pandemic due to work-from-home trends and robust online sales. The company's market cap now surpasses that of other U.S. tech giants and the GDP of several developed countries, with a four-for-one stock split planned to make shares more accessible.

title: The race to quantum advantage
summary: This article discusses the global race toward quantum advantage, highlighting how quantum computing promises to solve currently intractable problems across various industries. It details the fundamental concepts of quantum computing, including qubits and modalities like superconducting and trapped ion qubits, and outlines the technological stack required. The authors emphasize that while significant progress has been made by companies like IBM, Google, and Honeywell, the journey to scalable, error-free quantum computers capable of widespread application is still a marathon.

title: Two beverage giants choose cloud partners
summary: PepsiCo and Keurig Dr Pepper have each signed long-term cloud technology contracts with Microsoft and Google Cloud, respectively, to modernize their digital networks. PepsiCo's partnership with Microsoft aims to improve service delivery, innovation, and sustainability, while Keurig Dr Pepper's agreement with Google Cloud supports its digital transformation by migrating major applications and retiring data centers. Both companies are leveraging cloud solutions for greater agility, data insights, and operational resilience.

title: Antitrust hawks, restaurants want to rein in food delivery apps
summary: An online campaign led by the American Economic Liberties Project is launching to limit the market power of food delivery apps like Grubhub and Uber Eats. The campaign aims to lobby local and state governments to cap fees charged by these apps, which restaurants contend are predatory, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. Additionally, the campaign seeks Federal Trade Commission investigation into the companies for alleged anti-competitive practices.

title: Android Users Say Google Collects Data for Product Development
summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Google LLC and Alphabet Inc., alleging that Google employees monitor and collect Android user data without consent for product development, specifically a potential TikTok competitor. The plaintiff, Robert McCoy, claims Google uses "Android Lockbox" technology to monitor interactions with non-Google apps and mischaracterizes the purpose of data collection, violating consumer privacy laws and breaching contracts. The lawsuit argues that Google obtains consent through vague language during device setup, not fully disclosing its extensive data collection practices for competitive advantage.

title: Google investment in ADT raises profile, competitive edge — plus data worries
summary: Google's $450 million investment in ADT Inc. will boost ADT's profile and allow it to sell and install Google's smart home devices, enhancing its competitive edge and customer experience. The partnership is expected to benefit ADT through Google's AI and data analytics expertise, although it also raises concerns about data privacy and market consolidation among tech giants.

title: Google to buy stake in ADT in home security push for $450 million
summary: Alphabet Inc.'s Google is acquiring a 6.6% stake in ADT Inc. for $450 million to boost its home security presence and drive sales of its Nest devices. This investment gives ADT a high-profile technology partner and access to new resources, while Google gains access to ADT's 6.5 million customers. The companies plan to integrate Google products with ADT's services and co-invest an additional $150 million each in co-marketing, product development, technology, and employee training.

title: Google parent Alphabet issued the largest corporate ESG bond
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., issued the largest corporate ESG bond to date, totaling USD $5.75 billion, to fund environmental and social initiatives. This bond was part of a larger USD $10 billion debt offering and achieved record-low yields. The issuance highlights a growing trend among companies to utilize ESG themes for bond differentiation and demonstrates that sustainable business practices are being rewarded by capital markets.
source: The World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD)
source_domain: The World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD)

title: Tim Cook Says These 3 Words Guide Every Decision at Apple
summary: Tim Cook stated that "privacy, security, and quality" guide every decision at Apple, especially in its app review process. The article argues that these three words differentiate Apple from its competitors, particularly concerning data privacy and product experience. It emphasizes that these principles provide clarity for Apple's decisions and are foundational to its operations, serving as a lesson for other leaders.

title: Apple Announces 4-1 Stock Split After Shares Surge Toward $400
summary: Apple Inc. announced a 4-for-1 stock split following a significant surge in its share price over the past year. The company stated this move aims to make the stock more accessible to a broader base of investors, with post-split trading beginning on August 31. This marks Apple's fifth stock split since going public in 1980, contrasting with other large tech companies that typically avoid such actions.

title: Here’s what the CEOs of Apple, Amazon, Facebook and Alphabet will say at Wednesday’s antitrust hearing
summary: The CEOs of Apple, Amazon, Facebook, and Alphabet are scheduled to testify before a House antitrust panel on Wednesday. Their prepared statements indicate they will argue that competition exists and their companies strengthen America. The executives, including Jeff Bezos, Tim Cook, Mark Zuckerberg, and Sundar Pichai, will appear via videoconference.

title: Google Cloud Implements Multi-Year Digital Transformation Initiative with Keurig Dr Pepper
summary: Google Cloud announced a multi-year agreement with Keurig Dr Pepper to host the beverage giant's data footprint, migrating over 1,000 physical servers from two data centers to virtual machines on Google Cloud. This digital transformation aims to enhance operational efficiencies and IT infrastructure scalability, leveraging Google Cloud's innovation and security. Keurig Dr Pepper utilized Google Cloud's Live Migration service for a seamless transition, highlighting the critical role of data in business transformation.

title: Next-generation search engines want to bring back our privacy
summary: CodeFuel's new private search engine, Privado, in partnership with Microsoft, aims to offer users true anonymity by encrypting keywords and hiding identities. This initiative comes as consumers, particularly younger generations, increasingly demand greater privacy from tech giants. Privado seeks to provide targeted advertising based only on current searches, without building user profiles, and plans to explore voice and image search in the future.

title: Banking on AI: RBC Builds a DGX-Powered Private Cloud
summary: Royal Bank of Canada (RBC) has built an NVIDIA DGX-powered private cloud to enhance its AI capabilities and transform client experiences, leveraging a strategic investment in AI through its research institute, Borealis AI. This new infrastructure allows RBC to run thousands of simulations and analyze millions of data points rapidly, enabling the development of smart applications and significant savings in total cost of ownership. The initiative showcases RBC's commitment to innovation and its early adoption of emerging technologies to maintain its competitive edge in the financial services industry.

title: Boyd Gaming unveils mobile gaming app with nostalgic brand
summary: Boyd Gaming Corp. has launched a new mobile gaming app called Stardust Social Casino, leveraging its vintage Las Vegas Stardust brand to stand out in the competitive mobile gaming market. The app offers virtual versions of slot titles found on Boyd Gaming casino floors, primarily for entertainment, and allows members of its B Connected loyalty program to earn points for in-app purchases. This move aims to connect with existing customers and attract new players familiar with the historic Stardust brand.

title: Uber pledges to double company’s Black leadership by 2025
summary: Uber Technologies Inc. has pledged to double its Black leadership by 2025, joining other tech giants in setting measurable goals for racial and economic justice. The company will also implement anti-bias training, tie executive compensation to diversity metrics, and support Black-owned businesses. This initiative follows the company's 2019 diversity report, which showed Black leaders made up only 3.3% of those with a director title or higher, despite Black employees representing 9.3% of the total U.S. workforce.

title: Google to launch 3 more tech certificates on Coursera
summary: Google is launching three new tech certificates on Coursera in data analytics, project management, and user experience design, costing $49 a month and taking three to six months to complete. These certificates aim to help workers affected by the coronavirus pandemic find jobs, with Google funding 100,000 need-based scholarships and considering completion equivalent to a four-year degree for relevant internal roles. This initiative expands on Google's existing IT support certificate program and includes plans for a hiring consortium, apprenticeships, and integration into high schools and community colleges.

title: Google announces $10bn investment in 'digital India'
summary: Google has announced a $10 billion investment in India over the next five to seven years through its Google for India Digitisation Fund. This funding aims to boost India's digital infrastructure, help businesses go digital, and leverage technology for social good, reflecting Google's confidence in the country's growing digital economy. The investment comes shortly after India banned several Chinese apps, creating a potential void for Silicon Valley giants to fill.

title: ‘Reflection of our confidence’: Google to pump $10bn into India
summary: Google announced it will invest $10 billion in India over the next five to seven years through a digitisation fund, focusing on equity investments, partnerships, and infrastructure. This significant commitment highlights Google's confidence in India's digital economy and its rapid growth in apps and software platforms. The investment aims to expand internet access beyond English and other regional languages and includes a focus on artificial intelligence and education.

title: WeRide starts testing driverless autonomous vehicles in Guangzhou
summary: WeRide has commenced testing driverless autonomous vehicles on public roads in Guangzhou, making it the first company in China and the second globally to do so without safety operators inside the cars. This move brings WeRide closer to its goal of providing fully driverless robotaxi services to the general public in Guangzhou by 2021. The company, founded in 2017, already launched robotaxi services in November 2019 and has integrated its services with Alibaba's mapping provider AutoNavi.

title: Rackspace Technology Files For IPO Four Years After Going Private
summary: Rackspace Technology, a managed cloud company, has filed for an initial public offering four years after going private. The company, which recently rebranded, aims to re-enter the public stock market, having transformed from a competitor to a partner of public cloud giants. Rackspace reported $2.44 billion in revenue in 2019 with a net loss of $102.3 million.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook No.2 on 2019 highest paid list at $133.7 million
summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook ranked second on the 2019 highest-paid executive list with $133.7 million, largely due to an equity grant he received in 2011. Elon Musk topped the list with $595.3 million, primarily from a pay deal tied to Tesla's valuation. The article highlights the significant compensation packages in the tech industry compared to other sectors like finance.

title: Used Car Market Analysis Highlights the Impact of COVID-19- 2020-2024 | Increase in the Launch of New Models of Cars to Boost Growth | Technavio
summary: Technavio forecasts the global used car market to grow by 34.53 million units during 2020-2024, at a CAGR of almost 6%, driven by the increased launch of new car models. The report provides an in-depth analysis of market trends, drivers, and the impact of COVID-19, including market segmentation by product and geography, and profiles key vendors. It highlights the adoption of Industry 4.0 as a significant growth factor.

title: Special Feature: YouTube’s Evolution in the OTT Streaming Landscape...
summary: This article by Comscore and YouTube examines YouTube's significant growth within the evolving OTT streaming landscape, highlighting its increased reach in ad-supported households and substantial growth in CTV watch time. It also details how YouTube's unique user-generated content and extensive library are providing new opportunities for advertisers to target diverse audiences. The piece further explores emerging content consumption trends on the platform, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Starbucks to pause advertising across social media to help stop hate speech
summary: Starbucks announced it will pause advertising on all social media platforms to help stop the spread of hate speech, following a growing movement to boycott social networks, particularly Facebook. While not explicitly naming Facebook, the move aligns with increasing pressure from civil rights organizations on platforms to adopt stricter policies against hateful content. Starbucks clarified it is not joining the "Stop Hate For Profit" boycott campaign but is undertaking its own review.

title: LATEST TECH NEWS: Verizon joins others to boycott Facebook. 4 other things and a trivia you need to know today, June 26, 2020
summary: This article covers five key tech news stories from June 26, 2020, including Verizon joining the boycott against Facebook due to hate speech concerns, Egyptian edtech OTO Courses securing new investment, Waymo and Volvo partnering on electric robotaxis, the opening of applications for the AppsAfrica Innovation Awards 2020, and Amazon's reported acquisition of self-driving startup Zoox for over $1 billion. It also includes a tech trivia question and answer about the beginning of computer engineering.

title: Blackstone Group: Alphabet CFO Ruth Porat Joins The Board (BX, GOOG, GOOGL)
summary: Alphabet CFO Ruth Porat has been appointed to the board of directors of Blackstone Group Inc. Porat brings extensive experience having previously served as CFO at Morgan Stanley for 27 years and overseeing Blackstone's IPO in 2007. She will be the third woman on Blackstone's board, joining Kelly Ayotte and Rochelle Lazarus.

title: Blackstone adds Google CFO Ruth Porat to its board of directors
summary: Blackstone Group Inc. has appointed Ruth Porat, Google's finance chief, to its board of directors. This move highlights Blackstone's strategic shift towards technology and growth investments. Porat has a distinguished background, having previously spent 27 years with Morgan Stanley and serving as CFO for Google and its parent company, Alphabet Inc., since 2015.

title: Honeywell claims it has built the most powerful quantum computer ever
summary: Honeywell claims to have built the most powerful quantum computer to date, boasting a quantum volume of 64, double that of the next highest IBM quantum computer. While this achievement is significant for Honeywell's internal operations, researchers remain skeptical as the computer's six qubits cannot yet perform calculations beyond the capability of classical computers, unlike Google's 53-qubit machine that achieved quantum supremacy. Despite this, Honeywell views it as an important step towards integrating quantum computing into their industries.

title: Apple, Google and chorus of tech business leaders slam Trump's new visa restrictions
summary: Tech giants Apple and Google, along with other prominent business leaders, criticized the Trump administration's new restrictions on work visas, including the H-1B and L-1 visas. Critics argue that these restrictions, implemented to free up jobs for American workers, will actually hinder job creation and economic growth. CEOs like Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai, Brad Smith, Marc Benioff, and Elon Musk all expressed disappointment, highlighting the positive contributions of immigrant workers to innovation and the U.S. economy.

title: Awash in “AI Platforms”
summary: This article discusses the booming market for "AI Platforms," noting the significant financial investments predicted for digital transformation software by 2025. It criticizes the proliferation of open-source "AI Platforms" which, while offering useful components, individually lack the comprehensive utility required to fully develop and operate enterprise AI and IoT applications. The author argues that many of these components were not designed to work together and highlights their commercial viability issues.

title: Trump signs order freezing visas for foreign workers through the end of the year
summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order freezing new visas for various foreign workers, including tech and low-skill jobs, through the end of 2020. This action, aiming to preserve jobs amidst the COVID-19 economic downturn, exempts specific essential workers but includes au pairs and certain other exchange programs. The policy is expected to face backlash from the business community and immigration advocates despite the White House's claim of saving or creating 525,000 American jobs.

title: CEO of Gannett's operating company, Paul Bascobert, will leave company; Mike Reed assumes responsibilities
summary: Paul Bascobert, CEO of Gannett Co.'s operating company, is departing after his position was eliminated to streamline operations; Michael Reed, chairman and CEO of the overall public entity, will assume his responsibilities. Bascobert's departure is not due to any inappropriate action or business deterioration. The move comes as Gannett navigates significant financial pressures and a challenging media landscape, with plans to cut $300 million in annual costs.

title: Insight Partners to acquire senior Israeli venture fund Gemini V for $500 million
summary: Insight Partners is set to acquire the fifth fund of Israeli venture firm Gemini Israel Ventures for approximately $500 million. Gemini V's portfolio includes successful companies like WalkMe Inc., JFrog Ltd., Monday.com Labs Ltd., and Moovit App Global Ltd., which was recently acquired by Intel for $1 billion. This acquisition is part of a series of investments and deals made by Insight Partners in Israeli tech companies.

title: Morgan Stanley's Gorman 'thrilled' with ETrade purchase
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman expresses immense satisfaction with the acquisition of ETrade, highlighting the online trading firm's technology, digital banking capabilities, and management team. He plans to retain the ETrade brand, possibly as "ETrade powered by Morgan Stanley," recognizing its value to clients. Gorman believes the deal expands Morgan Stanley's online platform, diversifies the company, and strengthens its digital offerings, particularly appealing to a younger demographic.

title: General Electric’s exit from lighting business is a warning to other players in the sector
summary: General Electric has sold its lighting division to Savant for $250 million, marking the end of its nearly 130-year involvement in the lighting industry. This exit is attributed to GE's failure to prioritize LED research and adapt to the commoditization of LED technology and the rise of Chinese manufacturers. The article suggests that other lighting companies must learn from GE's mistakes and invest in innovative LED applications beyond general illumination to avoid a similar fate.

title: How Snowflake is challenging the cloud-native database giants
summary: This article examines how Snowflake Inc. is competing with major cloud providers like Amazon Web Services, Google, and Microsoft in the cloud-native database market. It analyzes customer spending data from Enterprise Technology Research (ETR) to demonstrate Snowflake's strong spending momentum across all three major clouds and discusses its strategy of being cloud-agnostic and prioritizing engineering investments. The piece concludes that Snowflake's specialized focus and native cloud architecture position it well for continued growth and a successful IPO despite competition from giants with vast R&D budgets.

title: Real Networks' AI Facial Recognition Software IDs Familiar Faces in Streaming Movies and Personal Videos
summary: Real Networks has launched two new AI-powered facial recognition products: StarSearch for identifying actors in streaming movies and TV shows on platforms like Netflix and YouTube, and RealPlayer 20/20 for organizing personal video collections by individuals. These tools aim to address the common user query of identifying faces on screen, leveraging Real's Secure Accurate Facial Recognition (SAFR) software, which boasts high accuracy and low bias. The company envisions expanding the technology to more streaming services and enhancing personal video organization.

title: New $5 billion lawsuit accuses Google of tracking users in Incognito Mode
summary: A new $5 billion class-action lawsuit has been filed against Google, alleging that the company continues to track users even when they are browsing in Chrome's Incognito Mode. The complaint argues that unauthorized data collection through services like Google Analytics and Ad Manager violates federal wiretapping and privacy laws. Google has stated it will defend the claims, noting that Incognito tabs warn users that websites might still collect browsing activity.

title: Google faces $5 billion lawsuit in U.S. for tracking 'private' internet use
summary: Google is facing a proposed class-action lawsuit seeking at least $5 billion for allegedly tracking users' internet activity through browsers set in "private" or Incognito mode. The lawsuit claims Google surreptitiously collects data through its various services, even when users believe their browsing is private. Google denies the claims, stating that it clearly informs users that websites might still collect information during Incognito browsing.

title: Expedia Group CEO Peter Kern: 'Google's a problem for everyone who sells something online'
summary: Expedia Group CEO Peter Kern criticized Google for its dual role as a competitor and a major source of customer traffic, stating it's an issue for all online sellers. Kern indicated a shift in strategy for Expedia to reduce its reliance on Google and performance marketing by improving internal merchandising and customer understanding. These comments follow Expedia's quarterly earnings report where marketing expenses dropped significantly, and the company reported a major reduction in business due to COVID-19.

title: NextEra Energy: Agrees to supply 114MW to Google Energy
summary: NextEra Energy Resources, a subsidiary of NextEra Energy Inc, has signed a power purchase agreement with Google Energy, LLC, to supply 114 megawatts of renewable energy from its Story II Wind Energy Center. This agreement highlights Google Energy's commitment to emission-free energy and expands NextEra Energy Resources' significant wind power portfolio in North America. The Story II Wind Energy Center, which began operations in December 2009, will start supplying Google Energy with power on July 30, 2010.

title: KeyBank to incorporate Kubernetes into digital transformation strategy
summary: KeyBank announced its plan to integrate Kubernetes technology into its data center operations to further its digital transformation efforts. This move, leveraging Google Cloud's Cloud Services Platform, aims to launch new features more quickly, efficiently, and securely for its customers. KeyBank anticipates that this will enhance velocity, reliability, and governance at scale for its banking services.

title: Lawsuit Alleging Anti-Conservative Bias at Google Ends Quietly
summary: A high-profile lawsuit alleging anti-conservative bias at Google, initiated by former engineer James Damore, has come to a quiet end. Damore and co-plaintiffs, along with Google, requested dismissal of the suit, with terms of the agreement prohibiting further public comment. Despite the quiet end, Damore's lawyer asserts the lawsuit prompted Silicon Valley companies, including Google, to institute workplace rules protecting alternative viewpoints and resulted in policy changes regarding employee discussions of working conditions.

title: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt Cut Last Ties With The Company: Report
summary: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt officially severed all ties with Alphabet Inc. in February 2020, ending his 19-year tenure with the company. Schmidt, who had served in various executive roles since 2001, stepped down as a technology advisor, a move that coincided with his increased involvement in government roles. His departure also came amid criticism over his dual role as an advisor to the Pentagon while Alphabet competed for the JEDI contract.

title: WOW! Launches WOW! tv+ in Cleveland and Mid-Michigan
summary: WOW! Internet, Cable & Phone launched its new IP-based video service, WOW! tv+, in Cleveland and Mid-Michigan. This Android TV-based platform offers live channel packages, cloud DVR, and access to an On Demand library, aiming to provide an enhanced viewing experience. The move signals WOW!'s shift to an IP-delivered video offering, leveraging its broadband network and supporting a more flexible content consumption model for customers.

title: Electronic Arts and Google Announce Partnership to Bring EA Games to Stadia
summary: Electronic Arts (EA) and Google have announced a partnership to bring five EA games to Google's cloud-based gaming platform, Stadia. Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order is expected to launch on Stadia by the end of 2020, with EA SPORTS FIFA and Madden NFL following in winter, and more games planned for 2021. This collaboration aims to provide new and innovative gaming experiences on the Stadia platform.

title: NEC and Intermedia Announce Strategic Global Partnership: Press Releases
summary: NEC Corporation and Intermedia have formed a strategic global partnership to provide cloud-based Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) and Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS) solutions. This collaboration introduces NEC UNIVERGE BLUE CONNECT and ENGAGE, designed to help businesses of all sizes migrate to the cloud and enhance their communication and collaboration capabilities. The partnership leverages Intermedia's technology and NEC's global reach, aiming to meet the demands of a digital workforce and support remote operations.

title: Barry Diller: Expedia normally spends $5 billion on ads but probably 'won't spend $1 billion' this year
summary: Expedia Group chairman Barry Diller announced that the company, which typically allocates $5 billion to advertising, will drastically cut ad spending to less than $1 billion this year due to the coronavirus pandemic. This decision reflects a broader trend of advertisers pausing or canceling campaigns amidst budget uncertainty, particularly in the travel industry. Shares in Expedia Group, whose brands include Hotels.com and Orbitz, were down 1% following the announcement.

title: Apple and Google partner on COVID-19 contact tracing technology
summary: Apple and Google are collaborating on a joint effort to enable the use of Bluetooth technology for COVID-19 contact tracing, prioritizing user privacy and security. The solution will be rolled out in two phases, starting with APIs in May and then integrating functionality directly into underlying operating systems. This initiative aims to help governments and health authorities reduce the spread of the virus.

title: Google Classroom sees a doubling user-base as more students work from home
summary: Google Classroom has seen its user base double to over 100 million due to the increase in online education during the pandemic, with significant growth in previously underserved regions like Italy and Indonesia. This surge is also boosting usage of other Google services like Meet and the broader G Suite for Education, which now has 120 million users. Despite the positive growth, Google continues to face privacy concerns and lawsuits regarding user data.

title: BlackBerry uncovers hacker tools that it says opened data servers for a decade
summary: BlackBerry has released a report detailing how five separate groups linked to the Chinese government have been targeting Linux systems for a decade. These hackers have used novel techniques, including disguising malicious tools as advertising software, to exfiltrate vast amounts of data from servers. The report highlights a significant blind spot in cybersecurity, as Linux powers critical global infrastructure like stock exchanges and major cloud services.

title: Microsoft Edge is becoming the browser you didn’t know you needed
summary: Microsoft Edge is introducing several compelling new features like Collections, Immersive Reader, and vertical tabs, aiming to elevate its status beyond just a functional default browser. While some features are still in preview, they offer significant enhancements for organization, readability, and user interface. Additionally, Edge gains exclusive 4K Netflix streaming support on Windows 10 and improved privacy tools.

title: Digital Asset Marketplace Apifiny Hires Execs from Google, Kraken & More, Plans Global Trading Service
summary: Digital asset marketplace Apifiny announced the launch of GlobalX, an API platform designed to enable institutional trading across multiple regulated exchanges with crypto-to-crypto and crypto-to-fiat pairs. The launch is spearheaded by three new executives with backgrounds from Google, Kraken, and AlphaPoint, aiming to simplify global trading for professional traders through a single account and onboarding process. GlobalX aims to break down barriers in digital asset trading by offering global execution from one account for unprecedented trading opportunities.

title: Social Media Moves to New Era of Growth
summary: Social media platforms are entering a new era of growth, shifting focus from user acquisition to maximizing revenue per user through targeted advertising and innovative technologies. New avenues like social commerce and AR/VR are being explored to diversify revenue streams. This evolution includes in-app purchases, live-streaming commerce, and augmented reality experiences to further engage users and drive monetization.

title: The Chief Information And Digital Officer Of AES Drives The Smart Grid And The Connected Enterprise
summary: Sanjeev Addala, Chief Information and Digital Officer of AES, discusses the company's digital transformation journey, focusing on customer-centricity, new business models, and revenue streams. He details the digital strategy across three business dimensions and five strategic themes, including connected enterprise, smart grid, and scaling a digital ecosystem. Addala also shares his perspective on the evolving CDO role and the importance of digital in driving growth and innovation for industrial companies.

title: Expedia Group, Booking Holdings spent more than $11B on marketing (mostly to Google) in 2019
summary: Expedia Group and Booking Holdings collectively spent over $11 billion on marketing in 2019, with a significant portion going to Google. Expedia Group increased its marketing spend by 6% to $6.03 billion, while Booking Holdings maintained a nearly flat spend at $4.97 billion. The article highlights how Google's growing presence in online travel forces OTAs to increase advertising to maintain visibility.

title: McDonald's cancels in-person convention for worldwide franchisees due to coronavirus
summary: McDonald's has canceled its in-person biennial worldwide convention for franchisees, originally scheduled for Orlando, Florida, due to the coronavirus outbreak. The event will now be held virtually. This decision follows similar actions by other major companies like Starbucks, Target, and Google, as the number of U.S. COVID-19 cases continues to rise, impacting the travel industry.

title: HPE Confirms Discover Conference Still On, Cancels ‘Most’ Events Through April
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has decided to proceed with its annual Discover Las Vegas and Discover More London conferences, despite canceling or postponing most other events through April due to coronavirus concerns. Partners have expressed support for HPE's decision, emphasizing the need to continue business while taking prudent precautions. The company plans to shift resources to digital engagement for customers and partners.

title: Waymo gets US$2.25 billion from investors to power self-driving expansion
summary: Self-driving car company Waymo has raised US$2.25 billion in its first external funding round to fuel its global expansion. The capital came from a diverse group of investors including Silver Lake, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, and Mubadala Investment, alongside its parent company Alphabet Inc. This funding will support the deployment of the Waymo Driver worldwide, as the company competes in the rapidly evolving autonomous driving market.

title: Waymo launches delivery service after raising $2.25 billion
summary: Waymo is expanding its services by formally launching Waymo Via, a delivery service utilizing its autonomous vehicles and Class 8 trucks, after successfully raising $2.25 billion from a group of outside investors. This move is a natural extension of its autonomous drive technology, with initial routes opening along the I-10 corridor connecting Arizona, New Mexico, and Texas. The company, an Alphabet unit, also plans future growth in California and other markets for its self-driving car technology.

title: !Alphabet's Waymo scores $2.25B in first outside funding
summary: !Alphabet's self-driving car unit, Waymo, secured its first external funding round, raising $2.25 billion. This investment marks a significant milestone for the Mountain View-based company, which originated from Google's autonomous vehicle project in 2009. The funding will likely accelerate the development and deployment of Waymo's autonomous vehicle technology.

title: Google has removed almost all Cheetah Mobile apps from the Play Store
summary: Google has reportedly removed almost all Cheetah Mobile apps from the Play Store due to the developer's history of ad fraud, disruptive apps, and data collection issues. While Google has not officially confirmed a ban, the timing coincides with their announcement of removing 600 apps for similar violations. Cheetah Mobile is now offering its apps as APK downloads directly from its website, bypassing the Play Store.

title: LatAm telecoms group with Luxembourg HQ posts profit
summary: Millicom International Cellular SA, a Luxembourg-headquartered telecom company, reported a profit of $149 million in the last year, reversing a previous loss, primarily driven by acquisitions in Latin America. The company significantly expanded its presence in Central and South America while largely divesting from its African markets. Despite political and competitive challenges in some regions, Millicom benefits from geographic diversification and its strong market position in the countries where it operates.

title: J&J’s Ethicon mostly fends off Intuitive Surgical’s robotic surgery patent challenge
summary: Johnson & Johnson's Ethicon subsidiary successfully defended most of its robotic surgery tool patent against a challenge from Intuitive Surgical. The Patent Trial and Appeal Board found that Intuitive failed to prove the patent was obvious, upholding 25 of 28 claims. This decision highlights the ongoing intellectual property disputes in the competitive robotic surgery market, where J&J and others are challenging Intuitive Surgical's dominance.

title: Beyond ESG: How Individuals Can Influence Corporations
summary: This article discusses how individuals can influence corporations beyond traditional ESG investing by leveraging their consumer choices, employment decisions, and advocacy. It highlights the rise of stakeholder capitalism and provides examples of how customers, employees, suppliers, communities, and shareholders have successfully pressured companies to adopt more responsible practices, leading to positive corporate behavior and potentially superior stock returns.

title: Google Has Banned Almost 600 Apps For Pushing “Disruptive” Ads
summary: Google has banned nearly 600 Android apps and their developers from the Play Store and its ad networks due to "disruptive" mobile ads and ad fraud. This crackdown, supported by new detection technology, targets apps that display ads when not in use or lead to inadvertent clicks, with many of the banned apps originating from developers in China, Hong Kong, Singapore, and India. Google is also refunding affected advertisers.

title: Expedia stock rises 10% as travel giant cites focus on core operations following executive shuffle
summary: Expedia's stock rose over 10% after reporting fourth-quarter earnings that beat profit expectations, driven by a renewed focus on core operations and efficiency improvements. This comes after an executive shuffle in December, with Chairman Barry Diller and Vice Chairman Peter Kern now projecting double-digit Adjusted EBITDA growth for 2020 despite Coronavirus uncertainties, and targeting $300-500 million in cost savings. The company also reported increased revenue and gross bookings, and aims for improved revenue growth and margin expansion in the coming years.

title: Wells Fargo ends forced arbitration for sexual harassment complaints
summary: Wells Fargo & Co. announced it will no longer require arbitration for employee sexual harassment complaints, making it the first major U.S. bank to do so. This change follows discussions with stakeholders including Clean Yield Asset Management, which had submitted a shareholder proposal focused on the practice. The decision is seen as a significant step in addressing misconduct in the #MeToo era, as forced arbitration has often been criticized for obscuring complaints and protecting repeat offenders.

title: Uber is ready to join the FANG camp, analyst says after earnings
summary: Following its latest earnings report, an analyst suggested that Uber Technologies Inc. is ready to join the ranks of major internet companies like Facebook, Amazon, Netflix, and Google. RBC Capital Markets analyst Mark Mahaney proposed the acronym FANGU, adding Uber, as the company works towards profitability and leverages its scale. This optimism led to an 8% increase in Uber's stock price on Friday morning.

title: Beam Therapeutics shines in $180m IPO
summary: Beam Therapeutics, a genomic medicine developer backed by Alphabet, Editas, and Bio Palette, successfully completed an upsized $180 million IPO, pricing shares at $17.00. The company increased its share offering to nearly 10.6 million and plans to use the proceeds to fund R&D, clinical trials, and drug discovery. Previously, Beam Therapeutics secured significant funding rounds from investors including GV, Eight Roads Ventures, F-Prime Capital, Hillhouse Capital, Temasek, and Arch Venture Partners, which was its largest pre-IPO shareholder.

title: Starbucks improves customer experience with AI
summary: Starbucks is enhancing its customer experience through the deployment of AI-equipped hardware and analytics. The company plans to install 4,000 AI-enabled Mastrena II espresso makers in 2020 and is leveraging its Deep Brew AI engine to understand customer preferences better and increase efficiency. These efforts, combined with significant growth in its loyalty program and digital customer base, are contributing to improved service, brand loyalty, and new offerings.

title: In Pictures: Indian-origin CEOs of top tech companies
summary: This article showcases prominent Indian-origin CEOs leading top technology companies globally. It highlights individuals like Arvind Krishna (IBM), Sundar Pichai (Google, Alphabet), Satya Nadella (Microsoft), Shantanu Narayen (Adobe), Jayshree Ullal (Arista Networks), Sanjay Mehrotra (Micron), George Kurian (NetApp), and Sandeep Mathrani (WeWork), detailing their backgrounds and roles within their respective companies as of early 2020. The article emphasizes the growing presence and influence of Indian-origin leaders in the tech industry.

title: Swiping their way higher: Visa, Mastercard could be the next $1 trillion companies
summary: Visa and Mastercard are rapidly increasing in market value, with stocks up roughly 50% in the past year, leading some to believe they could be the next $1 trillion companies by 2023. Their growth is driven by the global shift towards cashless financial transactions and online shopping, with both companies holding significant shares of the credit and debit card market. Despite potential risks from increased competition and regulation, both firms are actively seeking acquisitions to boost their financial technology integration.

title: IBM’s Arvind Krishna latest among Indians heading global companies
summary: IBM appointed Arvind Krishna as its new CEO, adding him to a growing list of Indian-origin executives leading major global corporations. The article highlights several prominent Indian-origin CEOs, including Sundararajan Pichai of Google, Satya Nadella of Microsoft, Shantanu Narayen of Adobe, and Ajaypal Singh Banga of MasterCard, detailing their backgrounds and career achievements. Krishna's appointment underscores the significant influence of Indian-origin talent in the global business landscape.

title: Which tech stock is best? Here’s how the ‘big five’ companies stack up as they report earnings
summary: This article examines how the "big five" U.S. tech companies are positioned as they prepare to report their quarterly earnings. It highlights Amazon as the favorite among analysts, while Apple is deemed the "cheapest" despite its recent stock performance. The article sets out to compare some of their key numbers ahead of Apple kicking off the earnings season.

title: The five biggest tech companies now make up 17.5% of the S&P 500 — here's how to protect yourself
summary: The five largest tech companies (Apple, Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, and Facebook) now comprise 17.5% of the S&P 500, leading to potential overexposure for passive investors. Financial advisors are suggesting strategies like equal-weighted funds, specialized tech ETFs focusing on emerging areas, and ESG investments to diversify portfolios. While Big Tech's dominance has driven strong returns, advisors emphasize balancing diversification with access to growth, cautioning against timing the market with large active bets.

title: Top 16 best datacenter service providers in India
summary: This article lists the top 16 data center service providers in India, highlighting the booming demand for data center infrastructure driven by increasing internet users and cloud adoption. It details each company's offerings, locations, and key features to assist businesses in choosing a suitable provider. The list includes both global and local players, detailing their services and infrastructure.

title: Quantum Computing Under Hype Cycle and Market Clock Scrutiny
summary: This article discusses quantum computing's position within Gartner's Hype Cycle and Market Clock theories, examining how new technologies often face unrealistic expectations. It explores the differing views on quantum computing's potential, from its current limitations as highlighted by industry experts to the optimistic long-term visions of advocates like Mikhail Lukin. The piece also touches on investment trends and the ethical implications of technological advancement.

title: Johnson & Johnson to disclose robot-assisted surgery plans in May
summary: Johnson & Johnson announced it will preview its robotic and digital surgery plans at a Medical Device Business Review Day on May 13 in New York. This comes after recent acquisitions of Auris Health and the remaining stake in Verb Surgical, positioning J&J to compete with market leader Intuitive Surgical in the rapidly growing robot-assisted surgery space. CEO Alex Gorsky emphasized that the event will provide clear, tangible evidence of their machines and digital platform.

title: Johnson & Johnson planning a robotic surgery reveal in May
summary: Johnson & Johnson is set to provide a preview of its robotic and digital surgery plans at a Medical Device Business Review Day on May 13 in New York City. CEO Alex Gorsky emphasized the event will offer clear evidence of their machines and digital platform. This move positions J&J to compete in the growing robotic-assisted surgery market, challenging dominant player Intuitive Surgical with recent acquisitions like Verb Surgical and Auris Health.

title: Google wades deeper into Expedia’s territory with new travel and cloud pact with Sabre
summary: Google is expanding its presence in the travel industry through a new 10-year strategic alliance with travel technology giant Sabre Corp. This partnership involves Sabre migrating its IT infrastructure to Google Cloud and co-creating future travel solutions, intensifying Google's rivalry with Expedia. The deal highlights Google's growing ambition in the travel market, potentially leading to increased antitrust scrutiny given Google's dominance in search and advertising that online travel companies rely on.

title: Capitalism 'will fundamentally be in jeopardy' if business does not act on climate change, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says
summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella asserts that capitalism is in jeopardy if businesses fail to address climate change, emphasizing that corporations must find profitable solutions to planetary problems. Microsoft has committed to being carbon negative by 2030, investing $1 billion in carbon-removal technology, and CFO Amy Hood views these initiatives as "good return investments." This stance aligns with a growing trend of companies and investors prioritizing sustainability alongside financial performance.

title: Grindr, Tinder and OkCupid apps share personal data, group finds
authors: Natalia Drozdiak and Nate Lanxon Bloomberg
summary: A Norwegian consumer group reported that dating apps like Grindr, Tinder, and OkCupid are sharing detailed personal data, including location, age, gender, and sexual orientation, with thousands of advertising partners. This practice raises significant concerns about compliance with European data protection regulations (GDPR) and California's new privacy law (CCPA). Complaints have been filed against Grindr and several ad-tech companies, highlighting the potential for severe privacy violations and the need for stricter enforcement of data protection laws.

title: Investing in Quantum Computing - The Quantum Daily Guide
summary: This article discusses the challenges of investing directly in quantum computing given its nascent stage of development. It highlights that most companies are private and that publicly listed companies offer limited, indirect exposure. The article also touches upon ETFs as a diversification option but emphasizes that targeted pure-play investments are difficult to achieve currently.

title: The Mighty Apple, Google, Tesla, Dell and Microsoft in “the dock” - A Look At the Child Labour Lawsuit
summary: A landmark class-action lawsuit has been filed against Apple, Google, Tesla, Dell, and Microsoft, alleging their complicity in child labor practices within the cobalt mines of the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). The International Rights Advocates (IRA) are seeking injunctive relief and damages on behalf of child victims, arguing that these tech giants knowingly benefit from and aid in the exploitation of young children. The lawsuit highlights the horrific conditions faced by child miners and seeks comprehensive relief, including medical care, monitoring, and environmental cleanup, while asserting U.S. jurisdictional basis given the companies' operations and alleged willful ignorance.

title: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos to Face Protests From ‘Enraged’ Local Merchants During India Visit
summary: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos is expected to encounter significant protests from local merchants during his visit to India. These merchants, organized under the Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT), plan sit-ins and rallies across 300 cities to protest Amazon's pricing and exclusive selling practices, which they argue harm small businesses. The protests coincide with Bezos's participation in Amazon India’s "smbhav" event, highlighting growing resentment against the company's business model in a critical market.

title: Pitney Bowes Announces SendPro C Auto - Latest Evolution of Award-Winning Sending Technology
